column1: MIAMI --   Saddled with a five - game losing streak
column2: the Miami Marlins were in the market for an early lead Wednesday
column3: and Giancarlo Stanton gave them one . 	 The Marlins slugger hit a two - run double in the first inning to end a 10 - game RBI drought and help beat the Atlanta Braves 6 - 2 . 	 Stanton had been in a 3 - for-26 slump before he gave the Marlins the lead in their four - run first against Paul Maholm . 	 " It put us on top
column4: and we stayed on top the whole game
column5: " Stanton said . " It was a good jump start . " 	 Stanton was also pleased that he walked in his next three at - bats
column6: laying off tempting pitches that he had been flailing at of late . 	 " They threw some good pitches at me
column8: " he said . " So it was a good day . " 	 Placido Polanco added three hits and three RBIs . Jacob Turner ( 3 - 1 ) allowed four hits and two runs in seven innings
column9: and Steve Cishek allowed two singles in the ninth to complete a six - hitter . 	 The Braves won two of three games in the series but missed a chance for their first road sweep since April 12 - 14 at Washington . 	 " It was a tough day
column10: " said Maholm ( 9 - 8) . " Obviously we would have liked to have gotten the sweep
column11: but we won the series . " 	 Miami improved to 3 - 12 against the Braves at Marlins Park since it opened in 2012 . 	 With thousands of youngsters in the stands on camp day
column13: 921 -- the Marlins ' largest home crowd since April 27 . Miami is last in the major leagues in attendance . 	 Atlanta came into the game with a 1.87 ERA this season against the Marlins
column14: but Miami batted around in the first inning . 	 " We needed that
column15: " manager Mike Redmond said . " We needed to jump out to a quick start and settle everyone down
column16: especially Jacob
column17: and gives ourselves a little room to breathe . " 	 Stanton showed the impact his bat can make with a line drive that reached the wall on one hop for a 2 - 0 lead . 	 " That ball was a laser beam
column18: and he had great at - bats after that . That 's a great sign
column19: " Redmond said . " He 's such a big presence in that lineup . You can see how in situations they start pitching around him
column20: but when he stays in the zone and handles the pitches he knows he 's capable of handling
column21: he can dominate a game . " 	 Last year 's NL slugging leader has had a subpar first half of the season
column22: in part because he missed 36 games with a strained right hamstring . He 's batting only .246 with eight homers and 24 RBIs
column23: and the Marlins have the NL 's worst record . 	 Stanton has tried to temper his frustration . 	 " I 'm kind of taking a little different approach
column25: I would just get furious
column26: but then I feel like I 'm a bad teammate
column27: and I do n't want to have that influence . You can get mad every once in a while
column28: with how much of a failure sport this is
column29: but it 's how you handle it . Get mad for a few minutes
column30: and then leave it . " 	 Stanton 's double came on a changeup . He scored on a double by Polanco
column31: and Jeff Mathis added a two - out RBI single . 	 " Obviously in the first inning I was n't in rhythm
column32: " Maholm said . " But Stanton is the only one that hit the ball hard
column33: and it was n't even supposed to be a strike . " 	 Maholm gave up no runs after the first but lasted only 4 1/3 innings
column34: throwing 103 pitches . Three times this year he has failed to pitch five innings . 	 Poor base - running hurt Atlanta in the second inning . Dan Uggla doubled home a run
column35: then was thrown out trying to go from second to third when a pitch rolled away from catcher Mathis . B.J. Upton reached first on the play because the pitch was strike three
column36: but he was promptly picked off by Turner . 	 Freddie Freeman
column37: contending for the final spot on the NL All - Star team
column38: doubled in the sixth and scored on Chris Johnson 's groundout to make the score 4 - 2 . But that 's all the Braves could muster against Turner
column39: who improved to 4 - 0 in his past six home starts with an ERA of 1.41 . 	 Game notes 	  Before the game
column40: Braves C Evan Gattis ( strained right oblique ) took batting practice for the first time since going on the disabled list June 18 . ... Umpire Dan Iassogna began wearing a cast this week on his right forearm after an X - ray revealed a broken wrist . He was hurt working behind the plate at a game June 29
column41: but the severity of the injury was n't determined until after Monday 's Marlins - Braves game
column42: when he was again the plate umpire and he was throwing balls underhand to the pitcher because of the pain . ... The Marlins ' Adeiny Hechavarria singled in the fifth to extend his hitting streak to 10 games

column1: MILWAUKEE -- With the Cincinnati Reds reeling
column2: Mike Leake knew he had to pitch a strong game . 	 After a shaky start
column3: the right - hander delivered for his team . 	 Leake scattered four hits over 8 1/3 innings and Brandon Phillips had three RBIs
column4: lifting the Reds to a 6 - 2 win over the Milwaukee Brewers on Wednesday . 	 Cincinnati put the leadoff runner on base in each of the first seven innings . The Reds snapped a three - game losing streak that had dropped them five games behind St. Louis in the NL Central . 	 " It would have been a graveyard in here if we did n't pull this one out
column5: " Leake said . 	 Leake ( 8 - 4 ) bounced back from a rare rough start in his last outing and seemed to get stronger as the game progressed . He allowed four walks while striking out two . 	 " It was n't the best game I 've pitched
column6: " he said . " They made me work and they were aggressive towards me . That was one thing that worked to my advantage . I made some pitches when I needed to
column7: to get out of jams . They put some pressure on me . " 	 Milwaukee starter Johnny Hellweg ( 0 - 3 ) had trouble throwing strikes
column8: was battered for his fourth consecutive appearance and sent back to the minor leagues after the game . The right - hander
column9: who made his major - league debut on June 28
column10: allowed four runs on four hits and five walks in 4 1/3 innings in his third start . 	 " I think there 's improvement there from the other two starts
column11: but still some things he needs to work on
column12: " Milwaukee manager Ron Roenicke said . 	 Leake allowed four runs in just five innings during his last start July 5 in a 7 - 4 loss to Seattle
column13: and gave up a first - inning run to Milwaukee . 	 " I did n't think he was going to make it
column14: because they were hitting the ball hard off him
column15: " Reds manager Dusty Baker said . 	 He then settled down
column16: giving up Sean Halton 's first major - league home run and a walk to Jeff Bianchi in the fifth . 	 " I thought I had a hundred pitches because I had walked four guys
column17: " Leake said . 	 Leake then retired the next 13 batters . 	 " I just kind of attacked them and mixed it up a little bit more
column18: " he said . 	 Jonathan Lucroy reached on a one - out single in the ninth against Leake
column19: and Baker turned to closer Aroldis Chapman to finish the game in a non - save situation . 	 Shin - Soo Choo had two singles
column20: a double and a walk . Phillips had two hits and drove in runs in the first
column21: third and seventh innings . 	 Jay Bruce went 2 - for-4 with a walk
column22: driving in a run in the fifth and seventh innings . 	 The Reds could have scored more runs
column23: but were 3 - for-14 with runners in scoring position . 	 " We have to cash in on a couple of those opportunities
column24: " Baker said . " I know it sounds greedy right now
column25: but we want all the runs we can get . You try not to keep them in the game . " 	 Acquired in the 2012 trade that sent Zack Greinke to the Los Angeles Angels
column26: Hellweg has struggled in three starts and one relief appearance . In 10 2/3 innings
column27: he has given up 20 runs on 19 hits and 12 walks while striking out three batters . 	 He was optioned to Class A Wisconsin in the Midwest League after the game to keep him pitching every fifth day
column28: Roenicke said . Other Brewers affiliates have off days that would have gotten Hellweg off schedule
column29: Roenicke said . 	 The Reds made it 1 - 0 in the first on Choo 's leadoff double and a two - out single by Phillips . 	 Milwaukee tied it in the bottom of the inning on a sacrifice fly by Carlos Gomez . 	 Cincinnati got a sacrifice fly from Devin Mesoraco in the second and added another run in the third when Zack Cozart scored from third on Phillips ' groundout . Cozart scored again to make it 4 - 1 in the fifth on a groundout by Bruce . 	 Halton 's made it 4 - 2 in the bottom of the fifth . 	 Cincinnati scored twice in the seventh off Hand to make it 6 - 2 on RBI singles from Phillips and Bruce . 	 Game notes 	 Brewers OFs Ryan Braun ( sore left thumb ) and Norichika Aoki ( left elbow tightness ) were out of the lineup . They are expected to start Thursday at Arizona . ... Reds LHP Sean Marshall
column30: on the DL with shoulder soreness
column31: threw a 42 - pitch bullpen session Tuesday and said he felt no soreness on Wednesday . He said there is no timetable to begin a minor - league rehab assignment . ... Reds OF Chris Heisey was wearing a compression sleeve on his left arm Wednesday after being hit by a fastball from RHP Wily Peralta on Tuesday night . He was out of the Reds lineup . column1: SAN FRANCISCO -- Zack Wheeler used to have long talks with Sergio Romo when they were teammates in the Giants organization
column2: and the young pitcher is good pals with Mike Kickham . 	 None of that mattered when Wheeler took the mound at AT&T Park for the first time . He just wanted to pitch well . 	 Wheeler threw seven sharp innings
column3: Marlon Byrd homered again and the New York Mets completed their first sweep in San Francisco since 1994 with a 7 - 2 win Wednesday . 	 " I was drafted by the Giants and obviously wanted to pitch here
column4: " Wheeler said . " I did n't know how I was going to feel when I got out there . Honestly
column5: I was relaxed . " 	 Daniel Murphy and John Buck each had two hits and drove in two runs as the Mets won their fourth in a row
column6: including three straight over the slumping World Series champions . The Giants have lost 16 of 19 . 	 Wheeler ( 3 - 1 )
column7: selected by the Giants with the sixth overall pick in the 2009 amateur draft
column8: took a shutout into the seventh . He allowed one run and three hits
column9: struck out five and walked three . 	 " That 's the best all - around stuff I 've seen
column10: " Mets manager Terry Collins said . " He pounded the strike zone and got outs . He has a chance to be very good . " 	 San Francisco dealt Wheeler to the Mets in July 2011 for outfielder Carlos Beltran . The trip to San Francisco brought back memories from his time with the Giants . 	 " Romo and me would talk all the time
column11: " Wheeler said . " He 'd sit me down and talk me through things . It was fun to be able to watch him pitch the first night . " 	 Matt Cain ( 5 - 6 ) lasted less than an inning for the first time in his career
column12: giving up three runs and two hits while walking three and getting just two outs . He is 0 - 3 with a 6.38 ERA in his last five starts . 	 " We needed a chance to win it
column13: and I was n't giving them an opportunity right there
column14: " Cain said . " I was walking guys . They got a couple of hits they needed
column15: and that was it . " 	 San Francisco dropped to 40 - 50
column16: its first time 10 games under .500 since the Giants finished 72 - 90 in 2008
column17: according to STATS . San Francisco was swept at home for the first time since July 27 - 29 last year against the Los Angeles Dodgers . 	 Wheeler retired 14 of his first 16 hitters before Pablo Sandoval singled for the Giants ' first hit with two outs in the fourth . Wheeler also hit an RBI double . 	 " He was a lot more efficient getting ahead
column18: " Buck said . " He just needed to get his feet wet and feel a little more comfortable
column19: but he 's also working hard in things . " 	 Cain 's home ERA rose to 5.94
column20: the second - highest among qualifying NL pitchers and more than double his 2.03 ERA in San Francisco last year . 	 " He was disappointed to come out
column21: but I had to make the call
column22: " Giants manager Bruce Bochy said . " He 's fine
column23: but I did n't want it to become an issue . He was going on 40 pitches there and I did n't want to push him through again . " 	 New York took a 3 - 0 lead in the first . Eric Young walked
column24: stole second went to third on catcher Buster Posey 's throwing error and scored on Murphy 's single . Ike Davis and Kirk Nieuwenhuis walked
column25: and Buck ended Cain 's day with a two - run single . 	 Kickham retired 12 of his first 14 hitters into the fifth . That stretch ended when Davis singled and Byrd followed with his 15th homer and second in two days . 	 Wheeler and Murphy each doubled home a run in the sixth to make it 7 - 0 . 	 Brandon Crawford singled home a run in the Giants ' eighth
column26: and Tony Abreu hit a sacrifice fly in the ninth . 	 Game notes 	 Giants RHP Santiago Casilla could be activated Thursday . ... LHP Madison Bumgarner ( 9 - 5

column1: PITTSBURGH -- Francisco Liriano does n't like to think about what might have been . At the moment
column2: the present is so sweet there 's no use focusing on the past . 	 The veteran left - hander 's renaissance hit a new high in Pittsburgh 's 5 - 0 win over the Oakland Athletics on Wednesday night . 	 Liriano ( 9 - 3 ) scattered four hits over seven innings
column3: striking out six and walking one to lower his ERA to a scant 2.00 as the Pirates snapped a four - game losing streak . The victory capped a remarkable first half for the former All - Star whose career has n't been the same since reconstructive elbow surgery six years ago . At last
column5: at age 29 he is all the way back . 	 Not that he wants to talk about it . 	 " I do n't think about ' 06 at all
column6: " Liriano said . " I just try to learn how to pitch
column7: how to move on . " 	 That includes trying to stay focused during a lengthy rain delay of nearly three hours . When Liriano finally took the mound at soggy PNC Park just before 10 p.m.
column8: he did n't waste time . Attacking the strike zone relentlessly
column9: Liriano kept the AL West - leading A 's off - balance all night . 	 " He set the tone
column11: " Pittsburgh manager Clint Hurdle said . " He was just on top of his game . " 	 And the Pirates did n't let it go to waste . 	 Pedro Alvarez went 2 for 4 and drove in two runs for Pittsburgh . Andrew McCutchen
column12: Starling Marte and Jose Tabata also had two hits each as the Pirates beat Oakland for the first time . 	 Pittsburgh came in 0 - 11 against the A 's since interleague play began in 1997
column13: but broke loose against Tommy Milone ( 8 - 8) . The Pirates managed just six runs total during a four - game slide that dropped them behind St. Louis in the battle for first in the NL Central but nearly matched that total on a night they went 5 for 9 with runners in scoring position
column14: heady territory for a team that came in hitting just .226 with runners on second or third this season . 	 " I think we did a pretty good job of consistently pressing them and attacking them
column15: " Alvarez said . 	 A little help is all baseball 's top pitching staff needs these days . Pittsburgh 's 13th shutout lowered its team ERA to 3.09
column16: easily the best in baseball . Liriano 's performance marked the 24th time in 25 games a starter has allowed three earned runs or fewer . 	 " I 'm just trying to learn how to go out there every fifth day and make pitches
column17: " Liriano said . 	 He made enough to cool off the surging A 's . Oakland had won 10 of 13 to vault over Texas and into the lead in the AL West but Milone struggled with his command . 	 The left - hander was coming off a season - high 8 1/3 innings of work in a win over Kansas City last week . He did n't make it out of the third inning as Pittsburgh 's offense showed signs of life . 	 Marte doubled leading off the third
column18: and Tabata followed with an RBI double . McCutchen drove Tabata home with a single
column19: and Alvarez followed two batters later with a single to center that scored McCutchen . 	 That was enough for Milone
column20: who needed 80 pitches to get through 2 2/3 innings . 	 " They were doing a good job of putting the ball in play and falling
column21: " Milone said . " And even though they were n't hit very hard
column22: you always give yourself a chance when you put the ball in play and that 's what they were doing . " 	 He was replaced by Pat Neshek
column23: who made his first appearance since June 29 . The rust showed . Pittsburgh tacked on two more runs in the fourth to give Liriano all the cushion he would need to cap a remarkable first half for one of baseball 's best comeback stories . 	 " I like the way I 've been pitching and the way we 've all been playing
column25: we 're in good position to make the playoffs and we want to continue playing like that in the second half and hopefully make the postseason . " 	 Game notes 	 Former Oakland first - round draft pick Sonny Gray made his major league debut in the fifth inning . The right - handed pitcher

column1: BALTIMORE -- While Wei - Yin Chen languished on the disabled list for two months
column2: despondent about his hiatus from the big leagues
column3: the Baltimore Orioles struggled to fill out an inconsistent rotation . 	 Chen made his long - awaited return Wednesday night
column4: and after he threw seven innings of three - hit ball in a 6 - 1 win over the Texas Rangers
column5: it was hard to determine who felt the happiest : the Taiwanese left - hander
column6: the other 24 players in the clubhouse or manager Buck Showalter . 	 " Winning the ballgame is real huge to me
column7: " Chen said through an interpreter . " I proved myself tonight . I 'm healthy
column8: and I 'm back . I feel like I helped the team to win . Everything is for the Orioles . " 	 Chen ( 4 - 3 ) had not pitched since May 12 because of a strained right oblique . The left - hander allowed one run
column9: walked three and struck out four . 	 " I know he 's been anxious to get back with the club and make a contribution
column10: " Showalter said . " It 's been a tough
column11: tough road for him . " 	 And for the Orioles
column12: who went through a variety of pitchers during his absence in an effort to fill out the rotation . 	 " Missed him
column13: " Showalter said . " Glad to have him back . " 	 So were his teammates
column14: who built a 6 - 0 lead in the fourth inning and coasted to the finish . 	 " He 's proven to be a guy who can get late in the games
column15: and that 's huge for us
column16: " second baseman Brian Roberts said . " That 's huge for every rotation
column17: but I think it sets a really good tone for everybody else . For him to come back after being out two months
column18: against that kind of lineup
column19: is very impressive . " 	 Adrian Beltre extended his hitting streak to 12 games and drove in a run for the Rangers
column20: whose four - game road winning streak ended . Texas had scored at least five runs in six consecutive games
column21: but Chen put an end to that streak . 	 " You 've got to give him credit
column22: " Rangers manager Ron Washington said . " He may not have pitched in a while
column23: but he certainly did n't look like it out there tonight . " 	 Nolan Reimold hit a three - run homer and Manny Machado had three hits and an RBI for the Orioles
column24: who won for only the third time in nine games . Baltimore will seek a split of the four - game series on Thursday night . 	 Major league home run leader Chris Davis went 0 for 3 with a walk and is hitless in his last 17 at - bats . He has n't gotten a hit since Major League Baseball announced he was the leading vote - getter in All - Star fan balloting . 	 Reimold was a late replacement at designated hitter for Chris Dickerson
column25: who was scratched with a strained left shoulder . Batting ninth in the order
column26: Reimold delivered his first home run since May 4 to put Baltimore up 6 - 0 in the fourth inning against Josh Lindblom ( 1 - 3 ) . 	 Reimold was on the disabled list from May 12 to July 1 and was playing in only his 37th game of the season . 	 " It felt good that I was able to come through
column27: " he said . " Something to build on . " 	 Lindblom gave up six runs
column28: nine hits and four walks in 5 1/3 innings . The right - hander started for Nick Tepesch
column29: who went on the disabled list Sunday . 	 " I compete
column30: and really I think that 's all you try and do as a starter
column31: " said Lindblom
column32: who has split time between the rotation and bullpen . " You go out and give your team a chance to win . " 	 Texas right - hander Yu Darvish joined Tepesch on the disabled list Wednesday with a strained upper back . Darvish was scheduled to start Thursday night ; he will be replaced by Ross Wolf . 	 The Orioles used a four - run fourth to take a 6 - 0 lead . Lindblom walked the first two batters before Roberts hit a liner to center that bounced out of the glove of Engel Beltre and off the wall . It went for an RBI single
column33: and Reimold followed with a towering fly ball that carried into the left - field seats
column34: a few feet inside the foul pole . 	 Texas got its lone run in the sixth when Ian Kinsler walked
column35: took third on a single by Nelson Cruz and scored when Adrian Beltre hit into a fielder 's choice . 	 Chen used 21 pitches in a 1 - 2 - 3 first inning
column36: and Lindblom needed 31 to get through a bottom half in which the Orioles got two singles . 	 Baltimore went up 2 - 0 in the third . After Nate McLouth beat out an infield roller and Machado tripled to center
column37: a wild pitch allowed Machado to score . 	 Chen retired 11 of the first 12 batters he faced
column38: allowing only a walk until Beltre singled with two outs in the fourth . 	 Just like old times . 	 " For the last year and a half he was a consistent force for our rotation
column39: " catcher Matt Wieters said . " You know he 's going to go out there and give you everything he has and compete . " 	 Game notes 	 Machado leads the majors with 14 three - hit games . He is tied for the lead with 36 multihit games . ... Miguel Gonzalez ( 6 - 3 ) will take the mound for Baltimore in the series finale . ... In addition to activating Chen from the DL

column41: who usually plays the infield

column1: CLEVELAND -- Munenori Kawasaki delivered the hit that Toronto had been waiting for . 	 His bases loaded two - run single in the ninth inning sparked a three - run rally and the Blue Jays hung on for a 5 - 4 win Tuesday night . 	 Kawasaki
column3: lined a 1 - 2 pitch from Joe Smith into left - center field to score two runs and break a 3 - all tie . A third run scored when center fielder Michael Bourn booted the ball for an error . 	 The Blue Jays nearly gave it away in the bottom of the inning . Closer Casey Janssen
column4: who had converted 17 - of-18 save chances
column5: gave up Asdrubal Cabrera 's RBI single that cut the lead to two . Kawasaki 's throwing error made it a one - run game but Steve Delabar retired Michael Brantley on a fly ball for his first career save . 	 " Great ballgame
column7: " Toronto manager John Gibbons said . " The guys battle
column8: like they always do . " 	 Colby Rasmus drew a one - out walk off Rich Hill ( 0 - 1 ) . After Maicer Izturis flied out
column9: J.P. Arencibia was announced to bat for Josh Thole . Smith relieved Hill but Arencibia singled and Emilio Bonifacio walked to load the bases . Kawasaki fell behind in the count but came up with the clutch hit Toronto 's struggling offense has needed . 	 " They were able to make the chance for the RBI opportunity
column10: " Kawasaki said through a translator . " I just tried to connect . " 	 Neil Wagner ( 2 - 3 ) struck out Ryan Raburn with the bases loaded to end the eighth after the Indians tied the game . Casey Janssen
column11: who had recorded 17 - of-18 save opportunities
column12: allowed two runs in the ninth before Steve Delabar retired Michael Brantley on a fly ball for his first major league save . 	 Indians starter Justin Masterson took a two - hit shutout into the seventh but Bonifacio 's two - run single put the Blue Jays ahead . 	 The Indians tied the game in the eighth off All - Star reliever Brett Cecil on Brantley 's RBI single . Asdrubal Cabrera 's two - out single and Kawasaki 's throwing error in the ninth cut the lead to 5 - 4 but Delabar recorded the final out . 	 " We took the lead and they came back and of course it got a little hairy there at the end
column14: pitching for the fourth straight day
column15: could n't get the one out the Indians needed . 	 " Smitty had faced Arencibia four times and struck him out four times
column16: " Cleveland manager Terry Francona said . " That 's the matchup we wanted . With Kawasaki
column17: he just left the ball over the plate and Bourny mishandled it for the unearned run . " 	 The Blue Jays
column18: who had been blanked in two of their last three games
column19: struggled against Masterson . Toronto finally broke through thanks to two hits and a pair of walks . 	 Toronto starter Esmil Rogers allowed one run in six innings . 	 Adam Lind doubled with one out in the seventh and moved to third on a groundout . Izturis walked on four pitches before Thole walked on a 3 - 2 pitch to load the bases . Bonifacio
column20: who struck out with a runner on third to end the fifth
column21: lined a 2 - 1 pitch into right field to score Lind and Izturis
column22: giving Toronto the lead . 	 The clutch hit came on Masterson 's 120th and final pitch of the night . The right - hander
column23: a member of the American League All - Star team
column25: struck out six and walked five . 	 The Blue Jays were shut out by four pitchers in Monday 's 3 - 0 loss to Cleveland . 	 Giambi 's RBI single gave Cleveland the lead in the second . 	 Cleveland traded Rogers
column26: who was making his eighth start of the season
column27: to Toronto for infielder Mike Aviles and catcher Yan Gomes in November . Rogers struck out seven and held Cleveland to four hits . 	 Masterson did n't allow a hit until Rasmus led off the fifth with a double . Masterson was coming off his shortest start of the season when he allowed six runs in 4 2/3 innings in a 7 - 0 loss to Detroit on Friday . He threw a six - hit shutout in his start before against the Chicago White Sox . 	 Cabrera broke an 0 - for-20 slump with a single in the first . Indians reliever Preston Guilmet made his major - leage debut in the seventh and retired both batters he faced . 	 Game notes 	 RHP Danny Salazar will be called up from Triple - A Columbus to make his major league debut Thursday against Toronto . " It was a shock when they told me . I did n't know what to say
column28: " said Salazar
column29: who began the season at Double - A Akron . Francona expects Salazar to have the normal pre - game jitters all pitchers experience before their first start . " If he has any brains at all
column30: he probably wo n't sleep a wink and he 'll tell everybody tomorrow he did
column31: " Francona said . ... The Blue Jays are considering moving Brett Lawrie ( sprained left ankle ) from third base to second base when he comes off the 15 - day disabled list . column1: NEW YORK -- Once the New York Yankees finally broke through with the bats
column2: they turned it into an easy night for Ivan Nova . 	 Robinson Cano hit a three - run homer
column3: Lyle Overbay added a grand slam and New York snapped out of its offensive funk with an 8 - 1 victory over the Kansas City Royals on Wednesday . 	 " We needed that really bad
column4: " Cano said . 	 Nova delivered another impressive pitching performance and the Yankees
column5: held to one run each of the previous three days
column6: stopped a three - game slide . 	 But it was n't all good news . Depleted by injuries all season
column7: New York had two more players get banged up in slumping Travis Hafner and speedy Brett Gardner . 	 Hafner came out of the game with a bruised left foot
column8: while Gardner departed with a bruised right leg after getting hit by a pitch for the second time . The team said X - rays on both were negative and they were day to day . 	 Hafner got hurt while swinging in the indoor cage during the middle innings . He cranked the pitching machine up near 100 mph and fouled one off his foot . 	 " Just kind of a freak incident
column10: adding he thinks he should be all right . " That 's a first . " 	 Said manager Joe Girardi : " I do n't get summoned to the cage very often . " 	 Gardner also walked twice and scored two runs . He reached base all four times from the leadoff spot . 	 Nova ( 4 - 2 ) yielded only four singles and a double in eight innings for his second win in three solid starts since returning from the minors . He struck out six and walked two . 	 " He has that kind of stuff that he can be one of the best in the game
column11: " Cano said . 	 The right - hander was coming off his first career complete game
column12: a three - hitter against Baltimore last Friday that included 11 strikeouts . 	 " Same thing . Pretty good downhill with his fastball
column13: really good curveball and mixed in a few changeups . I mean
column14: that 's kind of the formula for him . When his fastball 's like this
column15: he 's going to get a lot of outs
column16: " Girardi said . " It should help his confidence . ... He 's back on track . " 	 Cano and Overbay both connected off Wade Davis ( 4 - 8)
column17: who dropped his third consecutive start . 	 " I fell behind when I was in the stretch with runners on . I left bad pitches up in the zone
column18: " Davis said . 	 With the Yankees still waiting for injured stars Derek Jeter
column19: Curtis Granderson and Alex Rodriguez to return
column20: Girardi said he was n't particularly tempted to shuffle his makeshift lineup in an attempt to spark the offense . 	 " What would you suggest ? " he asked a reporter before the game . " This is what it is . " 	 No changes necessary on this night . 	 Gardner drew a leadoff walk in the first and scored on a wild pitch . With two outs in the third
column21: Cano stayed back on a 1 - 1 breaking ball and drove it just over the left - center fence . It was the 21st homer of the season for Cano
column22: the American League captain for the Home Run Derby next Monday night across town at Citi Field . 	 Cano singled to start the sixth and New York loaded the bases with none out for Overbay . He lofted a full - count pitch a few rows deep to the opposite field in left for his fourth career slam and first since May 10
column24: with Toronto . 	 " The little things set us up for those big hits
column25: " Overbay said . " I 'm just glad I put a swing on it and put it in the outfield for ( at least ) a sac fly . I ca n't remember how many times I 've struck out with the bases loaded . " 	 Davis crouched in disappointment next to the mound and was pulled from the game . He allowed eight runs
column26: matching a career high
column27: and six hits in his second ineffective start this season against the Yankees . They tagged him for seven runs and seven hits May 10 during a three - game sweep in Kansas City . 	 " Wade threw fine . The numbers do n't always tell the story
column28: " Royals manager Ned Yost said . 	 Meanwhile
column29: Nova was cruising thanks to a 93 - 95 mph fastball and sharp curve . Helped by Luis Cruz 's diving grab at third base
column30: he retired 12 straight before loading the bases with two outs in the fifth . After a visit from pitching coach Larry Rothschild
column31: the right - hander set down Alcides Escobar on a shallow fly . 	 Cano doubled off the very top of the right - center wall in the seventh
column32: but was thrown out by Lorenzo Cain trying to stretch it into a triple . 	 Cano also had some fun with double - play partner Eduardo Nunez on a second - inning popup that was caught by the shortstop on Cano 's side of second base . column1: PHILADELPHIA -- Gio Gonzalez is now getting results to match his fine performances . 	 Gonzalez tossed seven sharp innings
column2: the Nationals hit a pair of consecutive homers off Cliff Lee and Washington beat the Philadelphia Phillies 5 - 1 Wednesday night . column3: striking out five to win his fourth straight start . The lefty has eight quality starts in a row . 	 " I got in a couple jams against a good - hitting team
column4: but the defense came through with some double plays
column5: " Gonzalez said . 	 Before his winning streak began on June 25
column6: Gonzalez had been winless in eight previous starts despite posting a 2.18 ERA in that span . 	 He has n't changed anything . Only now
column7: the W 's are piling up like last year when Gonzalez was 21 - 8 . 	 " I have the same focus and trying to attack the strike zone
column8: " he said . 	 Lee ( 10 - 3 ) had allowed nine homers in his first 135 2/3 innings this year before yielding four in a span of eight batters . 	 " All four I felt were good pitches
column9: " Lee said . " When it 's hot here
column10: the ball carries . I got to do a better job inducing ground balls . " 	 Darin Ruf hit a solo shot for the Phillies
column11: who failed to reach .500 for the first time since June 7 . 	 Lee allowed four runs and nine hits in seven innings . column12: " Ramos said . " He throws strikes so you do n't have to wait for one pitch to hit . " 	 Lee threw just 76 pitches
column13: 64 of which were strikes . 	 " Sometimes when he 's like that
column15: " Phillies manager Charlie Manuel said . " His stuff was good . They got four balls airborne and they went out of the yard . " 	 The defending NL East champion Nationals
column16: who moved within five games of first - place Atlanta
column17: lost the first two of this four - game set against Philadelphia . The Phillies are 2 behind Washington . 	 Rendon lined an 0 - 2 pitch to left to give the Nationals a 1 - 0 lead in the fifth . Ramos followed with an opposite - field shot to right . 	 Zimmerman connected on an 0 - 2 pitch in the sixth
column18: hitting a towering drive to left - center . Werth followed with a shot to left . 	 " This park should make you more aggressive
column19: " Nats manager Davey Johnson said . " Lee likes to throw the cutter . We were ready for it . " 	 Ruf hit an opposite - field drive to right with two outs in the seventh for his first with the Phillies this season . Ruf had 38 homers at Double - A Reading last year and three more in a brief stint in Philadelphia . 	 Game notes 	 The Nationals have hit back - to - back homers six times this season . ... Zimmerman was 4 for 23 with seven strikeouts against Lee before going deep . ... Washington is 42 - 10 when scoring more than three runs . ... Lee has allowed more than three runs in consecutive starts after doing it twice in his first 17 starts . ... The Phillies had won 10 of their previous 14 against the division . column1: DETROIT -- Joaquin Benoit is enjoying a little extra attention these days . 	 That 's taken some getting used to for Detroit 's setup man - turned - closer . 	 The Tigers are promoting Benoit 's campaign to win the final vote for the American League All - Star team
column2: and on a night when orange " Vote BENOIT " shirts were all over Comerica Park
column3: the veteran right - hander closed out Detroit 's 8 - 5 victory over the Chicago White Sox . 	 " A little bit shaky -- I guess too excited for everything that 's going on with the fan votes
column4: " Benoit said . " If I do n't get there
column5: I 'm really just happy because everybody 's voting for me . " 	 Benoit walked two in the ninth
column6: but was able to finish the game . Prince Fielder and Miguel Cabrera -- who are already on the All - Star team -- had three hits apiece for the Tigers on Wednesday night
column7: including a two - run homer by Fielder . 	 Detroit allowed 23 hits in an 11 - 4 loss to the White Sox on Tuesday
column8: but it was the Tigers who did the slugging early on in this game . Fielder lined his two - run shot to right field in the first inning for his 16th homer of the year . 	 Alex Avila 's two - run single in the third put Detroit ahead 5 - 1 . 	 Conor Gillaspie and Gordon Beckham homered for Chicago . 	 Detroit 's Rick Porcello ( 6 - 6 ) allowed three runs and seven hits in six innings . 	 The Tigers ' bullpen has been shaky all season
column9: but Benoit has been used more as a closer lately . He 's now 8 - for-8 in save chances
column10: and he lowered his ERA to 1.69 . 	 He 's part of a group of five relievers up for a final vote for the AL All - Star team . The others are Toronto 's Steve Delabar
column11: the New York Yankees ' David Robertson
column13: and Boston 's Koji Uehara . 	 " It 's probably the only thing I have n't accomplished in my career
column14: " Benoit said . " I 've been to the World Series last year
column15: I 've been to the playoffs . I 've been a starter
column16: I 've been a reliever . I 've done almost everything -- now an All - Star game would n't be bad . " 	 The Tigers extended their AL Central lead over second - place Cleveland to 3 1/2 games . 	 Chicago 's Dylan Axelrod ( 3 - 6 ) allowed seven runs and 11 hits in 5 2/3 innings . 	 Cabrera 's run - scoring single in the sixth pushed his major league - leading RBI total to 93 . 	 " It 's hard to put in perspective
column17: " Porcello said . " That 's a career season for the majority of guys in baseball
column18: and that 's only his first half . " 	 Chicago 's Alex Rios was hitless a night after going 6 - for-6
column19: and the White Sox never led Wednesday . After Gillaspie 's homer in the second
column20: the Tigers made it 3 - 1 on Austin Jackson 's RBI triple in the bottom of the inning . 	 Axelrod 's problems continued in the third when Avila lined a single to right with the bases loaded . The ball landed just in front of a diving Rios
column21: and two runs came home . 	 " Ax was n't sharp
column22: and that 's a tough lineup to face when you do n't have your best stuff
column23: " White Sox manager Robin Ventura said . " His velocity was down all night
column24: and he was n't getting much from his pitches . When you do that against the Tigers
column25: they will squeeze you
column26: make you throw the ball over the plate and then they beat you . " 	 Axelrod has allowed 29 earned runs in 28 innings in his last six starts . 	 Porcello won his second straight start -- he blanked Cleveland for seven innings last week . Chicago scored twice in the fourth on an RBI single by Dayan Viciedo and a sacrifice fly by Beckham
column27: but right fielder Torii Hunter made a diving
column28: back - handed catch on Beckham 's hit to prevent further damage . 	 Porcello struck out six without a walk . 	 Detroit added three runs in the sixth on consecutive RBI singles by Cabrera
column29: Fielder and Victor Martinez . That made it 8 - 3
column30: but Tigers reliever Bruce Rondon allowed Beckham 's homer and an RBI double by Alexei Ramirez in a shaky seventh . 	 Then Detroit turned to two relievers who have been pretty sharp in 2013 . Drew Smyly worked a perfect eighth
column31: and Benoit pitched the ninth . 	 Game notes 	 All eight of Detroit 's runs came with two out . ... Martinez had three hits to extend his hitting streak to 12 games . ... column3: stellar defense and disciplined offense that produced just enough runs to win again was a successful combination for the Rays again . 	 " It 's just a formula for success in baseball when you do those different things
column4: " manager Joe Maddon said after the Tampa Bay Rays won their season - best seventh straight game on Wednesday night
column5: beating the struggling Minnesota Twins 4 - 3 on Ben Zobrist 's RBI single with two outs in the 13th inning . 	 " That 's pretty basic
column6: good stuff that everybody attempts to achieve
column7: " Maddon added . " But that 's why we 're winning as many games as we have . " 	 Zobrist lined a 1 - 2 pitch from Ryan Pressly ( 2 - 1 ) into the gap in right - center field
column9: 47 - minute game that featured 35 strikeouts -- 19 for Rays pitchers . 	 Tampa Bay climbed to a season - best 12 games over .500 . The second - place Rays also improved to 9 - 1 during a stretch of 14 consecutive games against the Twins
column10: Chicago White Sox and Houston Astros -- teams with the three worst records in the American League . 	 The Twins have has lost 10 of 11
column11: including four straight . They tied a franchise record by fanning 19 times for the first time since 1968 . 	 " A long night
column12: " Twins manager Ron Gardenhire said . " A lot of pitches thrown by both teams . A lot of missed opportunities . " 	 Cesar Ramos ( 2 - 2 ) got two outs
column13: escaping a jam with runners at first and third in the 13th to get the win . 	 Yunel Escobar singled with one out in the 13th and took second with two outs on Pressly 's errant pickoff throw . After Luke Scott walked on a full count
column14: Zobrist singled . 	 " I 've had some timely hits
column15: but it 's been up and down the lineup
column16: " Zobrist said . " You think about the hits Luke Scott had today and the hits he 's had lately
column17: and you ca n't say enough tonight about our bullpen
column18: shutting it down with men in scoring position and getting a lot of big strikeouts . " 	 Pedro Florimon hit a two - run
column19: third - inning homer and Clete Thomas had a RBI single in the fifth to give the Twins a 3 - 1 lead against Rays starter Jeremy Hellickson . 	 Kelly Johnson 's two - run homer off Minnesota starter Kevin Correia made it 3 - all in the sixth . 	 The game ended just before midnight
column20: just over 12 hours before the teams wrap up a four - game series Thursday afternoon . 	 " When you win a game like that
column21: there 's a residual energy . When you do n't win a game like that
column22: you have to go looking for that energy
column23: " Maddon said . " It does n't mean you win the next day
column24: but it definitely makes it easier to walk in the door . " 	 The Twins wasted opportunities to take the lead in the ninth and 11th . They failed to take advantage of a pair of singles to begin the ninth against closer Fernando Rodney
column25: and let reliever Jamey Wright off the hook when Oswaldo Arcia grounded out to strand runners at second and third base in the 11th . 	 Arcia also could n't get the potential go - ahead run home in the 13th

column1: CHICAGO -- It took them nearly up until the All - Star break
column2: but Albert Pujols and Josh Hamilton finally went back - to - back . 	 The Los Angeles Angels sluggers connected in the fifth inning of a 13 - 2 rout of the Chicago Cubs on Wednesday night -- the first time Pujols and Hamilton homered in consecutive at - bats this season . 	 After the game
column3: Hamilton seemed a bit confused when asked for his reaction to the back - to - back homers . 	 " Oh
column4: I hit the solo after he hit his ? " Hamilton said sarcastically before pausing . " Oh
column6: man . We do n't think about stuff like that . " 	 Actually
column7: not thinking about too much has served Hamilton well over the past couple of weeks as he looks to rebound from a rough start in his first season with the Angels . Hamilton had two homers -- his first multihomer game with the Angels -- and five RBIs to lead an offense that hit five homers in all . 	 His numbers ( 14 homers
column9: .229 average ) still are n't close to what is expected from him approaching the All - Star break
column10: but they are improving . 	 " I 'm sort of just getting back to doing what you do and quit worrying about listening to everybody
column11: " he said . " Listen to the guys here I really care about
column13: and go from there . " 	 The same could be said of the Angels ' entire lineup
column14: which has been mostly responsible for the team winning 11 of 14 games to improve to 44 - 46 . 	 Mark Trumbo and Brendan Harris also homered and all of the Angels ' home runs were no - doubters . They hit a pair during a five - run first inning and then followed with three more in a six - run fifth
column15: providing more than enough support for C.J. Wilson ( 9 - 6 ) . 	 " Offense is kind of a streaky thing sometimes
column16: " said Wilson
column17: who allowed one run in seven innings to win for the fifth time in six starts . " You have instances where you score 13 runs
column18: which is kind of a fluke no matter how good your offense is . I feel like our offense is capable of scoring six runs a night . That 's a good benchmark because of all the guys that have power throughout the lineup . 	 " We have a lot of guys that
column19: I think
column20: are on the way back up to their level of play after slow starts . That 's the key . We just need to get everyone playing just the way they can play . It 's not like they have to go out there and hit a grand slam every game or something like that . " 	 The Angels wasted little time in getting to Jeff Samardzija ( 5 - 9 ) . Erick Aybar and Mike Trout started the game with doubles and Pujols drew the first of his three walks . 	 Hamilton followed with a drive over the right - field wall for a three - run shot
column21: his 13th of the season . A batter later
column22: Trumbo connected on a hanging slider and hit it into the left - field bleachers to cap a five - run first inning . 	 Leading 5 - 1
column23: the Angels broke it open in the fifth as Pujols and Harris hit two - run shots and Hamilton added a solo homer . 	 Samardzija allowed nine hits and tied a career high by giving up nine runs
column25: in 4 2/3 innings . 	 " That game got out of hand
column26: " Cubs manager Dale Sveum said . " Give credit to some really good hitters . They get paid a lot of money to hit mistakes and they obviously did n't miss 'em tonight . " 	 It was a big night for the entire lineup
column27: but the focus was rightly on Hamilton because of his early struggles . 	 " You make a big adjustment when you switch teams
column28: " said Wilson
column29: who also was a teammate of Hamilton 's with the Texas Rangers . " You 're living in a new place
column30: you 're going to the ballpark on a different route and all that stuff . I went through that last year
column31: but the advantage I had was being from California . 	 " Josh wants to do well . He 's knows what he 's here to do . He 's knows he 's here to hit and play great defense
column32: and if he does n't do well
column33: he 's upset . He 's having more fun
column34: and that 's sort of contagious in itself . " 	 Game notes 	 RHP Scott Baker will throw a bullpen session at Wrigley Field on Thursday and general manager Jed Hoyer said he 's " pretty close " to going on a minor league rehab assignment . Baker has been on the disabled list all year after undergoing Tommy John elbow surgery and missing all of last year . ... The Cubs continue the homestand with a four - game series against St. Louis . Edwin Jackson ( 5 - 10 ) faces the Cardinals ' Jake Westbrook ( 5 - 3 ) in the opener Thursday night . ... After traveling from California to the Midwest for two games
column35: the Angels return to the West Coast and open a three - game series at Seattle on Friday . Jerome Williams ( 5 - 4 ) faces the Mariners ' Joe Saunders ( 7 - 8) in the opener . 	 The Yankees hired former Mets manager Luis Rojas as their new third base coach on Monday . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
column36: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
column37: Detroit added one of the most undervalued pitchers available this winter . 	 Joon Lee breaks down how Eduardo Rodriguez signing with Detroit affects the Tigers and Red Sox . 	 Check out some of the most electric moments from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. 's career . 	 Former Boston Red Sox left - hander Eduardo Rodriguez and the Detroit Tigers are in agreement on a five - year deal worth $ 77 million

column1: ST . LOUIS -- Matt Carpenter welcomes it when teams bring in a left - handed reliever to face him . In fact
column2: he almost thrives on it . 	 The left - handed Carpenter hit a two - run home run off lefty Wesley Wright ( 0 - 3 ) and Matt Holliday drove in two with a two - out hit to help the St. Louis Cardinals beat the Houston Astros 5 - 4 Wednesday night . 	 " I 've always felt
column5: like I see lefties pretty well
column7: who earned his first All - Star Game selection this year . " I try to take the same approach and just get a good pitch to hit and try to put a good swing on it . " 	 Carpenter 's batting average is nearly 40 points lower against lefties ( .294 versus .333 against right - handers )
column8: but four of his nine home runs this season have come against southpaws . 	 His homer in the seventh gave the win to Seth Maness ( 5 - 1 ) . Tony Cruz got hit by starter Jordan Lyles ' first pitch of the inning and one out later Carpenter put a 2 - 1 pitch into the right - field stands . 	 " I think he takes it personal that they come in thinking that 's something he 'd have more of a weakness with
column9: " manager Mike Matheny said . " There 's some guys who are just highly motivated and I think that 's one of the things he takes a lot pride in
column10: is putting together a tough at - bat so they just do n't start firing left - handers against us . " 	 Maness gave up two hits and a run in two innings of relief . He struck out three . 	 Edward Mujica earned his 25th save in 26 tries . He has appeared in six consecutive games
column11: going 1 - 1 with four saves . 	 Lyles gave up four runs and six hits in 6 1/3 innings . He struck out two and walked two . Lyles has n't won a game since beating Milwaukee on June 18 . 	 Astros manager Bo Porter said he knew his starter would only face the first two batters in the seventh . 	 " That was a totally left - on - left decision and you look at the stress of the innings in which he had gotten to that point
column12: " Porter said . " I sent him back out there with the notion he was going to face Cruz
column13: he was going to face the pinch hitter ( Yadier Molina ) and Wesley was going to be ready for Carpenter . " 	 Cardinals starter Shelby Miller needed 94 pitches to labor through five innings . He gave up three earned runs
column14: walked five and struck out five . He had a total of six full counts
column15: coming back to strike out Jason Castro and getting Brett Wallace to ground out . 	 " It was a rough one for me
column16: " Miller said . " I did n't have anything going for me . I could n't throw strikes or much of anything . I just tried to keep the team in it as much as I could with what I had . It was n't much
column17: but five innings
column18: three runs and the offense picks you up . 	 " These guys never cease to amaze me when they go out there and do the things that they do . " 	 Wallace
column19: who had four hits and scored a run
column20: drove in Jose Altuve in the seventh to give Houston a 4 - 3 lead . 	 Holliday 's single in the fifth tied the score at 3 - 3 . His slap to right field drove in Cruz and Shane Robinson
column21: who had a pinch hit single in place of Miller . 	 Allen Craig walked to open the second and scored on Matt Adams ' single . Adams has five RBIs in in his past six games . 	 The Cardinals swept their five - game homestand with three victories over Miami before taking both against Houston . The home sweep comes on the heels of a 7 - 11 stretch that included three wins over the Chicago Cubs
column22: who host the Cardinals in a four - game set starting Thursday . 	 " This is a huge five - game stretch for us to win
column23: come out here and win all these games at home
column24: to get on a roll right before the All - Star break
column25: " Carpenter said . " Hopefully we can continue it in Chicago . " 	 Chris Carter hit his 18th home run just over the right field fence to open the second . Houston then used a Wallace single
column26: two walks and an error for a 2 - 0 lead . The Astros took a 3 - 1 lead after Castro hit a ground rule double and J.D. Martinez drove him in with a single in the fifth . 	 Game notes 	 Cardinals C Cruz got his third start in the past four games in place of All - Star catcher and league - leading batter Yadier Molina
column27: who is nursing a sore right knee . He 's gone 3 of 9 in that span . ... Molina struck out as a pinch hitter in the seventh . ... Wallace
column28: former first - round pick of the Cardinals
column29: is 7 for 18 with five RBIs and four runs in four games this season against St. Louis . . Porter said after the game the Astros will call up one of their top prospects
column30: 23 - year - old right - hander Jarred Cosart
column31: to make his major league debut Friday at Tampa Bay . Dallas Keuchel will be pushed to Saturday with Erik Bedard starting on Sunday . . The Astros have lost 13 of their past 15 games against their former NL Central division rivals . column1: PHOENIX -- The Dodgers were going to head back to Los Angeles from a successful road trip regardless of what happened in their series finale against Arizona . 	 To close it out with a dramatic comeback and complete a three - game sweep
column2: they could n't have scripted it any better . 	 Hanley Ramirez and A.J. Ellis hit consecutive homers in the 14th inning after Ellis tied the game with two outs in the ninth
column3: helping the Los Angeles Dodgers beat first - place Arizona 7 - 5 Wednesday night for their first sweep of the Diamondbacks in two years . 	 " For us to walk out of here fighting and grinding the way we did
column4: it 's going to make for a real fun trip home
column5: " Ellis said . 	 Los Angeles won six of its first eight games on the road trip
column6: including the first two against Arizona . 	 The Dodgers closed it out with a flourish . 	 With the Dodgers still in it because of Ellis ' hit in the ninth off Heath Bell
column7: Ramirez hit the first pitch of the 14th off Josh Collmenter ( 4 - 2 ) just over the wall in right field . Five pitches later
column8: Ellis made it 7 - 5 with his fourth homer . 	 Kenley Jansen ( 3 - 3 ) pitched the final two innings for the Dodgers
column9: who used all of their position players and had Zack Greinke
column11: pinch hit in the 10th inning . 	 A team that was 12 games under .500 and 9 games out of first on June 22
column12: the Dodgers are back to .500 and 1 games back of the Diamondbacks in the NL West after winning 15 of 18 . 	 " Obviously
column13: you want to come in and win a series
column14: but to win three was big for us because it 's a two - game swing when you 're playing them
column15: " Dodgers manager Don Mattingly said . " I really felt like before we got here
column16: we really got ourselves back into it
column17: where we were in the race and we knew it . This has been icing on the cake . " 	 Arizona went through eight pitchers in the 19th game in the majors to go at least 14 innings this season
column18: according to STATS . There were 20 total last season . 	 Aaron Hill homered and drove in two runs
column19: and Paul Goldschmidt hit a two - run double for the Diamondbacks
column20: who went seven innings -- until two outs in the 12th -- without a hit . 	 Arizona appeared to be in position for the victory after Bell got two quick outs . 	 But
column21: as has been the case lately
column22: the Diamondbacks could n't hold the lead . 	 Adrian Gonzalez
column23: who led off the seventh inning with a solo homer
column24: worked a two - out walk off Bell in the ninth inning
column25: then Ramirez moved pinch runner Jerry Hairston to second with a single . Ellis followed with his tying single off Bell
column26: his fifth blown save and the Diamondbacks ' 19th . 	 " We have to figure out some things so guys can get some outs later in the game
column27: " Diamondbacks manager Kirk Gibson said . 	 The more than five - hour game started with the teams trading leads . 	 Tyler Skaggs had a superb return to Arizona 's rotation on Friday
column28: allowing three hits and striking out five in eight scoreless innings against Colorado after being called up from Triple - A Reno . The left - hander was n't nearly as good against the Dodgers
column29: giving up a run on Scott Van Slyke 's sacrifice fly in the fourth inning and a two - run double to Ramirez that put the Dodgers up 3 - 2 in the fifth . Skaggs then walked two to load the bases
column30: but reliever Will Harris prevented further damage by getting Van Slyke to hit into an inning - ending double play . 	 Skaggs allowed three runs on eight hits in 4 1/3 innings . 	 Hyun - Jin Ryu was n't much better . 	 He gave up a solo homer to Hill in the first inning and a sacrifice fly to him in the third . Given the lead back
column31: Ryu allowed a pair of one - out singles in the fifth and Goldschmidt followed with his two - run double . Martin Prado made it 5 - 3 with a run - scoring single . 	 Ryu allowed five runs on seven hits in five innings
column32: the second time in 18 starts he 's failed to reach the sixth inning . 	 Gonzalez led off the seventh inning with his 14th homer off David Hernandez to cut Arizona 's lead to 5 - 4
column33: then set the tying run after fouling off five pitches from Bell
column34: who 's allowed nine runs his past 11 outings . 	 " I feel really bad because I left everybody down
column35: " Bell said . " We definitely should have won that game . " 	 Even after Bell 's blowup
column37: as did the Dodgers . 	 But
column38: with fans falling asleep in the stands
column39: Ramirez and Ellis finally put the Dodgers ahead for good
column40: sending them home with an exclamation point to their successful road trip . 	 " We might be the only team in baseball not looking forward to the All - Star break
column41: " Ellis said . 	 Game notes 	 Dodgers 2B Skip Schumaker sat out and will not play Thursday after having his two - game suspension upheld by Major League Baseball . He was one of eight people suspended following a bench - clearing brawl against Arizona on June 11 . ... The Dodgers ' Ricky Nolasco and Greinke
column42: who started the series ' first two games
column43: were the first pair of starting pitchers to go at least a combined 5 - for-5 at the plate in consecutive games since Cincinnati 's Tim Pugh and John Smiley did it May 6 - 7
column45: according to information provided to the Dodgers by the Elias Sports Bureau . ... Wade Miley will pitch for Arizona in the opener of a four - game series against Milwaukee on Thursday . column2: Harold Baines and Edgar Martinez were among the hitters David Ortiz looked up to as examples . 	 So it 's not lost on Ortiz that he has now passed both to become baseball 's all - time leader in hits as a designated hitter . 	 " Wonderful hitters and when I first came up watching those guys
column3: " Ortiz said . " Now for your name to get mentioned next to theirs
column4: it 's a wonderful thing . " 	 Ortiz doubled in his first at - bat to pass Baines for the most hits as a DH and hit a two - run homer an inning later
column5: leading the Boston Red Sox to an 11 - 4 win over the Seattle Mariners on Wednesday night . 	 Ortiz entered the night tied with Baines with 1
column7: and was acknowledged by a standing ovation from the mix of Red Sox and Mariners fans when he doubled to left - center field to lead off the second inning . 	 An inning later
column8: Ortiz collected his eighth hit of the series with a two - run homer off Seattle starter Aaron Harang ( 4 - 8)
column9: his 19th this season . 	 " There is nothing that guy does that amazes me . He goes out there every day and is so consistent that you almost expect it . You kind of feel bad whenever he goes 0 for 4 and you 're like
column11: are you kidding me ? " Boston catcher Jared Saltalamacchia said . " But that 's how good he is and how consistent he 's been in his career . " 	 Jacoby Ellsbury had three hits to extend his hitting streak to 18 games
column13: and the Red Sox knocked around Harang for seven runs and eight hits . 	 Ortiz appeared touched by the ovation as he rumbled into second with the standup double . He tipped his helmet twice toward the standing fans and patting his chest as his milestone was shown on the video board . Ortiz already held the marks for the most runs scored
column15: home runs
column16: extra - base hits and RBIs by a designated hitter . 	 " The fans
column17: they looked forward to that . They look forward to watch guys breaking records and getting to a certain level
column18: " Ortiz said . " They really appreciated it . " 	 Ortiz scored in the second on Saltalamacchia 's sacrifice fly
column19: then provided the big blow in the third with a two - out
column20: two - run homer to right - center field
column21: his second straight game going deep . 	 " I 've seen too much of him over the years
column22: " Seattle manager Eric Wedge said . " He is about as professional a hitter as you can be . Still has the bat speed
column24: commands the strike zone as good as anybody in the game . " 	 Boston broke the game open in the sixth and knocked out Harang after singles by Jose Iglesias and Brock Holt to open the inning . Ellsbury and Shane Victorino both had RBI singles in the four - run inning that was helped along by a throwing error from Seattle shortstop Brad Miller . 	 After Seattle held a 5 - 1 lead after two innings in Tuesday 's game
column25: the Red Sox have outscored the Mariners 21 - 7 in the following 16 innings . 	 Ortiz 's milestone night overshadowed one of the best starts this season by Boston 's Felix Doubront . With its bullpen taxed in the opening two games of the series
column26: Doubront ( 6 - 3 ) provided the outing Boston needed to give its relievers a rest . 	 Doubront took a shutout into the seventh and silenced a Seattle offense that scored 19 runs against Boston pitching in the first two games of the series . He allowed only a pair of early singles
column27: and a double to Michael Saunders -- the first Seattle batter to reach second base -- in the fifth . 	 Seattle finally got to Doubront in the seventh when Jason Bay led off with a double and scored on Henry Blanco 's two - out single . But that was the extent of Seattle 's offense against the lefty . Doubront won his second straight start after going more than a month without a victory . It was the third time this season Doubront has allowed one earned run or less
column28: and just the second time he 's finished seven innings . 	 Doubront struck out six and walked two . 	 " We 'll take a strong outing off a starting pitcher every night that we walk in here
column29: " Boston manager John Farrell said . " I think the biggest thing is he continued to put up zeroes after we scored runs and that kept the momentum on our side . " 	 Game notes 	 Seattle SS Brendan Ryan led off the eighth with a solo homer off Boston 's Brandon Workman

column1: SAN DIEGO -- The Rockies expected to get a good game out of starter Jorge De La Rosa . Charlie Blackmon 's contribution was an unexpected surprise . 	 De La Rosa took a one - hit shutout into the sixth inning in beating San Diego for the sixth straight time and Blackmon
column2: recalled from Triple - A on Monday
column3: drove in the winning run and made a spectacular defensive play to help Colorado to a 5 - 4 win over the Padres on Wednesday night . 	 De La Rosa lifted his record at Petco Park to 3 - 0 with a 1.88 ERA . His winning streak against San Diego spans eight starts . 	 Blackmon matched a career - high with two RBIs and his triple in the eighth off Padres reliever Nick Vincent gave the Rockies a 5 - 3 lead . He also had an RBI single in the sixth . 	 Blackmon also made a diving catch on pinch hitter Mark Kotsay 's sinking liner to center with two runners on in the Padres ' sixth after Carlos Quentin had hit a two - run home run off De La Rosa to make it 4 - 2 and send the Rockies ' starter to the clubhouse . 	 " With the guys out of the lineup sometimes you got to win games that way
column4: " Rockies manager Walt Weiss said . " It 's nice to see us do that . Charlie had some big hits and made some big plays . Jonny ( Herrera ) had a really good series . Any time you win a series in your division on the road it 's really big . " 	 All eight position players for the Rockies had at least one hit and Colorado outhit San Diego 13 - 7 . 	 Herrera drove in the Rockies ' first run with a sacrifice fly off Andrew Cashner in the second inning . And his drag bunt single led to the Rockies ' fourth run in the sixth on Blackmon 's single . 	 The Rockies were leading 4 - 0 in the sixth when Quentin hit his 11th home run
column5: a two - run shot to straight away center field
column7: who had walked . That was all for De La Rosa ( 9 - 5 )
column8: who allowed two hits over five innings with four walks and four strikeouts . 	 " We could n't get to De La Rosa until Q 's homer
column9: " Padres manager Bud Black said . " He kept us in check . We could n't mount any attack against him . He did a good job of keeping the ball down and changing speed . The change / split is a very effective pitch . The fastball
column10: change combo was also effective . " 	 San Diego 's Everth Cabrera doubled down the left - field line off Rockies reliever Matt Belisle leading off the seventh and came around to score on a single to right by Chris Denorfia
column11: making it 4 - 3 . 	 The Rockies came back with an insurance run in the eighth off Padres reliever Nick Vincent when Blackmon tripled to score pinch hitter Corey Dickerson
column12: who had singled with one out . 	 " I 'm very thankful that the Rockies got enough faith in me to put me in this position ( and ) to have an opportunity
column13: " Blackmon said . " I 'm just blessed to be healthy and be here
column14: and it really feels good to help be a part of a team win . " 	 Rockies reliever Rex Brothers pitched a scoreless eighth and Rafael Betancourt came on in the ninth to pick up his 13th save in 14 opportunities . Betancourt gave up an RBI single to Headley
column15: who stole second to put the tying run in scoring position with two out . However
column16: Betancourt got Quentin to pop out to first in foul territory to end the game . 	 Cashner ( 5 - 5 ) went five innings for the Padres
column17: giving up three runs
column18: two earned
column19: on eight hits . He struck out five
column20: walked two and threw a wild pitch that led to a Rockies run in the fifth . 	 Herrera 's sacrifice fly scored Todd Helton in the second . Helton had walked leading off and moved to third on a double by Yorvit Torrealba . 	 Helton drove in the Rockies ' second run with a single in the third that scored D.J. LeMahieu from second . 	 D.J. LeMahieu
column22: reached on an error by Padres shortstop Cabrera leading off the fifth . Carlos Gonzalez
column23: who returned after missing two games with an injured middle right finger
column25: nearly hitting Cashner . Michael Cuddyer hit a grounder that forced Gonzalez at second . 	 With runners on first and third
column26: Cashner struck out Helton . However
column27: Cashner uncorked a wild pitch with Nolan Arenado at the plate
column28: allowing LeMahieu to score . 	 The Rockies left 12 runners on base . 	 Game notes 	 Rockies OF Dexter Fowler and SS Troy Tulowitzki were expected to rejoin the team Thursday in Los Angeles . Rockies manager Walt Weiss said that Fowler
column29: who has been on the DL with a right bone bruise since June 26
column30: would play Thursday against the Dodgers and that Tulowitzki
column31: sidelined with a fractured right rib since June 14
column32: could be activated during the four - game series . . Weiss also noted that pitcher Juan Nicasio would be recalled from Triple - A Colorado Springs and would pitch Friday against the Dodgers and Clayton Kershaw . . Padres manager Bud Black announced that the Padres plan to purchase the contract of 25 - year - old RHP Sean O'Sullivan from Triple - A Tucson and he will pitch against the San Francisco Giants on Friday night . O'Sullivan is 7 - 4 with a 3.88 ERA in 18 starts for Tucson . He has a 6.31 ERA in 43 major league games with the Angels ( 2009 - 10 ) and Royals ( 2010 - 11 ) . . Padres 1B Yonder Alonso ( right hand fracture ) went 4 for 4 with two RBIs Tuesday in a rehab assignment with Tucson and could be activated during the four - game series with the Giants . . Padres 2B Jedd Gyorko
column33: on the DL since June 10 with a right groin strain
column34: began his rehab assignment with Single - A Lake Elsinore Wednesday . Black said that Gyorko could be moved up to Triple - A Tucson Thursday or Friday . column1: CLEVELAND --   Still soaked after being doused with beer
column2: Danny Salazar picked up the official lineup card he was given as a memento of his first win . 	 " I did n't know I would get this
column3: " he said at his locker . 	 Salazar began to fold it in half and tuck the card into his backpack when he was stopped by clubhouse manager Tony Amato . 	 It was the rookie 's only mistake . 	 Salazar pitched six superb innings and won his major league debut
column4: leading the Cleveland Indians to a 4 - 2 victory over the Toronto Blue Jays on Thursday . 	 Salazar
column5: who began the season in Double - A ball
column6: allowed just one run and two hits . The right - hander did n't give up a hit until the sixth
column7: struck out seven and showed poise from his first pitch to his last . 	 The hard - throwing 23 - year - old was shocked at being called up
column8: but he pitched with the nerves of a seasoned veteran and gave the Indians a much - needed strong outing . 	 " He was terrific
column9: " Indians manager Terry Francona said . " That can be what he is . The kid has special stuff . " 	 Salazar was brought up for one start . He 's headed back to Triple - A Columbus
column10: but it may not be long before Salazar is back in Cleveland on a more permanent basis . 	 " We think the kid has a very bright future
column11: " Francona said . 	 Chris Perez gave up a run in a shaky ninth but got his 11th save as the Indians beat knuckleballer R.A. Dickey ( 8 - 10 ) for the second time this season . 	 Asdrubal Cabrera homered in the first off Dickey and Lonnie Chisenhall drove in a run in Cleveland 's two - run sixth . 	 Jose Bautista hit an RBI double for Toronto 's only run off Salazar
column12: who admitted being nervous during his pregame warmup in the bullpen . 	 But once he was on the mound
column13: Salazar was unflappable -- and for a while
column14: unhittable . 	 Unleashing a fastball that registered 99 mph on the stadium radar gun
column15: he coasted through the first five innings
column16: striking out seven and not letting the Blue Jays get many good swings . A few of his pitches were way out of the strike zone
column17: but just when it appeared he might come unraveled
column18: Salazar settled down . 	 Salazar 's seven strikeouts were the most by a Cleveland pitcher in his debut since Luis Tiant struck out 11 New York Yankees on July 19
column19: 1964 . 	 " We could n't do anything with Salazar
column20: " Blue Jays manager John Gibbons said . " He 's got a great arm . I tip my hat to the young kid . " 	 Salazar held Toronto without a hit until the sixth
column22: batting just .108 slapped a 1 - 2 pitch into left . Salazar received a nice ovation from Cleveland fans
column23: who have n't seen many quality starts lately from the Indians ' rotation . Munenori Kawasaki sacrificed and Salazar retired Jose Reyes on a liner to second . 	 Bautista then tied it 1 - 1 by ripping an RBI double to left . Salazar recovered and got the final out before heading to the dugout
column24: where he was warmly greeted by teammates . Salazar took some pressure off a tired Indians bullpen dragging itself to the All - Star break . 	 Salazar said he prayed the Indians would score in the bottom inning to get him a win
column25: and Cleveland
column26: which squandered some early threats against Dickey
column27: came through with two runs . 	 " I 've been waiting for this moment for seven years
column28: " said Salazar
column29: who was signed by the Indians in 2006 and underwent Tommy John surgery in 2010 . " I threw five innings without hits . After the game
column30: all the guys were throwing beers all over me . That 's fantastic . " 	 Salazar was given two souvenir balls : his first strikeout and the final out . He said " everyone " in his hometown of Cabrera
column31: Dominican Republic gathered in a local park to watch him pitch . 	 Rich Hill worked a hitless seventh
column32: Cody Allen struck out the side in the eighth and Perez allowed Colby Rasmus ' RBI single and put the tying run at first before getting Rajai Davis on a liner to left for the final out . 	 The Indians pushed two runs across in the sixth against Dickey to take a 3 - 1 lead and make Salazar a winner . 	 Chisenhall came through with a blooper to left with the bases loaded that hung in the air long enough that the runners had to freeze . 	 When it dropped
column33: Michael Brantley sprinted home and left fielder Davis
column34: thinking he had a chance at a forceout at home
column35: sailed his throw to the backstop . The ball ricocheted toward the plate
column36: and Ryan Raburn scored from second before the Blue Jays could retrieve it . 	 Cleveland tacked on an insurance run in the eighth on Carlos Santana 's RBI triple . 	 Cabrera
column37: who had two hits on Wednesday to snap an 0 - for-20 slump
column38: drove an 0 - 2 pitch from Dickey over the wall in right in the first to make it 1 - 0 . 	 Game notes 	  Last year at the break

column40: bothered by a sore left shoulder

column2: Fla. -- Matt Moore pitched like an All - Star on the day he became one . 	 Moore won his 13th game this season
column3: Luke Scott and Evan Longoria hit back - to - back homers
column4: and the surging Tampa Bay Rays completed a four - game sweep by beating the Minnesota Twins 4 - 3 on Thursday . 	 " Truly an All - Star performance

column6: who was added to the AL All - Star team Thursday after initially being left off
column9: two walks and had 10 strikeouts over 7 1/3 innings in winning his fifth straight start and setting a team record for victories before the All - Star break . 	 " It means a lot
column10: " Moore said . " I 'm ecstatic about being part of the festivities and being at the game with the best players in the game . " 	 Moore said the best part came after talking about his All - Star addition in Maddon 's office . 	 " Opened up the door and everybody was waiting there with waters and beers to celebrate
column11: " Moore said . 	 Moore is taking the spot of Texas right - hander Yu Darvish
column12: who went on the disabled list this week due to a strained trapezius muscle . 	 Two of the runs charged to Moore scored when reliever Alex Torres gave up a two - run single in the eighth to Joe Mauer that cut the Twins ' deficit to 4 - 3 . Jake McGee got his first save pitching a scoreless ninth . 	 Scott and Longoria hit solo shots in a span of three pitches off Mike Pelfrey ( 4 - 7 ) as the Rays took a 3 - 1 lead in the sixth . Longoria
column14: stopped a career - high stretch of 14 games without an extra base hit . 	 Rookie Wil Myers had three hits and two RBIs for Tampa Bay
column15: which climbed to a season - best 13 games over .500 with its eighth straight victory . The second - place Rays also improved to 10 - 1 during a stretch of 14 consecutive games against the Twins

column18: age - tested formula . We pitched well

The Twins struck out six times and had only one well hit ball
column21: a third - inning fly near the warning track in center by Aaron Hicks through five innings . The lone baserunner during the stretch came when Mauer drew a two - out walk in the fourth . 	 " That 's a heck of a pitching staff over there

column1: NEW YORK --   Derek Jeter walked to home plate
column3: stepped into the batter 's box as fans chanted his name and legged out an infield hit . 	 A feeling of normalcy returned to the Yankee Stadium . The captain was back after a nine - month layoff . 	 But
column5: only for a few innings . 	 Jeter singled on his first pitch of the season
column6: then felt a tight right quadriceps and was pulled for a pinch - hitter in the eighth inning of New York 's 8 - 4 victory over the Kansas City Royals on Thursday . 	 He scored a run and went 1 for 4 with an RBI groundout as the designated hitter in his return from a broken ankle sustained in last October 's AL championship series opener . After icing the leg
column7: the 39 - year - old was headed to a hospital for a scan . 	 In a season thus far memorable for sidelined stars rather than sustained success
column8: the Yankees anxiously awaited the test results . 	 " It 's not frustrating
column9: yet . We 'll see . They MRI everything around here

column13: before adding : " I always play . " 	 He played through September and into October last year with what was called a bone bruise . The left ankle finally gave out in the AL championship series opener against Detroit . 	 " I do n't think it broke because I was 38 . I think it broke because I continued to play on something that maybe I should n't have

column15: Curtis Granderson and Francisco Cervelli . 	 " It 's kind of what we went through this year
column16: " manager Joe Girardi said . " So hopefully it 's nothing

column18: two - run single in a four - run fifth against Ervin Santana ( 5 - 6 ) as New York overcame a 3 - 0 deficit and split the four - game series . 	 New York cut short the star shortstop 's rehabilitation assignment in the minor leagues after just four games following injuries Wednesday night to Travis Hafner and Brett Gardner
column19: who hit for Jeter in the eighth . Jeter found out about 11 p.m. in Scranton
column22: waited for his equipment and caught a ride to New York . He arrived about 2:30 a.m.
column23: fell asleep 90 minutes later . 	 And then woke up about 6:30 a.m. -- only partly because of the early schedule he had been on during his rehabilitation routine . 	 " Could n't fall back asleep

Jeter turned on a 95 mph fastball in the first -- " I had my mind made up yesterday that I was going to swing at the first pitch " -- and sent a three - hopper up the third - base line that fell from Miguel Tejada 's throwing hand . The crowd of 40
column28: 381 screamed " De - rek Je - ter ! De - rek Je - ter ! " 	 Jeter 's ankle got more tests when he raced to third on Robinson Cano 's single up the middle and came home without a throw on Vernon Wells ' sacrifice fly to right . 	 The Yankees ' all - time hits leader grounded out in the second and again in the fifth
column29: when second baseman Johnny Giavotella made a diving stop to prevent an RBI single . That 's when the quad tightened . 	 Jeter hit a sharp grounder to shortstop with the infield in during the sixth . Alcides Escobar bobbled the ball as Luis Cruz scored from third
