column1: DETROIT -- It was hard to tell who was happier when Josh Phegley 's sixth - inning grand slam cleared the fence -- Phegley himself
column2: or the pitcher who would benefit from those four runs . 	 Phegley 's drive gave Chris Sale some long - awaited offensive support
column3: and Chicago went on to beat the Detroit Tigers 6 - 3 on Thursday in a game that included a bench - clearing altercation shortly after the White Sox took the lead . 	 Sale was 0 - 6 in his previous seven starts despite an ERA of 3.10 over that span . With one swing
column4: Phegley helped the left - hander end his unfortunate winless stretch . 	 " That was awesome
column5: " Sale said . " Being in that situation and watching that ball go over the fence
column6: that was very satisfying to say the least . What a game . We did n't put our heads down
column7: did n't quit . " 	 Chicago trailed 3 - 1 when Phegley cleared the bases with a homer off Detroit starter Anibal Sanchez ( 7 - 6 ) . Luke Putkonen came on and got one out before throwing a pitch behind Alexei Ramirez
column8: who started toward the mound before being restrained . 	 Benches and bullpens emptied
column9: but the situation did n't escalate into any sort of fight . Putkonen was ejected
column10: and Detroit manager Jim Leyland argued with umpires at length and was also tossed from the game . 	 " I was n't trying to hit anybody

column13: that was n't a pitch that was intended to go in the zone
column14: " he said through a translator . 	 MLB is looking into the actions that led to the benches clearing

column17: a solo shot in the fifth that gave the Tigers a 3 - 1 lead . Prince Fielder was up next

column19: and that was n't the time or the place
column20: " Sale said . " I 'm not even trying to send a message . I was n't even trying to back him off the plate
column21: honestly . I 've got a lot of respect for Prince

column24: and he twice came back out to argue with umpires . 	 Leyland did not speak to reporters after the game . Plate umpire Chad Fairchild explained the decision to eject Putkonen . 	 " He threw behind him and I deemed it intentional

column4: Dustin Pedroia or any of Boston 's other big sluggers at the center of a Red Sox rally . 	 Try Brock Holt
column6: Daniel Nava and a reliever in Steven Wright making just his second major league appearance as the reason Boston was able to get out of Seattle taking three of four games . 	 Nava hit a two - out single in the top of the 10th inning to score pinch - runner Jackie Bradley Jr.
column7: and the Red Sox rallied from a four - run deficit for the second time in the series to beat the Mariners 8 - 7 in 10 innings on Thursday . 	 Once again
column8: the Red Sox found themselves trailing 5 - 1
column9: just as they were on Tuesday night . In that game
column11: Napoli and a big game from Ortiz to rally past the Mariners for an 11 - 8 victory . 	 In the series finale
column12: it was two - out hitting that proved critical for the Red Sox to come back . Boston got two - out hits to score runs in the fourth
column13: fifth and 10th innings . 	 " A number of big swings for us with two outs and the two out runs scored
column14: " Boston manager John Farrell said . " We continue to grind away and play it right to the last out . " 	 Ryan Lavarnway walked to open the 10th against Tom Wilhelmsen ( 0 - 3 ) and was replaced by Bradley . Holt laid down a sacrifice bunt to get Bradley to second base with one out . Wilhelmsen struck out Iglesias on the eighth pitch of the at - bat then intentionally walked Jacoby Ellsbury . 	 Nava fell behind in the count
column15: but was able to roll a 1 - 2 pitch back up the middle and past the dive of second baseman Brad Miller to give Boston the lead . Nava was 0 - for-5 prior to his hit in the 10th . 	 " I was trying to get on top of something and go back up the middle and that was it
column16: " Nava said . 	 Koji Uehara pitched the 10th for his seventh save as the Red Sox took three of four in the series . 	 Wright ( 1 - 0 ) was the reason Boston was able to rally
column17: shutting down the Mariners after replacing starter Ryan Dempster in the fourth inning . The knuckleball throwing right - hander allowed just three hits in 5 2/3 innings . He struck out three
column18: including Mike Zunino for the final out of the fourth inning with runners on second and third . Seattle got just one baserunner to second against Wright
column19: and that was via an error . 	 " Given how well they swing the bat against fastballs it was the right combination today
column20: " Farrell said . " He came to us
column21: today would have been his fifth day where he was completely rested and we needed every pitch that he could give us . Just an outstanding job . " 	 It was just the second major league appearance for Wright
column22: and Uehara made sure the ball from the final out ended up in Wright 's locker . 	 " That my goal every time just to keep going until they tell me I 'm done . Today I was able to do that
column23: " Wright said . 	 Ellsbury hit the eighth leadoff homer of his career to extend his hitting streak to 19 games
column24: the longest in the American League this season . Seattle got a solo homer from Kyle Seager leading off the second inning to give the Mariners a homer in 19 straight games
column25: matching the longest streak in franchise history set in September 1999 . It 's the longest streak in the majors since Toronto also had 19 straight with a homer in 2010 . 	 Seager 's homer helped Seattle build a four - run lead
column26: only to watch Boston rally against Mariners starter Erasmo Ramirez . Boston scored three times in the fourth on two - out hits from Holt
column27: Iglesias and Ellsbury
column28: then scored three more in the fifth . Boston loaded the bases with no outs on singles by Pedroia and Jonny Gomes sandwiched around a walk to Ortiz . Mike Carp 's sacrifice fly scored Pedroia before Holt and Iglesias came through again with two - out RBI singles . 	 " Every ground ball just go to the right spot . The hitters got the luck today
column29: " Ramirez said . " What I can do is just continue throwing the ball trying to make quality pitches
column30: but I did n't so they made me pay for that . " 	 Game notes 	  Seattle OF Endy Chavez left the game in the bottom of the fourth inning with tightness in the right side of his groin running out a bunt single . ... Seattle outrighted RHP Jeremy Bonderman

column1: BALTIMORE -- Chris Davis is having such a phenomenal season
column2: he can afford to joke about a slump he 's been stuck in for more than a week . 	 He 's not getting any sympathy from his teammates
column3: either . 	 Davis snapped an 0 - for-17 skid with his major league - leading 34th homer
column4: and the Baltimore Orioles beat the Texas Rangers 3 - 1 Thursday night to earn a split of the four - game series . 	 Davis reached career highs in homers and RBIs ( 86 ) with a second - inning solo shot off Ross Wolf ( 1 - 2 ) . His 34 home runs are the most in the majors before the All - Star break since 2001
column5: when Barry Bonds had 39 and Luis Gonzalez hit 35 . 	 " I was just glad to get a hit
column6: " Davis said . " Got tired of striking out and grounding out and breaking bats . Kind of went on long enough . " 	 After the home run
column7: he struck out twice and is now in a 2 - for-27 funk . But does it really matter ? 	 " I talked about trying to be a little more patient
column9: " he said . " And of course after I hit the home run I go back to swinging at everything . Some lessons are harder to learn than others . " 	 In spite of his recent dry spell
column10: Davis is still batting .310 and ranks second behind Miguel Cabrera for the major league lead in RBIs . 	 " Yeah
column11: we all feel terrible for him . He 's got 34 and 86 . It 's been a rough go for him
column13: who also homered . " Nobody would have ever predicted that . We know he 's talented
column14: but to have 34 and 86 before the break is just crazy . And it 's been fun to watch . " 	 Miguel Gonzalez ( 7 - 3 ) allowed one run
column15: four hits and two walks in 6 2/3 innings to improve to 5 - 0 at home this year . Baltimore has won each of the last 12 games he 's started at Camden Yards . 	 After Nate McLouth singled in a run for Baltimore in the eighth
column16: Jim Johnson got three outs for his 31st save in 37 opportunities . 	 Ian Kinsler homered and Mitch Moreland had three hits for the Rangers
column17: who scored only one run in each of the final two games of the series . Adrian Beltre went 1 for 4 to extend his hitting streak to 13 games . 	 Texas could n't have asked for much more from Wolf
column18: who got the start after Yu Darvish was placed on the 15 - day disabled list with an upper back strain . Wolf gave up two runs and three hits in six innings . 	 " I 'm very happy with him . He did what his job was today -- he kept us in the ballgame
column19: " manager Ron Washington said . " That 's all you can ask from a guy that 's sitting down there and gets a chance to pitch when you need him . We needed him today and he gave us what we needed out of him . We just did n't put enough runs on the board . " 	 Wolf had n't allowed a homer all season until Davis and Roberts both went deep in a span four batters . Davis put the Orioles up 1 - 0 by driving a 2 - 1 pitch into the center - field bleachers
column20: and Roberts led off the third with his second homer of the year . 	 " Davis
column21: threw him a changeup . It was right down the middle
column22: " Wolf said . " Roberts was a little better pitch . It was fastball down and in
column23: it was supposed to be away . I just missed the spot and it 's ( in ) his happy zone . Made a mistake and paid for it . " 	 Baltimore 's only other hit through the first five innings was a leadoff single by Matt Wieters in the fifth . He was promptly wiped out by a 6 - 4 - 3 double play in which shortstop Elvis Andrus went deep in the hole before flipping the ball to second from his glove . 	 The Rangers had just one runner through the first four innings and managed only two hits through the fifth -- both of them singles by Moreland . 	 Kinsler homered to lead off the sixth and Nelson Cruz singled with one out before Beltre hit into a double play . 	 Texas got a runner on second with no outs in the eighth before Darren O'Day quelled the threat . 	 Game notes 	 Texas assistant general manager Thad Levine said Thursday that Darvish 's injury is n't serious
column24: and the right - hander should be ready to return soon after the All - Star break . ... Baltimore begins a three - game series with Toronto on Friday night
column25: and Texas concludes the first half with three games in Detroit . After the All - Star break

column27: who 's been on the DL since June 9 with right shoulder inflammation

column1: PHILADELPHIA --   Facing one of the NL 's top pitchers brought out Kyle Kendrick 's best . 	 Kendrick outpitched All - Star Jordan Zimmermann
column2: pinch - hitter Kevin Frandsen hit a tiebreaking double in the seventh and the Philadelphia Phillies beat the Washington Nationals 3 - 1 Thursday night . 	 Kendrick ( 8 - 6 ) allowed one run and five hits in seven innings to help Philadelphia take three of four from the defending NL East champions . 	 " He rose to the occasion
column3: " Phillies manager Charlie Manuel said . " Zimmermann was real good . Kendrick was right there with him . " 	 The Phillies are 7 - 3 since July 2
column4: including series wins over first - place Pittsburgh and Atlanta
column5: to pull within 1 1/2 games of the second - place Nationals and one game of .500 . 	 " It 's a big win for us
column6: " Kendrick said . " I knew it was going to be close . I just wanted to give us a chance and we got some big hits . " 	 Zimmermann ( 12 - 4 ) gave up two runs and eight hits
column7: striking out six in 6 1/3 innings . 	 " My stuff was good
column8: " Zimmermann said . " On the pitch to Frandsen
column9: I did n't get the slider low enough and he just flicked it out there . " 	 Antonio Bastardo pitched a perfect eighth and Jonathan Papelbon finished for his 20th save in 24 tries . Papelbon blew two saves against the Nationals last month and allowed two runs in a 3 - 2 win Monday night . 	 Darin Ruf led off the bottom of the seventh with a double down the left - field line . Pinch - runner John McDonald advanced on a sacrifice and scored on Frandsen 's RBI double off center fielder Denard Span 's glove . 	 " As a group
column11: " Frandsen said of Philadelphia 's bench . " We know there 's one spot you 're going to have a chance and fortunately I came through . " 	 Frandsen is hitting .355 ( 11 for 31 ) with 10 RBIs as a pinch - hitter this season . 	 " He 's very valuable for us
column12: " Manuel said . " He 's won a few games for us already . " 	 Kendrick overcame a season - high four errors by the Phillies with two double plays and nine groundouts . Chase Utley had a career - worst three errors . 	 " I just had to battle and keep the game close
column13: " Kendrick said . 	 Utley got the Phillies an insurance run in the eighth by hitting a double to start the inning
column14: moving to third on a fly ball and sliding in safely just ahead of a throw to the plate on Michael Young 's grounder to second . 	 The Phillies took a 1 - 0 lead on Ben Revere 's RBI single in the fifth . Carlos Ruiz reached on an infield single
column15: advanced on Kendrick 's sacrifice and scored on Revere 's liner to left - center . 	 The lead did n't last long . 	 Bryce Harper hit a triple with one out in the sixth and scored on Ryan Zimmerman 's sacrifice fly to right . 	 All - Star Domonic Brown threw out fellow All - Star Harper trying to score from second on Jayson Werth 's two - out single to left in the first . That was Washington 's first hit with runners in scoring position in the series after going 0 for 16 . 	 Game notes 	 David Bell was the last Phillies player to have three errors in a game on May 17

column1: ATLANTA -- Braves fans set a record by voting Freddie Freeman to the All - Star Game . 	 The big first baseman found a way to say thanks . 	 Freeman celebrated his newly won All - Star berth by driving in four runs with three hits and Atlanta beat Mat Latos and the Cincinnati Reds 6 - 5 on Thursday night . 	 Freeman held off Dodgers rookie Yasiel Puig to win the fan voting for the final spot on NL All - Star roster . He received more than 19 million votes
column2: a record . The support from the fans continued into the game as he received a long ovation before his first at - bat . 	 " I was n't expecting it
column4: adding the ovation was " pretty cool . " 	 After backing out of the batter 's box
column5: Freeman approached the plate and with fans still chanting " Freddie ! Freddie ! " he hit a two - run double to center field on his first pitch to drive in Andrelton Simmons and Justin Upton . 	 " A load off the shoulders

column1: CHICAGO -- Even at his lowest point
column2: Edwin Jackson kept believing he would somehow turn his season around . 	 It sure is looking like an about - face now . 	 Jackson earned his third consecutive win
column3: combining with four relievers on a four - hitter
column4: and Anthony Rizzo drove in all the runs to lead the Chicago Cubs to a 3 - 0 victory over the St. Louis Cardinals on Thursday night . 	 " This is probably the craziest start I 've had in baseball
column6: referring to his season . " It 's a game of grinding it out . As long as you believe and you have the confidence that you can come in and turn things around
column7: it 's all that matters . 	 " Nobody expected me to start like I did -- myself
column10: the managers . No one . But it 's a game
column11: you have to keep grinding . You can either sink or you can swim . " 	 The Cubs almost went down at the end of this one . 	 St. Louis had the tying run at the plate in the ninth inning after Kevin Gregg dropped a throw covering first base after Rizzo made a diving stop on Allen Craig 's grounder and David Freese walked . Alfonso Soriano battled the lights and made a shoestring catch on Jon Jay 's liner to end the game . 	 Cardinals manager Mike Matheny was then seen arguing vehemently with plate umpire Dan Bellino and might have made contact with him in front of the first - base dugout . He also had to be restrained . 	 Matheny said he was n't sure if he made contact with Bellino or if he will be disciplined by baseball . He was actually upset at the umpire for taking off his mask after a called third strike on Matt Adams to start the inning . 	 " It had more to do with the umpire and how he mistreated one of our players
column13: " Matheny said . " It had nothing to do with the call . It had everything to do with going too far . " 	 Either way
column14: the Cubs escaped with the win . Gregg got his 16th save in 18 chances
column15: and St. Louis ' five - game winning streak ended . 	 Jackson ( 6 - 10 ) struck out five without a walk in seven innings . Starlin Castro added three singles and scored two runs for the Cubs
column16: who won for the fifth time in six games . 	 The Cardinals lost Matt Holliday to tightness in his right hamstring when he ran out a grounder in the fourth inning . 	 Rizzo delivered an RBI double in the first inning after Castro singled with one out and made it 3 - 0 in the third off Jake Westbrook ( 5 - 4 )
column17: poking a two - run single to left past a drawn - in infield . 	 That was enough for Jackson
column18: who did n't give up either a run or a walk for the first time this season . He also matched his longest outing of the year and improved to 5 - 2 in his last seven starts after opening 1 - 8 . 	 " Hopefully
column19: this is ( a sign of ) things to come in the second half
column20: " Rizzo said . 	 The Cubs made some crisp plays behind Jackson
column21: including Brian Bogusevic 's leaping catch against the center - field wall to rob Adams of an extra - base hit leading off the seventh . 	 The Cardinals had runners on first and second in the eighth after Blake Parker gave up a leadoff single to Jay and walked pinch - hitter Daniel Descalso with one out . James Russell then retired Matt Carpenter on a liner to center
column22: and Pedro Strop threw a wild pitch to put runners on second and third before Carlos Beltran struck out swinging to end the threat . 	 Westbrook went seven innings
column23: allowing three runs and seven hits . But it was a tough night for the NL Central leaders
column24: particularly with Holliday leaving the game . 	 He came up clutching his hamstring halfway to first base on a grounder to short in the fourth . He walked off gingerly after being tended to by a trainer and did n't go out to left field in the bottom half . 	 " I think I 'll have a better feel for what it looks like ( Friday )
column25: " Holliday said . " And hopefully
column26: it will be day to day and I 'll be able to use the ( All - Star ) break
column27: and it will be all right . " 	 Game notes 	 Beltran played in his 2

column1: SAN DIEGO -- Madison Bumgarner struggled in the first inning
column2: allowing two runs on three hits . 	 Then he retired 15 straight batters
column3: keeping the San Diego Padres off - balance and giving his San Francisco Giants a chance to catch up . 	 Bumgarner
column5: allowed just four hits in seven innings
column6: and Pablo Sandoval hit his first home run since May 21 as the Giants beat the Padres 4 - 2 Thursday night in a matchup of the worst teams in the weak NL West . 	 It was the third straight start in which Bumgarner snapped a four - game losing streak . 	 " That 's why he 's on the All - Star team
column9: who will lead the NL team on Tuesday night . " We needed a lift . Inauspicious start there
column10: but that 's what good pitchers do . They limit the damage . He got out of that . What was impressive about Madison he was flat the first inning until he made a nice adjustment and got in a great groove there and pitched great . 	 " Early
column11: he was getting under the ball and leaving pitches up . But he made a nice adjustment and gave us seven solid innings in a much
column12: much - needed win . " 	 Bumgarner ( 10 - 5 ) struck out six and walked one . 	 Bumgarner did n't think he made much of an adjustment . 	 " I felt I made some pretty good pitches there in the first and they just happened to hit them
column13: " he said . " I just kept making pitches and throwing strikes

column15: " Romo said . " To be able to do that tonight is big for us . We really
column16: really needed it . " 	 The defending World Series champion Giants
column17: who snapped a four - game losing streak

column19: with Bumgarner getting both wins . 	 Everth Cabrera

column24: his ninth . 	 It was Sandoval 's first homer in 101 at - bats . Sandoval
column25: who was on the disabled list from June 9 - 24 with a strained left foot

column1: CHICAGO --   Carlos Beltran had a forgettable 2
column2: 000th game in the majors on Thursday . His 2
column3: 001st might stay with him for a while . 	 After going 0 - for-4 with two strikeouts one day earlier at Wrigley Field
column4: Beltran bounced back Friday with three hits -- falling a home run short of the cycle -- and an RBI to lead the St. Louis Cardinals to a 3 - 2 win over the Chicago Cubs . 	 " Yesterday was n't a good one and today was better
column7: who had a run - scoring triple
column8: double and single . " That 's baseball . Some days you feel like you come to the ballpark and you try and nothing works out your way
column9: and today it seems like everything worked out my way . " 	 Beltran 's offense bolstered a second straight spot start for reliever - turned - starter Joe Kelly ( 1 - 3 )
column10: who won his first game of the season . 	 " I just attacked with everything -- slider
column15: " Kelly said . " When you throw a couple of those for strikes
column16: you make it easier on yourself . If you 're throwing some off - speed and command both sides of the plate with the heater
column17: it makes for a little better time out there . " 	 It was the second straight start for Kelly
column18: who had a no - decision against Miami last Saturday . He 's unsure if he 'll get another start soon or will head back to the bullpen . 	 " I do n't look too far ahead about anything
column19: " said Kelly
column20: who allowed three hits and a run in 5 1/3 innings
column21: struck out four and walked two . " I go out there and when they tell me to pitch
column22: I pitch . That 's what 's good about being versatile
column23: and I 'm just still happy to be here . " 	 Edward Mujica pitched the ninth for his 26th save in 27 opportunities . 	 Thursday 's 3 - 0 loss snapped a five - game winning streak for the Cardinals . 	 An added bonus was a seventh inning pinch - hit triple by Rob Johnson

column25: " Cardinals manager Mike Matheny said of Johnson 's clutch hit . " It 's a feel - good for a guy who 's been doing a lot of things right for us in our system . In a situation
column26: he helped us produce and we wound up getting a run out of it . " 	 St. Louis jumped on Cubs starter Carlos Villanueva ( 2 - 5 ) for two runs in the top of the first inning . Carpenter singled and scored on Beltran 's triple
column27: followed by Allen Craig 's RBI single . 	 The Cubs cut St. Louis ' lead to 2 - 1 in the third . Luis Valbuena walked
column28: went to second when Starlin Castro was hit by a pitch
column29: Anthony Rizzo hit into a fielder 's choice that pushed Valbuena to third and then Alfonso Soriano 's single scored Valbuena . 	 After Carpenter 's double scored Johnson in the seventh to make it 3 - 1

column1: BALTIMORE -- The three members of the Baltimore Orioles voted onto the All - Star team staged their own version of the Home Run Derby . 	 Chris Davis hit his 35th homer
column2: Adam Jones and J.J. Hardy each had a three - run shot
column3: and the Orioles beat Mark Buehrle and the Toronto Blue Jays 8 - 5 Friday night . 	 Davis upped his major league - leading home run total with a two - run drive in the second inning . Only Barry Bonds ( 39 in 2001 )
column4: Mark McGwire ( 37 in 1998 ) and Reggie Jackson ( 37 in 1969 ) hit more homers before the All - Star break . 	 Jones connected in the third to put the Orioles up 5 - 3
column5: and Hardy went deep in the sixth for a five - run cushion . It all added up to Baltimore 's third straight win
column6: even though Toronto outhit the Orioles 14 - 9 . 	 " But we got some big hits with people on base
column7: " manager Buck Showalter said . 	 It 's been that way all season for the Orioles

column9: Jones and Hardy . 	 All three long balls came off Buehrle

column11: " Toronto manager John Gibbons said . " They had the two big three - run homers

column13: but we just did n't score a lot . " 	 Not enough

column20: " Tillman said . " I 've said it a hundred times -- the quicker you get these guys back in the dugout and in the batter 's box

column22: Jim Johnson needed one pitch to get his 32nd save . 	 Buehrle ( 5 - 6 ) surrendered eight runs and nine hits in six innings to fall to 0 - 5 against the AL East this season . The last time the left - hander allowed eight earned runs in a game was July 12

column25: ( but ) anybody else does n't hit that ball out

column1: CLEVELAND -- Corey Kluber kept the Cleveland Indians in the game long enough to get to Kansas City 's bullpen . 	 Kluber pitched into the eighth inning and pinch - hitter Michael Bourn had a big two - run double
column2: leading the Indians to a 3 - 0 win over the Royals on Friday night . 	 Cleveland got its first hit of the game against Bruce Chen in the fifth inning
column3: but Kluber and two relievers made sure a three - run seventh was enough . Carlos Santana had an RBI single before Bourn came up his clutch swing . 	 Kluber ( 7 - 5 ) allowed three hits and struck out eight in 7 2 - 3 innings . The right - hander
column4: a bright spot in a rotation that 's struggled most of the season
column5: worked out of a bases - loaded
column6: one - out jam in the fifth . 	 " He certainly stays composed
column7: " Indians manager Terry Francona said . " For a young pitcher
column8: that 's a big compliment . " 	 Joe Smith recorded the final out in the eighth and Cody Allen struck out Jarrod Dyson with the bases loaded for his second save . The five - hitter was Cleveland 's American League - leading 12th shutout . 	 Allen was subbing for regular closer Chris Perez
column9: who had appeared in five of the previous six games . Perez was on the disabled list from May 27 to June 26 with a sore right shoulder and missed time in spring training because of the injury . 	 Allen knew before the game that Perez was unavailable but was n't sure if he would get the call in the ninth . 	 " I thought it was going to be Joe
column10: " Allen said . " I knew the possibility was there . " 	 Composure was also a key for Allen . After allowing two singles
column11: he walked pinch hitter George Kottaras but struck out Dyson to end the 32 - pitch inning . 	 " I was trying to make one good pitch at a time
column13: I did n't want to get into a bases - loaded situation but that 's where I was . " 	 Chen pitched six innings of one - hit ball in his first start of the season . Santana 's leadoff double in the fifth was Cleveland 's only hit off Chen

column1: NEW YORK -- Hiroki Kuroda returned to the mound for one more gritty inning after an extended delay . Still
column2: it might 've been more if Yankees pitching coach Larry Rothschild had n't counted all the warmup tosses the right - hander threw to keep loose during the rain . 	 Kuroda returned after a break of 73 minutes to pitch the fifth inning
column3: Robinson Cano had another big hit against the Twins and New York beat Minnesota for the fifth time in two weeks
column4: 2 - 0 Friday night . 	 Kuroda threw 90 pitches when it counted and about 20 in the batting cage while waiting out the chilly downpour . Rothschild decided that was enough work for one night . 	 " I think I gave Larry a hard time

David Robertson was perfect in the eighth and Mariano Rivera finished off the eight - hitter for his 30th save . 	 Rivera reached 30 saves for the 15th time in his career
column8: passing Trevor Hoffman for most 30 - save seasons in big league history . 	 New York was playing without captain Derek Jeter after he strained his right quadriceps in his first game this season on Thursday . Jeter will not play in this series and the Yankees will re - evaluate after the All - Star break . 	 " It 's deflating a bit

column12: " Overbay joked . " First time I ever had to deal with that . " 	 The Yankees improved to 31 - 7 against Minnesota in New York since 2002 . The Twins were coming off a four - game sweep at the hands of the Tampa Bay Rays and have lost 12 of 13 . column13: " Gardenhire said . 	 The first two times up

column17: and the atmosphere
column18: I felt like I was focused in pretty well

column25: kinda what our storyline 's been

column1: PITTSBURGH -- Jordy Mercer knows the routine . He figured it was time he experienced it for himself . 	 The Pittsburgh Pirates second baseman singled up the middle off Gonzalez Germen with two outs in the 11th inning to send teammate Andrew McCutchen sprinting home with the winning run in a 3 - 2 victory over the New York Mets on Friday night . 	 Mercer celebrated the first walk - off hit of his career and the sixth of Pittsburgh 's stunning season by flipping his bat in the air and then running for safety . 	 " You make them chase you down because you know you 're going to get punished afterward
column3: " Mercer said . " It 's all worth it in the end
column4: though . " 	 McCutchen led off the 11th with a walk
column5: stole second and then easily beat the throw home from center fielder Juan Lagares to end the Mets ' four - game winning streak . 	 The Pirates stayed one game behind St. Louis in the tight NL Central race . 	 Vin Mazzaro ( 5 - 2 ) retired all three batters he faced to earn the victory . Starling Marte had two of Pittsburgh 's six hits
column6: and Pedro Alvarez added his 24th home run . 	 Mets All - Star David Wright had two hits and extended his hitting streak to 12 games . He had an RBI single but also flied out with two runners on to end the New York 10th . Kirk Nieuwenhuis hit his third homer of the season for New York . 	 Germen ( 0 - 1 ) got only two outs in his first inning in the majors and took the loss . He struck out Alvarez and Gaby Sanchez with McCutchen on second before Mercer 's grounder slipped by shortstop Omar Quintanilla and into the outfield . 	 " He made some great pitches
column8: " Mets manager Terry Collins said of Germen . " The 3 - 1 pitch to Gaby Sanchez was about as ( gutsy ) of a pitch that you 'll ever see . " 	 The game carried a little more heat than usual between one team in the midst of a pennant race and another rebuilding . 	 Wright
column9: the starting NL All - Star third baseman and Home Run Derby captain
column10: added Alvarez to the NL 's derby roster on Thursday after Colorado 's Carlos Gonzalez pulled out because of a hand injury . 	 Still
column11: Wright 's perceived initial snub of Alvarez was n't forgotten by Pirates fans . He was booed lustily before each at bat
column12: even though he and Alvarez -- who will make his All - Star debut -- exchanged a handshake and a brief chat before the national anthem . 	 " They 're knowledgeable fans
column13: they know what 's going on and it 's cool that they 're upset and passionate about it
column14: " Wright said . " It made for a nice atmosphere . " 	 Alvarez wasted little time celebrating . One batter after Jose Tabata reached on an infield single in the bottom of the first
column15: Alvarez hit the first pitch he saw from Jeremy Hefner into the New York bullpen in center field . He trotted past Wright without looking up as the seventh sellout crowd of the season roared . 	 Alvarez
column16: a New York native
column17: dismissed any sense of payback with his blast . He considers Wright a friend and would rather focus on his breakout season . 	 " I just try to hit the pitch where it 's pitched
column18: and just trying to make good contact and really not worry about trying to put too much on the ball
column19: " he said . " You ca n't really control the home runs . I try my best to make good contact wherever the ball is . " 	 Hefner settled down and retired 14 straight after Alvarez 's homer
column20: needing just 78 pitches to get through seven innings . He allowed three hits and struck out three without issuing a walk . 	 " Last year and even at the beginning of this year I would have folded or given up more runs or whatever the case may be
column21: " Hefner said . " I 've been able to bounce back
column22: turn the page and give quality outings after giving up some runs early . " 	 It marked the eighth straight start in which Hefner gave up two earned runs or fewer
column23: the longest streak by a Mets pitcher since Johan Santana did it over 13 starts between 2008 and 2009 . 	 Pittsburgh 's Charlie Morton gave up two runs
column25: and a walk with four strikeouts in his longest start since returning from elbow surgery last month . Morton rolled through five innings before Wright delivered an RBI single in the sixth . 	 Morton 's only real mistake came on a 2 - 0 fastball that Nieuwenhuis hit into the first row of seats in right - center to tie it at 2 . 	 Game notes 	 New York right - hander Carlos Torres ( 0 - 1
column26: 0.51 ERA ) makes his first major league start in nearly three years on Saturday when he fills in for ace Matt Harvey
column27: who is dealing with a blister on his right index finger and an innings limit . Collins says Torres could earn a regular spot in the rotation . The 30 - year - old Torres has allowed just one run in 10 relief appearances since being called up from Triple - A in mid - June . A.J. Burnett ( 4 - 6
column28: 3.05 ERA ) starts for the Pirates . ... Pittsburgh wo n't send rookie RHP Gerrit Cole to Triple - A Indianapolis during the All - Star break . Cole is 4 - 2 with a 3.68 ERA since making his debut on June 11 . The right - hander started on Tuesday

column1: MIAMI -- The Miami Marlins ' rough first inning certainly did n't suggest they would eventually get the best of Stephen Strasburg and the Washington Nationals . 	 The Marlins spotted Strasburg three runs in the first
column2: but responded in a big way . 	 Marcell Ozuna drove in three runs
column3: and Giancarlo Stanton homered for the Marlins
column4: who dealt Strasburg the worst loss of his career in a 8 - 3 win over the Nationals on Friday night . 	 " Obviously
column5: that first inning was n't how anybody drew it up
column6: " Marlins manager Mike Redmond said . " I do n't think anybody anticipated that . Fortunately for us we were able to come out there and have some great at - bats . " 	 Strasburg ( 5 - 7 ) allowed a career - high seven earned runs and tied a career - high with four walks in two innings after the Nationals gave him a 3 - 0 lead . 	 " He 's been awfully good
column7: but this time was the one bad one
column8: " Nationals manager Davey Johnson said . " It was just a tough time . We got him the lead and he had some problems . " 	 It was his shortest outing since he pitched two innings on May 31 at Atlanta . He left that game early because of a lat strain that forced him to go on the disabled list . 	 " Today was one of those days where Strasburg really looked out of whack
column9: " Redmond said . 	 Washington has lost four of five . 	 Nathan Eovaldi ( 2 - 0 ) settled down after the tough first inning and held the Nationals without a run over the next five innings . He struck out five and walked four . 	 The Nationals took a 3 - 0 lead on a two - run double by Adam LaRoche and an RBI groundout by Jayson Werth . 	 " I kind of let the first inning get the best of me
column10: " Eovaldi said . " The guys picked me right back up as soon as we got in the dugout
column11: which was huge for them to put together the at - bats they did against Strasburg . " 	 It was rare run support for Strasburg
column12: who entered the game with a 2.45 ERA but was unable to hold the lead . 	 " I could n't throw a strike
column13: " Strasburg said . " It 's frustrating . Throw ball one
column14: ball two to every single batter . " 	 Strasburg walked three of the first four batters he faced
column15: and Ozuna made him pay with a bases - clearing triple to deep center field that tied the game 3 - 3 . 	 " I was facing him a couple years ago in low - A when he made a rehab start
column16: and I struck out
column17: " Ozuna said . " He threw harder before and now he is 96 sometimes -- 93
column18: 92 is the average of his fastball . He threw very hard 99
column19: 98 with a big curveball
column20: no chance to get a hit . 	 " Now we face him and I got my hit
column21: a big hit . " 	 Derek Dietrich and Eovaldi followed with RBI singles
column22: and the Marlins sent 10 batters to the plate in the first inning and led 5 - 3 . 	 " I was n't planning on going out there and giving up five runs in the first inning
column23: but it is what it is
column24: " Strasburg said . " You just have to hang in there
column25: I guess . It 's tough . It happens to everybody . It 's all about how you bounce back . " 	 Stanton 's ninth home run of the season
column26: a two - run shot into the Nationals bullpen in right field
column27: stretched Miami 's lead to 7 - 3 . 	 Adeiny Hechavarria

column2: Fla. -- Jarred Cosart had difficulty getting to sleep
column3: so he spent much of the night before his major league debut online and learned he was about to face the hottest team in baseball . 	 Turns out he had little reason to be restless . 	 The 23 - year - old Cosart took a no - hitter into the seventh inning
column4: and the Houston Astros beat AL Cy Young Award winner David Price 2 - 1 on Friday night to end the Tampa Bay Rays ' season - best
column5: eight - game winning streak . 	 " I try to stay off the Internet the day before
column6: but I could n't sleep last night
column7: " he said . " So I was messing around
column8: I looked at the Rays ' website
column11: ' all that good stuff . 	 " It 's a natural instinct . You 're like
column13: they 're good . " 	 Cosart ( 1 - 0 ) limited the Rays
column14: who have won 10 of 12 during a 14 - game stretch against the American League 's three worst teams
column15: to a pair of walks before All - Star Ben Zobrist singled with one out in the seventh . Evan Longoria grounded into a double play to end the inning . 	 Cosart also yielded a single to James Loney in the eighth and was removed after walking pinch - hitter Kelly Johnson leading off the ninth . Cosart threw 96 pitches
column16: 54 for strikes . 	 Cosart was he was " very nervous " before facing Price
column17: who reached out to him on Twitter early Friday . 	 " He tweeted at me this morning and said good luck
column18: and most of all have fun
column19: " Cosart said . " I look up to him . He 's one of the best pitchers in the game . 	 " That was my thing
column20: not to go out there and try to be David Price or beat David Price . He 's a Cy Young winner
column22: all that stuff . I knew if I did that I 'd probably overthrow . I just wanted to go out there and be myself
column23: pitch down in the zone . " 	 Carlos Corporan 's two - run
column24: first - inning single provided all the support Cosart needed to beat Price ( 3 - 5 )
column25: who allowed eight hits and struck out three in a complete - game performance . 	 Four of the five Rays who reached base against Cosart were erased by double plays . Jose Veras gave up an unearned run on Luke Scott 's two - out RBI single in the ninth
column26: but struck out Longoria with the potential tying run on third base to notch his 18th save . 	 " You watched him in spring training . The times he went out you could tell this is a special arm
column27: " Houston manager Bo Porter said . " What I like about tonight was the level of composure he displayed . 	 " I just thought he did a great job of managing his emotions and really honing in on exactly how he wanted to pitch guys . " 	 It was the second straight day that a rookie right - hander made his big league debut against a reigning Cy Young winner . Cleveland 's Danny Salazar took a no - hitter into the sixth inning of the Indians ' 4 - 2 victory over R.A. Dickey and the Toronto Blue Jays on Thursday . 	 Cosart was equally impressive after being promoted earlier Friday from Triple A Oklahoma City
column28: where he went 7 - 4 with a 3.29 ERA in 18 appearances
column29: including 17 starts . 	 He began the night by retiring nine in a row before walking Desmond Jennings to lead off the fourth . Wil Myers drew a one - out walk in the fifth
column30: but was erased when Matt Joyce grounded into an inning - ending double play . 	 Zobrist hit a one - hopper past diving second baseman Jose Altuve for Tampa Bay 's first hit . Loney singled leading off the eighth
column31: but Houston turned its third double play to thwart the prospect of a comeback . 	 Porter was reluctant to compare Cosart 's debut with those of other young pitchers who have made an early splash . 	 " I think a lot of times when you have guys come up who are top prospects
column32: one of the worst things you can do is start throwing out comparables
column33: " Porter said . " Jarred Cosart will establish who Jarred Cosart is
column34: and I want to give him an opportunity to do that . I think he has the stuff to be an elite pitcher in this league
column35: and over time he will answer all those questions . " 	 Despite a rough first inning
column36: Price was solid in his third start since rejoining the Rays from a 47 - day stay on the disabled list with a triceps strain . He beat the Astros 8 - 0 at Minute Maid Park in his return on July 2
column37: then held the Chicago White Sox to one run in a complete game victory last Sunday . 	 The Astros loaded the bases in the first on singles by Jake Elmore
column38: Chris Carter and J.D. Martinez . Corporan 's single to center produced a 2 - 0 lead . 	 Houston scattered four hits over the final eight innings
column39: but only had one runner -- Matt Dominguez
column40: who doubled leading off the fifth -- get past first base . 	 " That first inning
column41: that puts us in a hole . That 's probably part of the reason Cosart had so much success
column42: " Price said . " I gave him two runs before he made a pitch
column43: and I know the difference in having runs
column44: especially if you can get them in the first before you go out there . " 	 Game notes 	 With the All - Star break beginning Monday

column46: " Porter said . ... Astros OF Justin Maxwell
column47: on the seven - day concussion disabled list

column1: ATLANTA --   Bronson Arroyo had everything working . After the Cincinnati Reds got off to a fast start at the plate
column2: the veteran right - hander knew exactly what to do . 	 Arroyo pitched seven sparkling innings
column3: Brandon Phillips hit a two - run single in Cincinnati 's three - run first and the Reds beat the depleted Atlanta Braves 4 - 2 on Friday night . 	 Arroyo ( 8 - 7 ) allowed three hits
column4: including Brian McCann 's two - out solo homer in the seventh
column5: and walked one . 	 " I had good stuff today for the first time in a little while
column6: " Arroyo said . " I had a little bit of zip on my fastball and a little sharper breaking ball
column7: which I have n't had in a while . " 	 Arroyo had dropped two of his last three starts . But he was in control against the Braves and did n't allow a baserunner to reach second before McCann 's homer . 	 " I commanded the game the way I wanted to and the mistakes I did make they popped the balls to left field
column8: " Arroyo said . " The ball rolled my way a good bit today . It just seemed like nothing was going wrong . " 	 Sam LeCure pitched a perfect eighth and Aroldis Chapman gave up a run in the ninth before earning his 21st save . 	 Atlanta added two more names to its list of injured outfielders
column9: with brothers B.J. and Justin Upton unable to finish the loss . Jason Heyward was held out one day after he strained his right hamstring . 	 " There must be something in the water
column11: who strained his right adductor muscle in the first inning . 	 Justin Upton strained his left calf while running to first base in the seventh . The Braves ' patchwork outfield at the end of the game included Tyler Pastornicky
column12: Reed Johnson and rookie Joey Terdoslavich . 	 The team announced after the loss that Jose Constanza will be recalled from Triple - A Gwinnett before Saturday 's game . A corresponding move was not announced . 	 Pastornicky walked with two outs in the ninth and went to second on defensive indifference . He scored on Freddie Freeman 's single
column13: but McCann popped out to end the game . 	 The Reds jumped on Kris Medlen ( 6 - 9 ) right at the start . Shin - Soo Choo singled and moved to second on Derrick Robinson 's bunt single . Medlen walked Joey Votto to set up Phillips ' two - run single to center . Votto scored on Todd Frazier 's triple off B.J. Upton 's glove and left knee . 	 Upton 's right knee dug into the grass as he attempted to make the catch . He appeared to favor his right side as he walked slowly off the field
column14: accompanied by assistant trainer Jim Lovell . 	 Upton said he " kind of dove " for Frazier 's line drive . 	 " With the backdrop
column15: it 's tough to see sometimes
column16: " he said
column17: before adding the injury is " not too bad . " 	 " We 'll re - evaluate tomorrow
column18: see how it feels
column19: " he said . 	 Justin Upton said his calf " kind of locked up " as he was running to first base . 	 It was another rough night for Atlanta 's outfield
column20: forcing the Braves to consider their options with the All - Star break coming up . 	 " We 're talking through it right now
column21: " manager Fredi Gonzalez said . " We 've got three guys banged up . " 	 The list of injured outfielders actually is longer than the three starters . 	 General manager Frank Wren announced during the game that Jordan Schafer 's right ankle injury is more serious than originally believed . Schafer went on the 15 - day disabled list on July 4 with what was called an ankle contusion
column22: but a MRI on Friday revealed a stress fracture . Wren said the normal recovery period for the injury is six weeks " and he 's two to three weeks into it . " 	 Evan Gattis
column23: who has made 11 starts in left field
column24: could return from an oblique injury after the All - Star break . 	 The Reds chased Medlen in the fifth . Robinson singled and moved to third on Votto 's double before Medlen hit Phillips with a pitch to load the bases . Left - hander Alex Wood then came in and gave up a sacrifice fly to Jay Bruce . 	 Medlen was charged with four runs and nine hits . Medlen
column25: who was 4 - 1 with a 2.14 ERA in five June starts
column26: has allowed a combined 10 runs in two straight losses . 	 " I look at my mechanics after every game and I 'm doing the same thing
column27: " Medlen said . " I 'm trying to make adjustments and it comes down to
column28: in the game
column29: making the adjustments stick . It has n't gotten there for me . " 	 The Braves had only two hits before McCann 's seventh - inning homer . Medlen singled with two out in the third and Justin Upton singled to right field in the fourth . Upton was thrown out at second by Bruce . 	 Game notes 	  The run in the ninth was the first allowed by the Reds ' bullpen since June 28 at Texas . The streaks of 10 games and 33 2/3 innings with allowing a run by the bullpen set team records . ...   Reds LHP Sean Marshall threw to batters before the game . Reds manager Dusty Baker said Marshall is closer to returning from his second DL stint with a sore left shoulder . ... RHP Homer Bailey will make his second start since throwing his second career no - hitter against San Francisco on July 2 when he faces Atlanta 's Mike Minor on Saturday . column1: PHOENIX -- Patrick Corbin was all over the place at the start of the game . Fortunately for the Arizona Diamondbacks
column2: he settled down in time to put together another great performance . 	 Corbin matched a career high with 10 strikeouts for the second straight start
column3: and the Diamondbacks beat the Milwaukee Brewers 2 - 1 on Friday night . 	 Corbin ( 11 - 1 ) allowed a run and seven hits in 6 2/3 innings . The All - Star left - hander threw three wild pitches -- tying a franchise record -- hit a batter and walked two
column4: but still managed to win consecutive starts for the first time since he won seven in a row from April 28 to June 2 . 	 " Early in the count I was n't locating and they got some hits
column5: " Corbin said . " When they got some guys on I made some pitches to get out of jams . " 	 The Diamondbacks ' beleaguered bullpen managed to hold on for Arizona 's seventh victory in the last 10 games . Heath Bell escaped a jam in the eighth thanks to a diving catch by center fielder A.J. Pollock
column6: and David Hernandez finished for his second save in seven chances . 	 " I did n't have much time to think . It was a couple of steps and I was diving there . I 'm just glad I got a decent jump . " Pollock said of his big play . 	 Bell had blown a save opportunity in each of his last two outings
column7: leaving the closer spot unsettled . Bell
column9: who got two outs in the eighth
column10: came into the game with five blown saves apiece this season . 	 " That 's what we do
column12: " Hernandez said . " I 'm happy to close out a game for Pat and send him off to the All - Star Game . " 	 Milwaukee starter Tom Gorzelanny ( 1 - 3 ) pitched six effective innings on his 31st birthday
column13: but was saddled with the hard - luck loss . He allowed two unearned runs and three hits . 	 The Brewers chased Corbin in the seventh
column14: but were unable to take advantage of a prime scoring opportunity . Yuniesky Betancourt had a leadoff double and Logan Schafer followed with a base hit to right
column15: putting runners on second and third . 	 Corbin retired the next two hitters
column16: and then walked fellow All - Star Jean Segura to load the bases . Will Harris came in and struck out another All - Star
column17: Carlos Gomez
column18: to end the inning . 	 Milwaukee went 1 for 12 with runners in scoring position and left 11 on base . 	 " When it rains
column19: it pours

column1: SAN DIEGO -- The San Francisco Giants are on their first winning streak in nearly three weeks thanks to Buster Posey 's season - high five RBIs and Jose Mijares ' lights - out relief . 	 The Giants beat the San Diego Padres 10 - 1 Friday night to win consecutive games for the first time since they beat San Diego June 18 - 19 at San Francisco . Coming in
column2: the defending World Series champions had lost 16 of 20 . 	 Marco Scutaro and Brandon Crawford had three hits apiece and Gregor Blanco scored four times in San Francisco 's highest - scoring game since it beat Pittsburgh 10 - 0 on June 13 . 	 The performance of the game
column4: belonged to Mijares . 	 The Padres were trailing 5 - 1 when they chased Chad Gaudin by loading the bases on a single and consecutive walks with no outs in the sixth . But the lefty Mijares came on and retired the side on eight pitches . He got lefty Yonder Alonso to pop up to shortstop before striking out Jedd Gyorko and pinch hitter Chris Denorfia . 	 " Player of the game right there
column5: " Gaudin said . " It 's something else . " 	 Said Mijares : " I 'm ready for every pitch . I 'm ready for the lefty . That 's it . " 	 Mijares said he was n't necessarily surprised that manager Bruce Bochy left him in to face the right - handed Gyorko after he retired Alonso . 	 " I 'm ready for everything . I 'm ready for the righty
column7: " he said . 	 " That 's a huge part of the game
column8: " Padres manager Bud Black said . " The last two weeks we have not really gotten that real big hit to swing momentum to our side . " 	 Gaudin and three relievers combined on a five - hitter . 	 The Padres lost for the 17th time in 20 games and dropped a season - high 12 games under .500 . 	 Posey 's two - run double highlighted San Francisco 's five - run seventh inning
column9: when Black was thrown out . 	 Black was ejected by second base umpire Laz Diaz for arguing after Kensuke Tanaka was awarded third base on an obstruction call against third baseman Chase Headley . Tanaka was on the infield grass when he and Headley collided . 	 " The definition of obstruction is when you 're not in possession of the ball and when you 're not fielding the ball
column10: you hinder the process of the runner
column11: " crew chief Mike Winters said . " He 's throwing the ball
column12: so he 's neither of those two things apply to him . He basically has to disappear at that moment . It was a textbook obstruction case and Laz ruled it exactly
column13: 100 percent correctly . " 	 The Giants led 5 - 1 going into the seventh
column14: when Brad Brach allowed five runs on five hits and a walk . Because of the obstruction call
column15: four of the five runs were unearned . Scutaro and pinch hitter Andres Torres had RBI singles and another run scored on a wild pitch . 	 Posey also had a sacrifice fly in the third and a two - run single in the sixth . 	 Gaudin ( 3 - 1 ) improved to 3 - 0 with a 2.70 ERA in six starts since joining the rotation on June 2 . He allowed one run and three hits
column16: struck out five and walked four . 	 Sean O'Sullivan ( 0 - 1 ) lost his debut with his hometown Padres . He threw 102 pitches in five innings
column17: allowing two runs and six hits . He also doubled leading off the third . 	 O'Sullivan
column18: who graduated from Valhalla High in suburban El Cajon in 2005
column19: signed a minor league deal in December . 	 Game notes 	 The Padres made several moves before the game
column20: including moving LHP Clayton Richard to the 60 - day DL and announcing he will have season - ending surgery on his pitching shoulder . Also
column21: 1B Yonder Alonso and 2B Jedd Gyorko were activated from the 15 - day DL
column22: INF - OF Kyle Blanks was placed on the 15 - day DL with left Achilles tendinitis
column23: RHP Miles Mikolas was optioned to Triple - A Tucson and SS Pedro Ciriaco was designated for assignment . ... The four - game series continues Saturday night when Giants RHP Tim Lincecum ( 4 - 9
column25: 5.33 ERA ) . 	 Randy Arozarena hit 20 home runs and stole 20 bases this season

column1: NEW YORK -- The slumping Twins caught a couple of breaks and took advantage of that short porch in right field . Not at all what they 're accustomed to when visiting Yankee Stadium . 	 Samuel Deduno pitched seven impressive innings and Minnesota finally figured out a way to beat the New York Yankees
column2: hitting three home runs off Phil Hughes in a 4 - 1 win Saturday . 	 Trevor Plouffe
column3: Ryan Doumit and Pedro Florimon connected against Hughes -- all on 2 - 2 pitches with one out . Minnesota snapped a six - game losing streak with its second victory in 14 games
column4: winning for the first time in six meetings with the Yankees this year . 	 New York won 32 of the previous 39 matchups
column5: including a pair of playoff sweeps . 	 " It 's a big sigh of relief
column6: " Doumit said . " This has been a tough road trip
column7: no doubt . " 	 Beaten by Hughes earlier this month
column8: Deduno ( 5 - 4 ) scattered six hits in his first start at Yankee Stadium . He struck out three
column9: walked three and matched the longest outing of his career . 	 Casey Fien pitched a scoreless eighth -- with help from his shortstop . Florimon saved the reliever from a throwing error on a comebacker with nobody out . 	 All - Star closer Glen Perkins
column10: making his first appearance in a week
column11: got three outs for his 21st save in 23 chances . 	 " Exciting baseball game
column13: ejected in the eighth for arguing a call at first base . " That was needed . It 's been a tough go here to get a win
column14: so to see the guys smile again is very exciting . " 	 The Yankees
column15: who swept four games in Minnesota from July 1 - 4
column16: had won three straight and nine of 12 . 	 Hughes ( 4 - 9 ) tied a career high with 10 strikeouts in 7 1/3 innings but gave up three homers in a game for the second time this season . He has allowed 18 long balls in as many starts . 	 " I thought it was some of the better stuff he 's had all year
column17: " manager Joe Girardi said . " I think he threw the ball exceptionally well except for a few mistakes . " 	 About 13 hours after the Yankees finished a rain - delayed shutout Friday night
column18: the teams were back on the field . 	 New York jumped on top in the first inning when Ichiro Suzuki doubled and scored on Robinson Cano 's single . Deduno got Vernon Wells to ground into an inning - ending double play and settled in from there . 	 The right - hander
column19: who pitched the Dominican Republic to the World Baseball Classic championship in March
column20: received some help when Doumit caught Zoilo Almonte stealing second with a runner on third to end the fourth . Deduno struck out Suzuki with two on to finish the fifth and worked around a one - out double in the seventh . 	 " Everything was around the plate and everything was working today
column21: " Deduno said . 	 Plouffe tied it in the second on a long drive to left - center and Doumit put the Twins ahead in the seventh with a line drive to right . 	 " That 's a single at Target Field . It might be an L-9
column23: referring to Minnesota 's pitcher - friendly home . " This is a great place to hit . " 	 Gardenhire was tossed by plate umpire Vic Carapazza in the eighth after Clete Thomas and was called out for interference when Hughes ' throw to first hit him in the back and bounced away . Aaron Hicks
column24: who opened the inning with a bunt single
column25: was sent back to first base . 	 Florimon followed with his fifth home run
column26: a high fly that cleared the short porch in right to make it 4 - 1 . 	 " It 's frustrating
column27: " Hughes said . " I 've felt good with my stuff over the last three or four starts . There 's just one or two mistakes that I have to stay away from . I have a straight fastball
column28: a four - seamer
column29: that when I miss over the plate with it
column30: it leads to fly balls . I just have to concentrate on location
column31: and it comes down to execution . " 	 Game notes 	 After the game
column32: the Twins optioned RHP Michael Tonkin to Triple - A Rochester to make room for LHP Caleb Thielbar
column33: who will be reinstated from the bereavement list Sunday . ... It was Gardenhire 's 65th ejection as a manager and third this season . ... Rookie OF Oswaldo Arcia
column34: who has struck out in 11 of his last 13 at - bats
column35: was rested by the Twins . Arcia whiffed all four times up Friday night and is hitless in his last 20 at - bats . " He 's swinging at some cartoon breaking balls . He 's swinging three times at one pitch and he 's not hitting any of them
column37: who deemed it best to give Arcia a breather . " He 's got the starry eyes right now . He 's overwhelmed right now . " ... Joe Mauer had two hits as the DH and Doumit started behind the plate . ... LHP CC Sabathia ( 9 - 7

column1: PHILADELPHIA -- Alexei Ramirez watched the Chicago White Sox bullpen escape trouble and delivered when he got his chance . 	 Ramirez hit a tiebreaking double in the 11th inning to lift Chicago over the Philadelphia Phillies 5 - 4 in the opener of a day - night doubleheader Saturday . 	 After a 41 - minute rain delay following the top of the ninth
column2: White Sox righty Nate Jones escaped a no - out
column3: second - and - third jam in the bottom half . Ramon Troncoso ( 1 - 2 ) then left the winning run on third in the 10th . 	 " The last few innings
column4: guys were hanging by the skin of their teeth
column5: " White Sox manager Robin Ventura said . " It was n't pretty
column6: but it worked out . " 	 The teams were forced to play two after Friday night 's interleague game was rained out . John Lannan faces Chicago 's Hector Santiago in the nightcap
column7: which was pushed back 30 minutes . 	 Alejandro De Aza hit a two - out triple off J.C. Ramirez ( 0 - 1 ) in the 11th and Ramirez followed with a liner to right - center for his fourth hit . Ramirez then scored when shortstop Jimmy Rollins booted Alex Rios ' grounder for an error . 	 " Ramirez has been swinging the ball well
column9: " Ventura said . 	 The Phillies fell to 3 - 10 when they have a chance to move to .500 . They won consecutive series over first - place Pittsburgh and Atlanta
column10: and took three of four from defending NL East champion Washington . 	 But the inability to hit a sacrifice fly cost Philadelphia against the White Sox
column11: who entered with the third - worst record in the majors . 	 " We had some golden chances
column12: " manager Charlie Manuel said . " All we had to do was hit the ball and could n't do it . The game was sitting there for us . " 	 Jones balked runners to second and third in the ninth before retiring Carlos Ruiz on a shallow fly
column13: striking out pinch hitter Laynce Nix and getting Ben Revere on a hard liner to right . 	 The Phillies had runners on first and third with one out in the 10th
column14: but Troncoso fanned Delmon Young and Kevin Frandsen grounded out . 	 " We just needed to hit a ball somewhere
column15: make a fielder move
column16: " Manuel said . " Just needed to make contact . " 	 Addison Reed pitched the 11th for his 24th save in 28 tries . He allowed an RBI single to pinch hitter Humberto Quintero . 	 Rookie Jonathan Pettibone allowed three runs and six hits
column17: striking out six in six innings . The Phillies fell to 10 - 6 in Pettibone 's starts . 	 White Sox starter John Danks gave up three runs and eight hits in 6 1/3 innings . 	 " I think I 'm on the right track now
column18: " Danks said . " I 'll be disappointed if it does n't go right . " 	 Darin Ruf fouled off three straight pitches before driving a changeup out to straightaway center to tie it at 3 in the seventh . Ruf has two homers in 20 at - bats since being called up to replace injured slugger Ryan Howard . Ruf hit 41 homers last season
column19: including 38 at Double - A and three for the Phillies . 	 Ruf then made an over - the - shoulder
column20: sliding catch on a foul ball near the stands in the eighth . 	 Conor Gillaspie 's sacrifice fly put the White Sox up 3 - 2 in the sixth . De Aza 's two - run double in the fifth tied it . 	 The Phillies jumped ahead 2 - 0 in the first on a RBI groundout by Domonic Brown and RBI single by Young . 	 Game notes 	 Plate umpire Brian O'Nora left the game after the top of the 10th inning . There was no immediate word on the cause . ... Ruiz took a hard shot to the throat on a pitch that bounced in the dirt before striking the catcher under his mask in the seventh . He grimaced and went down to the ground briefly
column21: but stayed in . ... This is the fourth - ever series between the teams and first since the Phillies swept a three - game set in June 2007 . ... The White Sox recalled LHP Donnie Veal from Triple - A Charlotte to replace lefty Matt Thornton
column22: who was traded to Boston on Friday night . Veal retired the only batter he faced in the eighth . ... Revere extended his hitting streak to 10 games . ... Gordon Beckham has an eight - game hitting streak . ... Cole Hamels ( 4 - 11
column23: 4.17 ) goes for his third straight win in the series finale Sunday afternoon against Chicago 's Jose Quintana ( 4 - 2
column24: 3.67 ) . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column1: BALTIMORE -- The bullpen door kept swinging open
column2: and one Toronto pitcher after another made his way to the mound seeking to keep the powerful Baltimore Orioles in check . 	 Five Blue Jays relievers combined for five shutout innings
column3: and Toronto overcame home runs by Chris Davis and Adam Jones in a 7 - 3 victory Saturday . 	 J.P. Arencibia gave the Blue Jays the lead with a two - run single in the sixth
column4: Edwin Encarnacion hit his 25th homer and Maicer Izturis had three hits to help the Blue Jays secure their fourth win in 11 games . 	 But the key was the bullpen . 	 Aaron Loup ( 4 - 3 ) got the victory with 1 1/3 innings of hitless relief . Loup replaced starter Todd Redmond
column5: who allowed three runs in four innings . 	 Dustin McGowan
column6: Brett Cecil and Steve Delabar followed before Casey Janssen entered with one out in the ninth and struck out Nate McLouth and Manny Machado for his 18th save in 19 chances . 	 " The bullpen came in and there 's not much to say other than they 've really been lights out the whole year and continue to pitch that way
column7: " Arencibia said . 	 Baltimore managed only three hits over the final five innings after Davis and Jones went deep to give the Orioles a 3 - 2 lead . 	 " They hammer mistakes . If you make them against these guys
column8: they 're going to make you pay
column9: " Arencibia said . " That 's why they are as good as they are . " 	 One of the positives this season for the last - place Blue Jays has been the performance of their bullpen . When rested
column10: it 's tough to beat . 	 " Those guys have been used pretty good this year
column11: but with one more game before the ( All - Star ) break we knew we could do that today
column12: " Toronto manager John Gibbons said . 	 The strategy worked perfectly . 	 " They 've got a good bullpen
column13: " Orioles manager Buck Showalter said . " Once they got the lead there
column14: they can really match up with you . " 	 Davis increased his major league - leading home run total to 36 with his third long ball in three games
column15: a solo shot in the second inning . Reggie Jackson is the only player in AL history with more home runs before the All - Star break
column16: hitting 37 in 1969 . 	 Baltimore led 3 - 2 before the Blue Jays took the lead in the sixth against Jason Hammel ( 7 - 6 ) . Singles by Adam Lind
column17: Colby Rasmus and Izturis loaded the bases for Arencibia

column1: ATLANTA -- Mike Minor took advantage of support from unexpected sources -- a combined seven hits by three fill - in outfielders and
column3: his own two - run double . 	 Minor struggled early before recovering to throw seven strong innings
column4: and also hit a go - ahead double that led the Atlanta Braves over Homer Bailey and the Cincinnati Reds 5 - 2 Saturday . 	 The Braves
column5: who lost starting outfielders Jason Heyward
column6: B.J. Upton and Justin Upton to injuries in the first two games of the series
column7: found success with their fill - ins . Jose Constanza
column9: started in left field and hit leadoff with Reed Johnson in center and rookie Joey Terdoslavich in right . 	 The patchwork outfield combined for seven hits
column10: including three by Constanza . 	 " I feel bad for them to be hurt
column11: " Constanza said through a translator . " It 's a bad way to be called up
column12: but I was ready to come up here and help the team win . " 	 Brian McCann and Dan Uggla hit home runs
column13: but the second - string outfielders stole the show . 	 " I think Vegas lost a lot of money today when they saw our lineup
column14: " said Braves manager Fredi Gonzalez . " But you know what
column15: you ca n't judge and you ca n't handicap heart . " 	 Minor 's two - run double in the fifth inning gave Atlanta a 3 - 2 lead and provided the pitcher a rare opportunity to brag about his batting skills
column16: even though he was hitting only .086 before the at - bat . 	 " Oh yeah
column17: every time I go up there I think I 'm going to hit the ball
column18: " Minor said with a slight smile . 	 " No
column19: actually I thought it was a fastball and it was a slider . " 	 Minor ( 9 - 4 ) snapped a streak of five straight starts without a win . The left - hander allowed two runs on six hits and one walk -- including only one hit in his last five innings . 	 Minor 's two - run double in the fifth gave the Braves a 3 - 2 lead . 	 Bailey ( 5 - 8) lost his second straight start since throwing his second career no - hitter on July 2 . He faded after being given an early 2 - 0 lead
column20: allowing four runs on 10 hits in six innings . 	 Bailey said he was hurt by infield singles and ground balls
column21: including Minor 's double that skipped down the line . 	 " It was just one of those days
column22: " Bailey said . " It just seems like I 've had a lot of one - of - those days . " 	 Minor appeared headed toward a short outing when he threw 51 pitches in the first two innings . He gave up singles to Shin - Soo Choo and Joey Votto and walked Brandon Phillips to load the bases with one out in the first . Minor escaped by striking out Jay Bruce and ending the inning on Todd Frazier 's liner to third base . 	 " It 's disheartening to see it happening over and over again
column23: " Reds manager Dusty Baker said of the wasted scoring opportunity . " ( Minor ) was n't sharp . We had him on the ropes and then we came out with nothing . His pitch count was high
column24: then he settled down in the middle innings and was extremely tough on us . " 	 The Reds took a 2 - 0 lead in the second . Zack Cozart tripled
column25: Chris Heisey doubled and Choo hit an RBI single . 	 Minor then recorded 11 consecutive outs
column26: providing his teammates an opportunity to rally . 	 After McCann 's 12th homer in the fourth
column27: the Braves took the lead with two runs in the fifth . Johnson singled
column28: Terdoslavich hit his first career double and Minor followed with a sharp grounder down the left - field line that drove in both runners . 	 Constanza hit an RBI single in the sixth . Uggla hit his 17th homer off Alfredo Simon in the seventh . 	 Braves reliever Luis Avilan walked Votto and gave up a single to Phillips with two outs in the eighth . Bruce ended the inning with a fly ball . 	 Craig Kimbrel struck out Frazier
column29: Cozart and pinch hitter Xavier Paul in the ninth for his 26th save . 	 Braves manager Fredi Gonzalez said before the game he is confident Heyward can recover from his strained right hamstring by resting through the All - Star break . Gonzalez said the " trickiest " injury is Justin Upton 's left calf strain . He said calf injuries can be nagging . 	 B.J. Upton

column2: Fla. -- Luke Scott downplayed his contribution to Tampa Bay 's win . 	 Scott hit a two - run homer and a go - ahead RBI single Saturday but he credited the efforts of his Rays ' teammates in a 4 - 3 victory over the Houston Astros . 	 Trailing 3 - 0
column3: Scott hit a two - run homer off Houston starter Dallas Keuchel in the fifth . Yunel Escobar then had a two - out double
column4: stole third and scored on Desmond Jennings ' RBI bunt single . 	 In the sixth

column12: a wild pitch or anything could score me

column1: CLEVELAND --   Lonnie Chisenhall kept his head up when he was handed a ticket back to the minor leagues in May. The Cleveland Indians are glad he did . 	 Chisenhall 's first career grand slam was the key hit in Saturday night 's 5 - 3 win over the Kansas City Royals . 	 The sixth - inning drive off Jeremy Guthrie broke open a 1 - 0 game and hit off the facing of the second deck in right field
column2: landing in Kansas City 's bullpen . 	 " It 's a good feeling
column3: probably the best one of my career so far
column4: especially being my first grand slam
column5: " Chisenhall said . " It was a big game for us . " 	 Scott Kazmir ( 5 - 4 ) allowed two runs in 6 1/3 innings for his first victory since June 21 as the Indians won for the fifth time in seven games . Cleveland is 50 - 44 and trails Detroit by 1 1 - 2 games in the American League Central going into the final game before the All - Star break Sunday . 	 Miguel Tejada 's RBI single in the seventh broke a streak of 22 consecutive scoreless innings for Kansas City
column6: which has lost four in a row . Alcides Escobar 's infield hit with the bases loaded added two runs in the inning . 	 Chris Perez
column7: pitching for the sixth time in eight days
column8: worked the ninth for his 12th save . 	 Chisenhall
column9: the Indians ' No . 1 draft pick in 2008
column10: began the season as Cleveland 's starting third baseman but was sent to Triple - A Columbus on May 15
column11: batting .213 . He 's hitting .292 with three homers and 14 RBIs since being recalled on June 18 . 	 " Nobody wants to go down but I knew at some point I was going to start hitting the ball
column12: " Chisenhall said . " It was their decision . I did all I could to work hard in Triple - A so I could help the major league team when I got back . " 	 Indians manager Terry Francona sees a difference in Chisenhall since his return . 	 " When he 's getting balls to hit he 's not fouling them
column13: " Francona said . " Sometimes you get one pitch to hit in an at - bat . Now he 's getting it and hitting it . " 	 Jason Kipnis ' sacrifice fly in the third gave Cleveland the lead . That began a stretch that saw Guthrie ( 8 - 7 ) retire nine straight
column14: which Kipnis ended with a leadoff single in the sixth . Michael Brantley 's one - out double moved Kipnis to third and Carlos Santana was intentionally walked . 	 Guthrie struck out Jason Giambi on a 3 - 2 pitch but Chisenhall teed off on his next delivery . The home run was the 22nd allowed by Guthrie
column15: tying him for the American League lead . 	 " It was a curveball that stayed up
column16: so that 's my fault
column17: but any time a guy hits a first - pitch breaking ball for a home run
column18: he 's done a pretty good job
column19: " Guthrie said . 	 Kazmir remained unbeaten at Progressive Field this season
column20: going 5 - 0 in eight starts . The left - hander walked the first two hitters in the seventh . Tejada 's one - out single off Matt Albers scored Salvador Perez before David Lough grounded out . After Alex Gordon was intentionally walked
column21: Escobar beat out a slow groundball to shortstop Asdrubal Cabrera as two runs scored . 	 Rich Hill struck out Eric Hosmer to end the inning . Vinnie Pestano worked out of a two - on
column22: one - out jam in the eighth
column25: made a diving grab of Tejada 's line drive . 	 " It feels good to go out there and throw strikes
column26: " Kazmir said . " I feel like I 've been a little more consistent . " 	 Guthrie allowed five runs and eight hits in seven innings . He 's recorded one win since June 10
column27: a stretch of six starts . 	 Kipnis
column28: who will be making his first All - Star appearance Tuesday in New York
column29: was 3 for 3 with an RBI and stolen base . 	 Cabrera
column30: who was 1 for 3 with a walk
column31: has been the subject of trade rumors . Media reports have said the Indians and St. Louis are discussing a deal that would send the two - time All - Star to the Cardinals in exchange for pitching help . The Indians entered play Saturday ranked 12th in the American League in ERA . 	 The rumors involving Cabrera

column1: DETROIT -- For the first time in more than nine months
column2: Max Scherzer stood in front of his locker as the losing pitcher
column3: trying to explain what went wrong . 	 " I threw some good pitches
column4: they hit it . I threw some bad pitches
column6: " the Detroit right - hander said . " It 's a loss . That 's what happens when you do n't quite pitch as well . " 	 Scherzer allowed four runs in the middle innings
column8: the AL Central - leading Tigers did n't back him with much offensive support
column9: falling to the Texas Rangers 7 - 1 Saturday night . It was Scherzer 's first defeat since Sept. 23 . In between
column10: he went 22 starts -- 19 in the regular season and three in the postseason -- without a loss . 	 Scherzer ( 13 - 1 ) was trying to become the first pitcher in the majors to start 14 - 0 since Roger Clemens in 1986 . He allowed four runs and eight hits in six innings
column11: walking two and striking out six . 	 The defeat came in his final start before the All - Star Game -- he could start the event next Tuesday night at Citi Field in New York . 	 " He probably was n't as dominant
column12: but he still gave us a chance to win and kept us close
column13: " outfielder Torii Hunter said . " We just could n't get any run support for him . Tonight
column14: we failed him . " 	 Mitch Moreland 's two - run homer in the fourth gave Texas a 3 - 0 lead
column15: and Derek Holland ( 8 - 4 ) was sharp for the Rangers . He allowed a run and five hits in seven innings . 	 Adrian Beltre added a two - run homer in a three - run ninth for Texas . 	 Scherzer entered the day leading the majors in run support
column16: and that was no small reason for his unblemished record . He struck out three in the first . 	 Jurickson Profar 's line drive in the second caught Scherzer in the left wrist
column17: and he showed reporters his bruised non - throwing arm afterward . The Detroit pitcher threw to first to retire Profar and was able to keep going . 	 " Right on the bone
column18: " he said . " Obviously it was n't broken but it just affected how -- you never realize how much you use your glove to pull through with your body . I was still able to pitch and pitch effectively and hit my spots
column19: but it changed kind of how my mechanics worked . " 	 The Rangers finally put his streak in jeopardy in the fourth . 	 Nelson Cruz led off with a double
column20: advanced to third on a groundout and scored on a sacrifice fly by A.J. Pierzynski . Scherzer then walked Elvis Andrus
column21: and that came back to haunt him when Moreland lifted a drive to left - center for his 13th homer of the season . 	 Hernan Perez hit an RBI single in the bottom of the inning
column22: but Pierzynski 's RBI bloop double in the fifth made it 4 - 1 . 	 Scherzer did extend one streak . He 's struck out at least six hitters in all 19 starts this year . When he walked off the mound after the third out of the sixth
column23: a few fans behind the Detroit dugout gave him a nice ovation
column24: presumably sensing his night was done . 	 Scherzer threw a season - high 122 pitches . 	 Holland
column25: meanwhile
column26: lowered his ERA to 3.08
column27: which is actually better than Scherzer 's mark of 3.19 . Holland started the Rangers ' 11 - 8 victory over Detroit on May 19
column28: allowing two of Miguel Cabrera 's three homers in that game . He kept the Tigers quiet Saturday in front of a sellout crowd of 44
column29: 061 at Comerica Park . 	 Holland walked five and struck out seven . 	 " Scherzer was 13 - 0 for a reason . He 's got great stuff
column30: " Holland said . " Today I made pitches when I needed to and I thought my defense did a great job making plays and saving me . It 's up there with the big games this year . " 	 Texas starters are only 10 - 13 since the beginning of June
column31: even after Holland 's solid performance . 	 Detroit 's rotation
column33: has been among the best in the game -- and Scherzer has certainly contributed his share . He 's a big part of the Tigers ' efforts to win their third straight division title . 	 " I believe in my talents and I believe going forward that I 'm going to put together other streaks as well
column34: " Scherzer said . 	 Game notes 	 Ian Kinsler set a Rangers ' record with his 162nd career steal
