column1: NEW YORK -- Mariano Rivera was all set up to save his final All - Star Game -- or so it seemed . 	 Jim Leyland just was n't about to take that chance . 	 Summoned in the eighth inning to make certain he would pitch
column2: Rivera soaked up a 90 - second standing ovation and got three straight outs while helping the American League to a 3 - 0 victory over the National League on Tuesday night at Citi Field . 	 " I think the plan was perfect
column4: who took home the MVP trophy . 	 Rivera reported early for work
column5: and the New York Yankees ' indomitable closer combined with nine other pitchers on a three - hitter as the AL snapped a three - game skid and regained home - field advantage in the World Series . Joe Nathan saved it in Rivera 's place after the AL scratched out a pair of runs and got an RBI double from Jason Kipnis . 	 Leyland
column7: had promised Rivera would pitch . So rather than risk waiting for a save opportunity that might never come
column8: the Detroit Tigers ' skipper made his much - awaited call one inning earlier than Rivera is accustomed to
column9: just in case of " something freaky . " 	 " If anybody ever messed up Mariano Rivera
column10: I can lay claim to that
column11: " Leyland said . " I just could n't take any chance . You know
column12: I 'm probably not the most popular manager in baseball . I wanted to make sure I got out of here alive . " 	 Robinson Cano hobbled off early after getting hit by a pitch from crosstown rival Matt Harvey of the host Mets . X - rays were negative
column13: and Cano said he should n't miss any games for the Yankees . 	 Harvey and opposing starter Max Scherzer were among a record 39 first - time All - Stars in a game that featured four precocious players 21 or younger -- baseball 's next generation . 	 Both came out throwing 99 - mph heat
column15: at 43 the oldest All - Star since Carlton Fisk in 1991
column16: who was the center of attention in his farewell season . And on this night
column17: with drug suspensions still looming for some of the game 's biggest names
column18: the spotlight found a player who is almost universally respected . 	 Baseball 's career saves leader came in from the bullpen to Metallica 's " Enter Sandman
column19: " just like he does across town at Yankee Stadium
column20: and was left alone on the field to take in a stirring ovation . 	 " It was a great moment . He is one of the best pitchers that 's ever played this game
column21: " Tigers outfielder Torii Hunter said . 	 All - Stars on both sides clapped from the top of the dugout steps
column22: and Rivera tipped his cap to the crowd . 	 Then he went to work
column23: retiring three straight hitters on 16 pitches -- all cutters
column24: as usual -- before walking off to another ovation and receiving a hug from Detroit ace Justin Verlander . 	 " It was tough . It was special
column25: " an emotional Rivera said . " Seeing the fans sharing and both teams standing out of the dugout -- managers
column26: coaches
column27: players . Priceless . " 	 Exit
column28: Sandman . 	 Next stop
column29: the Hall of Fame . 	 The game 's greatest reliever
column30: quiet and humble by nature
column31: addressed his AL teammates before they took the field . He made it quick
column32: just like his outing . Most of them
column33: actually . 	 " What I said was that I was honored and it was a privilege for me to play with all of them for so many years
column35: the lengthy cheers provided a fitting tribute and the latest salute to Rivera
column36: set to retire after this season . The 13 - time All - Star is on something of a farewell tour
column37: receiving creative gifts at each opposing ballpark he visits for the final time . 	 He got a rocking chair built out of broken bats in Minnesota
column38: a decorated surfboard and bottle of wine in Oakland . 	 The last time he was at Citi Field
column40: things did n't go so well . He was honored by the Mets before a game in late May
column41: threw out a ceremonial first ball -- and then had his first blown save of the year . 	 While other All - Stars wore flashy spikes
column42: Rivera stayed with traditional black . No surprise for Mr. Steady . 	 Rivera has never allowed an earned run in nine All - Star innings . The only older pitcher to appear in an All - Star Game was 47 - year - old Satchel Paige 60 years ago . 	 " First class all the way
column43: " Mets captain David Wright said . " Well deserving for Mariano . I was on the top step clapping and cheering as loud as I could . " 	 Winning pitcher Chris Sale from the Chicago White Sox worked two perfect innings for the AL
column44: which posted its third shutout and first since 1990 at Wrigley Field to trim the NL lead to 43 - 39 - 2 in All - Star Games . 	 The NL did n't manage a baserunner until Carlos Beltran 's one - out single in the fourth . 	 It was the ninth All - Star Game in New York -- most for any city -- and second in five years after a farewell to old Yankee Stadium in 2008 . But the only other time the Mets hosted was during Shea Stadium 's debut season in 1964
column45: when Philadelphia Phillies outfielder Johnny Callison hit a game - ending homer in the ninth . 	 This one gave the struggling Mets a chance to pack their cozy ballpark for one of the few times all season . Fans chanted Harvey 's name during pregame introductions
column46: and the 24 - year - old sensation delivered with three strikeouts in two shutout innings . 	 He walked off to a standing ovation and received a pat on the back from NL manager Bruce Bochy of the San Francisco Giants
column47: the defending World Series champions . 	 Harvey was the youngest All - Star starting pitcher since former Mets ace Dwight Gooden was 23 a quarter - century ago -- and the first from the home team since Houston 's Roger Clemens in 2004 . Gooden cheered Harvey on from the stands . 	 All the buildup might have made the phenom a little too excited at the start . Mike Trout doubled inside first base on his opening pitch
column48: and Harvey drilled Cano just above the right knee with a 96 - mph fastball on the third . 	 In obvious pain
column49: Cano initially stayed in the game but limped off after Triple Crown winner Miguel Cabrera struck out -- just as he did against Harvey in spring training . 	 Cano crossed in front of the mound while heading to the dugout
column50: and Harvey patted himself on the chest . 	 " I did n't mean to

column1: WASHINGTON --   Andre Ethier thought it was gone . Then he was n't so sure . 	 Leading off the ninth in a tie game
column2: Ethier pulled Rafael Soriano 's two - strike slider and watched it sail through the oppressive
column3: humid July air in the nation 's capital . It barely cleared the high wall
column4: with right fielder Jayson Werth a helpless spectator for the deciding blow in the Los Angeles Dodgers ' back - from - the - break 3 - 2 win Friday night over the Washington Nationals . 	 " I was jogging at first
column5: " Ethier said . " I saw the outfielder get to the wall real quick
column6: Werthy there . ... When he did that I actually starting running real hard because I thought maybe it was going to go off ( the wall ) . " 	 Hanley Ramirez also homered
column7: and overnight sensation Yasiel Puig made a highlight throw and an even better catch for the Dodgers
column8: who picked up where they left off before the All - Star break

column11: " Ethier said . " It was really tough to get that confident
column12: good feeling going . Hopefully we can keep it going . " 	 The Nationals were hoping to make up ground in the NL East as they began a season - long
column14: they lost for the sixth time in eight games to fall back to .500 and into third place
column15: trailing the first - place Atlanta Braves by seven games . 	 They also resumed their habit of failing to support Stephen Strasburg
column16: whose ERA dropped to 2.97 to go with his 5 - 7 record . The two - run homer by Ramirez accounted for the right - hander 's only runs allowed over seven innings

column21: who hit a shallow fly ball for the second out in the inning . " We just did n't get it done . " 	 The Nationals were 1 for 9 with runners in scoring position . column22: " Johnson said . " We swung the bats pretty good
column23: but it leaves a tough taste in your mouth . " 	 Compounding things was the second ninth - inning homer allowed by Soriano ( 1 - 2 ) in three appearances . 	 " I do n't know how he hit the ball . ... When I make good pitch and the hitter hit the ball good like tonight
column25: " Soriano said . 	 Ronald Belisario ( 4 - 5 ) faced only one batter to get the win

column1: BOSTON -- Jacoby Ellsbury started off the second half for the Boston Red Sox in the best possible way . 	 Ellsbury hit Andy Pettitte 's second pitch of the game over the right - field bullpen
column2: and Jonny Gomes added a two - run shot in the second inning to help the Red Sox return from the All - Star break with a 4 - 2 victory over the depleted New York Yankees on Friday night . 	 " It seems like he 's been hitting .700
column3: " Red Sox manager John Farrell said . " His timing has been much more Jacoby - like . And his ability to get on base speaks for itself with the havoc he can create . " 	 Felix Doubront outpitched Pettitte in the opener of the three - game series to help AL East - leading Boston maintain a 2-game lead over Tampa Bay in the division and open a seven - game cushion over its fourth - place rivals from New York . 	 " You ca n't take too much of it
column4: but obviously this is an important stretch for us that we are in
column5: " Yankees manager Joe Girardi said . " We understand that . The next three teams we play are all in front of us . We need to play well . " 	 Ellsbury also singled in the third inning and reached on a walk in the seventh to support Doubront ( 7 - 3 )
column6: who allowed three or fewer earned runs for the 12th start in a row . Doubront has six quality starts against the Yankees in six tries . 	 The last Red Sox pitcher to open his career with as many quality starts
column7: defined as six innings pitched and three or fewer runs allowed
column8: against the Yankees was Dutch Leonard -- in 1913 - 15 . 	 " Look at the last two months . He 's pitched extremely well since the end of May
column9: " Girardi said . " And he 's been tough on us . " 	 Ellsbury hit .360 in June and is batting .370 in July
column10: putting together a 19 - game hitting streak that was snapped just before the break . He had three hits in the first - half finale
column11: then went 2 for 3 on Friday night to raise his average to .308 . 	 " Not the way you want to start the second half
column12: first batter of the game hitting a home run off you
column13: " Pettitte said . " Ca n't keep going out there and giving up 2 - 3 - 4 runs in the first or second inning . ... The long ball hurt me . " 	 Doubront held a Yankees lineup without Derek Jeter and a handful of other regulars hitless until Lyle Overbay doubled to lead off the fifth inning . In all
column14: the Red Sox left - hander gave up two runs -- one earned -- on three hits and three walks while striking out five in 6 1/3 innings . 	 Koji Uehara pitched the ninth for his ninth save . 	 Pettitte ( 7 - 7 ) gave up four runs on six hits and a walk
column15: striking out four in 6 1/3 innings . 	 Three days after the New York Mets showed their support for the city in the wake of the Boston Marathon bombings by playing " Sweet Caroline " at the All - Star game
column16: the Red Sox thanked the Yankees by playing " New York
column17: New York . " 	 The Yankees made their first visit to Fenway Park this season for the first game after the break
column18: and Robinson Cano played after being hit on the knee by a pitch in the All - Star game . But the lineup barely resembled the team New Yorkers thought would be wearing pinstripes at this point in the season . 	 Jeter was placed on the disabled list before the game -- he 's spent all but one game there this season -- and the Yankees are also missing third baseman Alex Rodriguez
column19: first baseman Mark Teixeira ( wrist surgery )
column20: outfielder Curtis Granderson ( broken pinkie ) and catcher Francisco Cervelli ( broken hand ) . 	 The lineup was further depleted when left fielder Zoilo Almonte came out of the game in the fifth inning with a left ankle sprain ; X - rays were negative . And center fielder Brett Gardner took himself out when
column21: after being called out on a 3 - 2 pitch to end the top of the fifth
column22: he slammed his helmet on the ground and was ejected by home plate umpire Mike Everitt . 	 " I have to have better control of my emotions . I put us in a bad spot and caused some guys to play out of position
column23: " Gardner said . " I was frustrated . I feel I let the team down and I 'm sorry for that . " 	 That left the Yankees ill - equipped to come back after Boston took a 3 - 0 lead on the homers . 	 New York made it 3 - 1 when Gardner walked
column24: stole second and scored when he stole third and catcher Jarrod Saltalamacchia 's throw went into left field . Chris Stewart doubled home Overbay in the fifth to cut the deficit to one run . 	 The Red Sox added a run in the seventh
column25: then Ichiro Suzuki singled over the shortstop 's glove and Cano doubled to put runners on second and third with one out in the eighth . But Craig Breslow got Vernon Wells to fly out weakly to short and Luis Cruz grounded to shortstop ; Jose Iglesias ' throw pulled first baseman Mike Napoli off the bag
column26: but he made the tag for the third out . 	 Game notes 	 The Yankees put Jeter on the disabled list before the game with a strained right quadriceps . ... The Yankees signed INF Brent Lillibridge from Triple - A Scranton / Wilkes - Barre . ... It was the third homer against him by a lefty in his last four starts . ... Boston OF Shane Victorino left the game with left hamstring tightness . ... It was the latest the Yankees have played their first game of the season at Fenway
column27: except for the strike - shortened season of 1981 . ... The Red Sox placed RHP Andrew Bailey on the 15 - day disabled list ( retroactive to July 13 ) with a right shoulder strain . To fill his spot on the 25 - man roster

column1: CINCINNATI --   Brandon Phillips had to move into the cleanup spot because of an injury on opening day . He 's swinging like he belongs there . 	 The All - Star second baseman drove in three runs with a bases - loaded double on Friday night
column2: and Mike Leake got the better of left - hander Francisco Liriano for the third time this season
column3: leading the Cincinnati Reds to a 5 - 3 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates that tightened the NL Central . 	 The third - place Reds moved to within three games of second - place Pittsburgh . The Pirates lead their season series 6 - 5 . 	 The Reds sent nine batters to the plate for four runs in the fifth off Liriano ( 9 - 4 )
column4: who had his shortest outing of the season . Chris Heisey 's infield single drove in the first run
column5: and Phillips ' double off Justin Wilson made it 5 - 0 . 	 It also gave Phillips 77 RBIs this season
column6: among the best in baseball . 	 " Wow
column7: " Phillips said . " My teammates put me in a great situation
column8: and I was able to come through . It 's my job to try to drive men in . I 've been doing it all year . That 's what it 's all about . " 	 Phillips ' excellence with runners on base has helped the Reds get through the loss of cleanup hitter Ryan Ludwick
column9: who tore cartilage in his right shoulder while sliding into base on opening day . 	 " He 's been our RBI clutch man all season
column10: " manager Dusty Baker said . " You certainly need a guy like that in the middle of your lineup
column11: because he 's going to come up with men on base . " 	 Heisey also had a solo homer off Liriano
column12: who is 0 - 3 in three starts against Leake and the Reds this season . Liriano did n't have much control during his first start in nine days . 	 " One of those days I did n't get any rhythm
column13: " Liriano said . " I tried to make good pitches and it did n't work out . Everything was up . " 	 Leake ( 9 - 4 ) gave up solo homers to Starling Marte
column14: Andrew McCutchen and Russell Martin in the sixth inning . Manny Parra fanned Pedro Alvarez with runners on second and third to end the seventh . 	 Aroldis Chapman struck out two in the ninth while getting his 22nd save in 25 chances . 	 The Ohio River rivals have produced the majors ' most painful pairings this season . Nineteen batters have been hit by pitches -- the Reds 10 times
column15: the Pirates nine times -- in their 11 games . Nobody was hit on Friday
column16: a rare game that did n't leave a mark . 	 The Pirates emerged from the All - Star break with their best record in 37 years . Their 56 wins were their most at the break since the World Series champion Pirates of 1971 had 57 wins . 	 Pittsburgh 's overriding question : Can it avoid another second - half meltdown and break a two - decade streak of losing ? 	 The Reds are trying to duplicate what they did last season
column17: when they went on a surge after the break and ran away to the NL Central title . First
column18: they need to get healthy . Top starter Johnny Cueto
column19: set - up men Sean Marshall and Jonathan Broxton
column20: and Ludwick are still on the disabled list . 	 " That 's a great win to start the second half of the season
column21: " Phillips said . " We 're playing a great team . It 's time to have some fun and wipe out the mistakes of the first half . " 	 Heisey took over in left field when Ludwick got hurt
column22: then pulled his right hamstring and missed nearly two months . His solo shot on Friday gave him three homers since his return . 	 Shin - Soo Choo singled during Cincinnati 's four - run fifth
column23: extending his hitting streak to 13 games
column24: matching his career high . 	 Phillips ' decisive double came a few hours after a magazine released an interview with the All - Star second baseman in which he said he 's still " scarred " by the Reds ' decision to give Joey Votto a 10 - year
column25: $ 225 million extension in 2012 while he was in tough negotiations for an extension of his own . Votto said he understood Phillips ' opinion and appreciated his honesty . 	 Game notes 	  Pirates 2B Neil Walker started a rehab assignment with Triple - A Indianapolis on Friday . He 'll play three games and get evaluated . He 's been on the 15 - day DL since June 7 with soreness in his right side . ... 1B Garrett Jones ' error ended Pittsburgh streak of 41 innings without one
column26: matching their season high . ... The Reds called up INF Neftali Soto from Triple - A Louisville
column27: filling the spot opened when LH Tony Cingrani was sent down on Wednesday . ... Baker said LH reliever Sean Marshall suffered a " minor setback " in his throwing program . Marshall has been on the DL since April 10 with a sore pitching shoulder . 	 The Yankees hired former Mets manager Luis Rojas as their new third - base coach on Monday . column2: Texas -- Nick Markakis is considered to be one of the Baltimore Orioles best players
column3: even if he is n't one of their five All - Stars . 	 Markakis had an RBI double and saved a run with a home run - robbing catch for the Orioles in a 3 - 1 victory over the Texas Rangers on Friday night . 	 " That was a great play . ... He had a big part in the game tonight
column5: who had an RBI double for the Orioles . " As far as right fielders
column6: he 's about as good as they come . He can swing the bat a little
column7: too . " 	 Matt Wieters homered and Wei - Yin Chen ( 5 - 3 ) pitched into the seventh inning as the Orioles gave Buck Showalter his 250th victory since being hired by the team in July 2010 . 	 Showalter joined Joe Torre
column8: Gene Mauch and Dick Williams as the only major league managers to win 250 games with at least four different teams . Showalter won more than 250 games with the New York Yankees ( 1992 - 95 )
column10: where he was replaced by current Rangers manager Ron Washington . 	 " You had to mention four different teams . Count the losses
column11: I probably have as many of them
column12: " Showalter said . " Been fortunate to have good players . Tonight was a good example of that . " 	 Baltimore never trailed after Wieters ' 13th homer
column13: a solo shot in the second . After No . 9 hitter Brian Roberts walked to lead off the third
column14: he scored on McLouth 's double for a 2 - 0 lead . 	 The run - saving grab by right fielder Markakis came when Adrian Beltre led off the Texas fourth . Markakis leaped and stuck his glove above the 8 - foot wall to make the catch . 	 " I feel Beltre 's pain
column15: but it was a great play by Nick
column16: " All - Star shortstop J.J. Hardy said . " ( Markakis ) has been the guy for eight years and never been an All - Star . We all recognize it and I think the fans do too . " 	 Left - hander Chen allowed only one run and eight hits and two walks over 6 1/3 innings . Jim Johnson worked the ninth for his majors - best 34th save even after allowing a hit and hitting a batter . 	 Rangers left - hander Derek Holland ( 8 - 5 ) allowed three runs and six hits in an eight - inning span when he threw 119 pitches . He struck out six and walked three . 	 " I thought he threw the ball extremely well . He certainly threw it well enough that on any other night he might have got a victory
column17: " said manager Ron Washington
column18: who visited Holland on the mound in the eighth . " When I went out there
column19: I was just going out there to see how he felt . " 	 Orioles ' All - Star slugger Chris Davis
column20: the major league leader with 37 home runs
column21: was 0 - for-4 with three strikeouts . The Texas native traded to Baltimore from the Rangers nearly two years ago did have a nice play at first base when he reached into the seats to catch Beltre 's foul pop leading off the eighth . 	 Manny Machado reached on a two - out infield single in the fifth and scored on the double by Markakis
column22: the seventh overall draft pick by Baltimore in 2003 . 	 Jeff Baker and Craig Gentry both returned to the Texas lineup after being activated from the disabled list
column23: and produced the Rangers run . 	 Baker had two hits and was involved in unusual plays while running the bases after both . 	 After his single in the fourth
column24: Mitch Moreland drew a walk . Baker was jogging toward second base when Chen has his head down kicking dirt on the front of the mound and All - Star third baseman Machado was way off his base and not watching . So Baker took off for the third
column25: and was credited with a stolen base before scoring on Gentry 's sacrifice fly . 	 " As soon as I saw him put his head down
column26: I just went and I was able to get in there pretty easy
column27: " Baker said . " I probably get one a year . You do n't have to be really fast to be a good base runner . " 	 Baker was at first after a leadoff single in the sixth when Gentry doubled into the right - center field gap . Baker was already rounding third base hard with coach Gary Pettis waving him home before the coach suddenly throwing up a stop sign . Baker tried to scamper back but was thrown out on an 8 - 6 - 5 play . 	 " I see him waving me
column28: " Baker said . " Then I hit the bag
column29: then I see him put up the stop sign and I tried to get back the best I could and they had me . " 	 Game notes 	 Texas has lost five of its past six games . ... column1: CHICAGO -- Brian McCann picked up where he left off before the All - Star break . 	 McCann hit his third homer in as many games to put Atlanta ahead and Tim Hudson ( 7 - 7 ) earned his third straight win to give the NL East - leading Braves a 6 - 4 win over the Chicago White Sox on Friday night . 	 After homers in his last two games before the break

column12: but when I have pitched here it has n't been too pretty at times . It 's nice to finally get in the right column . " 	 White Sox starter John Danks ( 2 - 7 ) took his seventh loss in his last 10 starts . Danks pitched seven innings

column25: his first of three hits
column26: advancing Phegley to second
column27: and then Alex Rios followed with a two - run double deep to right - center . 	 White Sox manager Robin Ventura pulled Rios out of the game after the sixth because he felt his player did n't give full effort running to first in that double play . 	 " We just expect more than that
column28: " Ventura said . " There is just expectations and we are not starting the second half off that way . It was simple

column31: 3 - 2 pitch for his 13th home run

Jeff Keppinger 's bloop single to right scored Ramirez . 	 The Braves added an insurance run in the ninth when Upton singled off White Sox reliever Matt Lindstrom

column1: MILWAUKEE -- Brewers manager Ron Roenicke knows there 's only one way Milwaukee is going to salvage the season . Kyle Lohse did his part . 	 Juan Francisco and Carlos Gomez each hit home runs and Lohse blanked Miami for six innings as the Brewers started the second half of the season with a 2 - 0 victory over the Marlins on Friday night . 	 " It felt good to get the second half started this way
column2: " Lohse said . " We just to keep playing some clean games and just keep it going . " 	 Lohse ( 6 - 7 ) has owned the Marlins over his career . He came in 5 - 2 in nine starts
column3: including a 3 - 0 record with the St. Louis Cardinals last season . He was in command all the way this time
column5: allowed five hits but no walks . It was his fourth win in his last five decisions . 	 The Brewers ( 39 - 56 ) are 17 games below .500 and last in the NL Central . The victory over the lowly Marlins started them on their way . 	 " I want to play good baseball
column6: " Roenicke said . " We played good baseball tonight . " 	 Francisco hit an opposite - field home run in the fourth
column7: driving a 3 - 2 pitch from Jacob Turner ( 3 - 2 ) into the left - field seats . 	 Gomez
column8: fresh off his first All - Star appearance
column10: 0 - 2 pitch around the left - field foul pole in the fifth inning . He flipped his bat and hesitated
column11: watching the ball sail toward the second tier in left
column12: before racing full speed around the bases . 	 Francisco has 12 home runs and Gomez 15 this season . 	 " Whether we get back to .500 or not
column13: we got to really play well
column14: " Roenicke said . " There 's no doubt about it . We 've got to play really good baseball . " 	 Brewers tested his theory in the sixth . The results were good and could have been bad had Lohse not made key pitches . 	 Third baseman Jeff Bianchi helped Lohse . 	 Giancarlo Stanton drilled a pitch that headed down the line and looked like it was a sure hit . Bianchi lunged fully extended and snared the ball . He held it up for the ump to see that he had it . 	 Gomez made it difficult for Lohse when he muffed a fly ball that was ruled a double . 	 Logan Morrison hit a towering fly ball that Gomez tracked toward the wall in left center . The ball deflected off Gomez 's glove as he tried to make the catch . Marcell Ozuna flied out to Gomez to end the inning . 	 John Axford and Jim Henderson each pitched a scoreless inning before Francisco Rodriguez pitched the ninth for his 10th consecutive save . 	 Turner faced the Brewers for the second time this season . He took a no - decision in the Marlins ' 5 - 4 win on June 11 . 	 " I definitely did n't have my best stuff
column15: " Turner said . " No excuse for the home runs . Francisco
column16: I knew he got it . He 's got power to the opposite field . Gomez was an 0 - 2 terrible pitch . The put good swings on bad pitches . " 	 Lohse has had trouble keeping the ball in the park this season . The Arizona Diamondbacks hit three home runs in a 5 - 4 loss in his last start before the All - Star break . That pushed his total to an NL - leading 19 and a tie with Dan Haren of the Washington Nationals . Morrison came the closest to making it 20 in the fourth when he skied a pitch toward the right - field pole
column17: but the ball turned just in front of the pole . 	 Turner was done after hitting Rickie Weeks
column18: the first batter in the sixth . Ryan Webb came on and retired three batters . Turner went five innings
column19: gave up five hits
column20: walked four and struck out six . 	 " It was an uphill battle all night
column21: " Turner said . " Some days you have it
column22: some days you do n't . " 	 Ryan Braun returned to the starting lineup after coming off the bereavement list on Thursday . The Brewers left - fielder last played July 9
column23: a day after leaving the 15 - day disabled list with a sore right thumb . He missed a total of five games
column24: but not the continuing Biogenesis suspension rumors . 	 Braun went 0 - for-3 off Turner before being replaced by Logan Schafer in the top of the seventh . 	 " It feels like it has been awhile and it has been awhile
column25: " Braun said . " I have n't done a lot of baseball stuff over the last 10 days
column26: and I could tell . " 	 Game notes 	 The massive stage for Paul McCartney 's sold - out concert Tuesday evening at Miller Park left quite a footprint . There was a wide area of dead grass that stretched from the front of the warning track well into center field . Some of it had been re - sodded . Neither manager seemed concerned with the overall condition of the field . ... The Marlins reinstated reliever Chad Qualls ( 2 - 1
column27: 2.89 ERA
column28: 37 appearances ) from the paternity list . The team made room for the him by optioning LHP Duane Below to Triple - A New Orleans on July 14 . ... Turner had made eight starts coming into the game since being called up on May 31 from Triple - A New Orleans . His 2.34 ERA ranked seventh in the NL and ninth in majors . column1: MINNEAPOLIS -- That rough first half of the season for the Minnesota Twins is inescapable . 	 But they emerged from the All - Star break strong
column2: taking advantage of several Cleveland mistakes
column3: a bunch of highlight - reel plays by their defense and one of their liveliest crowds of the summer . 	 Joe Mauer 's two - out RBI single in the eighth inning lifted the Twins to a 3 - 2 victory on Friday to end the Indians ' winning streak at four . 	 Four Twins relievers combined for six strikeouts over 3 1/3 hitless innings
column4: including Casey Fien ( 2 - 2 ) in the eighth and All - Star Glen Perkins in the ninth for his 22nd save in 24 tries . 	 " Huge crowd out there
column5: which really picked up the guys

column9: but Mauer followed with his go - ahead single . Indians manager Terry Francona said he never considered intentionally walking Mauer
column10: though Smith was instructed to pitch carefully . Until he got ahead of the catcher with a 1 - 2 count . 	 " Then my approach changed . I was going for a punch out . I wanted to get out of the inning
column11: " Smith said . 	 Mauer stroked a single to center field . 	 " It was good that they pitched to Joe and gave him a chance
column12: " Perkins said . " So thanks for that . " 	 The Indians stayed 1 1/2 games behind first - place Detroit
column14: in the AL Central race . 	 The Twins have won three in a row after losing 16 of 18 . 	 " Baseball 's a funny game
column15: " Plouffe said . " Just when you think you 're out of it
column16: you can run off some wins and get right back in it . " 	 The Twins need a lot more of those . From manager Ron Gardenhire to cornerstone first baseman Justin Morneau
column17: many of them are more concerned about finishing the season here and being able to come back next year than focusing on a pennant chase . 	 In this third straight lost season for the Twins
column18: Morneau 's name is at the top of the could - be - traded list . 	 " It 's a place where I 'm happy and we 've won here
column19: which is always the goal . But it 's not up to me
column22: the 2006 AL MVP who 's in his 11th season
column23: all with Minnesota . 	 With two outs in the sixth inning
column24: after a two - out walk by Florimon
column25: Dozier hustled for second base when Chisenhall bobbled his bouncer for an error at third . Then Plouffe followed with a clean line drive that bounced in front of Drew Stubbs in right field
column26: driving in the two unearned runs with his team 's first solid hit of the night . 	 Kazmir walked three and struck out three . Indians starters
column27: who entered the night with the fourth - fewest innings in the league
column28: have n't taken a loss in their past nine games . They have a 2.14 ERA in that span with only two homers allowed and a .192 batting average against them . 	 But the bullpen and the defense were the problems

column31: a sliding grab from left fielder Clete Thomas and a slick play by second baseman Dozier to end the third with a jump to snag a line drive and a same - motion sidearm throw to Florimon to finish a double play . column32: and he dived to catch a bloop in shallow left field for the first out of the ninth for Perkins . 	 Pelfrey gave up a pair of deep doubles the inning before to Chisenhall and Michael Bourn
column33: whose drive drove in both runs . Pelfrey said his bullpen warmup was " terrible . " But he bounced back . 	 " I guess I found a way

column1: HOUSTON -- Seattle rookie Brad Miller waited 72 at - bats for his first major league homer . 	 The second one came much quicker . 	 Miller hit his first two major league homers on consecutive at - bats and drove in five runs as the Mariners overcame rookie Brandon Barnes ' cycle for the Astros in a 10 - 7 win over Houston on Friday night . 	 " I was obviously pumped after the first one
column3: " he said . " I was just trying to have another good at - bat and I was able to get another one . So it was fun . " 	 Miller
column4: who started the season in Double - A
column5: launched a two - run shot to the second deck in right field to chase starter Bud Norris ( 6 - 9 ) and make it 6 - 2 in the sixth . 	 " It felt pure
column6: and I kind of blacked out there for a little bit
column7: " he said . 	 He finished with three hits and added a three - run homer when he sent one to the first row in right field
column8: just beyond the grasp of a leaping Justin Maxwell
column9: in the eighth . 	 " I did n't see it originally off the bat and then I saw Maxwell turn . I 'm like : ' Gosh
column10: he 's like 7 - foot tall . He 's about to do something
column11: ' " Miller said of the 6 - foot-5 Maxwell . " He was sizing up the wall
column12: and I 'm like : ' Just go . ' And luckily it just got out of his reach . " 	 Manager Eric Wedge was impressed with the work of his rookie . 	 " He has some power
column13: " Wedge said . " He has considerable power talking about ball off the bat
column14: the way it jumps . He 's going to be a hitter first . He 'll hit a few home runs . " 	 Kyle Seager extended his major league - best hitting streak to 15 games with a two - run homer that gave Seattle a 2 - 1 lead in the second
column15: and Justin Smoak hit a solo home run in the ninth . 	 Barnes hit a solo homer in the second inning and had a run - scoring triple in the fourth . He singled in the sixth inning and completed the cycle with a sharp ground ball double down the right - field line in the eighth inning . 	 " That 's a great feat
column16: and it does n't happen in our game every day
column17: " Houston manager Bo Porter said . " To accomplish it in a big league game is pretty impressive
column18: and it could n't have happened to a better guy . " 	 He added a single in the ninth to finish 5 - for-5 and become the first Astro to collect five hits since Hunter Pence did it in May 2008 . 	 It was Seattle 's 23rd straight game with at least one homer to extend the team record . It is tied for the sixth - longest such streak in major league history dating to 1916 . 	 Mariners starter Joe Saunders ( 9 - 8) yielded nine hits and three runs with six strikeouts in 5 1/3 innings for his fourth straight win . Tom Wilhelmsen allowed two hits and a run in 1 1/3 innings for his 20th save . 	 Norris had a second straight tough start
column19: allowing six hits and six runs with four walks in 5 2/3 innings . He has allowed 17 hits and 13 runs in his past two starts . 	 Miller 's dazzling play was n't limited to offense Friday night . He also had a nice night on defense
column20: starting a nifty double play in the fourth inning by flipping a grounder hit by J.D. Martinez to second baseman Nick Franklin . Franklin barehanded the ball and threw it to first to complete the double play . 	 Barnes became the second player this season to hit for the cycle against the Mariners . Mike Trout of the Angels did it May 21 . 	 It is the eighth time an Astro has hit for the cycle and the first time since Luke Scott did it May 28
column22: against Arizona . 	 Barnes is the first right - handed hitter to accomplish the feat since Craig Biggio did it April 8
column24: at Colorado . Barnes pumped his fist after he beat the throw into second base on his double . 	 Saunders walked Maxwell with one out in the sixth before a single by Barnes . He was replaced by Yoervis Medina after Matt Dominguez drew a walk to load the bases . 	 Pinch hitter Brett Wallace grounded into a forceout that scored a run to cut the lead to 6 - 3 . 	 Wallace added a two - run homer in Houston 's three - run eighth inning . 	 Kendrys Morales singled to start the fourth inning . Seager gave Seattle a 2 - 1 lead with his shot to left field . Norris plunked Michael Saunders with one out before walking Mike Zunino . Dustin Ackley followed with a double that rolled into the left - field corner to score two and push the lead to 4 - 1 . 	 Houston 's Jason Castro hit his 26th double of the season in the first inning to pass Brad Ausmus for most doubles by a catcher in team history . Ausmus had 25 in 1997 . 	 Game notes 	 The series continues Saturday when Seattle 's Hisashi Iwakuma ( 8 - 4 ) opposes Erik Bedard ( 3 - 6 ) . ... Houston will recall RHP Jarred Cosart from Triple - A Oklahoma City on Tuesday to start against Oakland . The 23 - year - old took a no - hitter into the seventh inning and got the win
column25: allowing just two hits and no runs in eight - plus innings
column26: in his major league debut just before the break . He was optioned to Oklahoma City after the game but is scheduled to stay this time and be Houston 's fifth starter . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
column27: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
column28: Detroit added one of the most undervalued pitchers available this winter . 	 Joon Lee breaks down how Eduardo Rodriguez signing with Detroit affects the Tigers and Red Sox . 	 Check out some of the most electric moments from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. 's career . 	 Former Boston Red Sox left - hander Eduardo Rodriguez and the Detroit Tigers are in agreement on a five - year deal worth $ 77 million
column29: sources confirmed to ESPN . 	 From who we think deserves MVP and Cy Young to if the voters got it right

column1: ST . LOUIS -- Jake Westbrook did a little bit of everything Friday night against the San Diego Padres . 	 A career .116 hitter
column2: Westbrook recorded the first multihit game of his career with two singles and a double . He picked off a runner in the fifth inning . Perhaps most importantly
column3: the St. Louis starter lasted 6 1/3 innings and allowed just two runs
column4: eight hits and four walks in the Cardinals ' 9 - 6 victory . 	 " Overall
column6: " Westbrook said . " It was a good start to the second half . " 	 The right - hander
column7: who scored twice and had an RBI
column8: surpassed his hit output for the year and raised his batting from .100 to .217 . 	 " I ran into a few
column10: " Westbrook said . " It 's the first time I ran the bases that much since high school . " 	 Westbrook has usually resembled a pitcher who spent most of his career in the American League without swinging a bat . Westbrook came to the Cardinals after breaking in with the New York Yankees and then spending nine seasons in Cleveland . 	 St. Louis manager Mike Matheny appreciated the offensive outburst . 	 " The hits
column12: " Matheny said . " They started two rallies and a big RBI in another ( inning ) . 	 " These guys
column13: they take their at - bats seriously . They put a lot of pride in them . It 's frustrating to them . They do n't get enough repetitions to consistently be able to do what they want to do . They go working hard and some time it pays off like tonight . " 	 After rookie Carlos Martinez allowed three runs in the ninth to make it a three - run game
column14: All - Star Edward Mujica got the last two outs to record his 27th save in 29 chances . 	 Fellow All - Star Matt Carpenter continued his strong season with three hits and three RBIs . 	 " I 'm just trying to have good at - bats
column15: play good defense and do whatever I can to get on base
column16: " Carpenter said . 	 Two other St. Louis All - Stars
column17: Carlos Beltran and Yadier Molina
column18: each drove in two runs
column19: Beltran contributing two sacrifice flies and Molina a two - run double in the seventh . 	 St. Louis reached a season - best 22 games above .500 ( 58 - 36 ) and owns the best winning percentage in the majors ( .617 ) . 	 The Padres ' lone All - Star representative
column21: drove in two runs with a two - run single off Westbrook in the seventh . San Diego
column22: which lost 18 of 22 to conclude the first half
column23: fell to 15 - 32 on the road and 74 - 149 in St. Louis ( 6 - 19 at new Busch Stadium ) . 	 " We got 13 hits and we put some stress on them
column24: " manager Bud Black said . " We forced them to bring in their closer and we started hitting the ball with some authority . " 	 Former Cardinal Jason Marquis ( 9 - 5 ) lost his third straight . Marquis
column25: who has not won since beating Arizona 6 - 4 on June 15
column26: was touched for six runs on eight hits and three walks . 	 Marquis blanked the Cardinals the first two innings before Westbrook led off the third with a single to center . He later scored on Beltran 's sacrifice fly to center . 	 Two innings later
column27: Westbrook started another rally when he doubled over right fielder Will Venable 's head to begin the fifth . Carpenter followed with an RBI double to the gap in left center and he scored on Beltran 's sacrifice fly one out later that made it 3 - 0 . 	 The Cardinals broke it open and chased Marquis by scoring three times in the sixth . With the bases loaded and one out
column28: Westbrook coaxed a single through the middle to drive in Matt Adams . Carpenter then drove home two more with an RBI single to center . 	 Game notes 	 Edinson Volquez ( 6 - 8)

column1: DENVER -- A couple of bullpen sessions over the All - Star break helped Jeff Samardzija resolve the mechanical problems in his pitching delivery that had been bothering him much of the season . 	 The refinements were evident Friday night when Samardzija pitched effectively into the eighth inning
column2: and Anthony Rizzo doubled home the go - ahead run in the seventh in the Chicago Cubs ' 3 - 1 win over the Colorado Rockies . 	 " We changed a couple things with my mechanics
column3: kept me on line a little more
column4: " Samardzija said . " But if you had asked me all year how I felt about my mechanics
column5: I would say they were off
column8: I 'm really excited to stop making adjustments and really just working on pitch selection and pitch location . As a pitcher
column9: sometimes those things happen . It clicks for you
column10: and you go from there . " 	 Alfonso Soriano added a home run
column13: recalled by Chicago from Triple - A Iowa before the game
column14: had three hits in his major league debut
column15: including a double in his first career at - bat . Darwin Barney drove in an insurance run with a ninth - inning double . 	 Samardzija ( 6 - 9 ) kept the Rockies in check by limiting them to one run on four hits in 7 1/3 innings
column16: bouncing back after tying a career high by allowing nine runs in a 13 - 2 loss to the Los Angeles Angels on July 10 . 	 " Tonight
column17: the guy was nasty and dominated
column18: " Michael Cuddyer said . " You 've got to tip your hat every once in a while . He pitched really well . " 	 Samardzija was able to paint the corners with his fastball and kept the Rockies off balance with a devastating splitter . 	 " It was so good tonight
column19: " Cubs manager Dale Sveum said . " It was diving out of the strike zone so much you could n't even get swings at it sometimes . " 	 Samardzija walked three and struck out six
column20: including striking out the side in the seventh
column21: when he set down All - Stars Carlos Gonzalez
column22: Troy Tulowitzki and Cuddyer . 	 " I was working both sides of the plate with my fastball

column25: it makes your splitter that much better
column26: " he said . " Just being aggressive helped out a lot . " 	 Added Cuddyer : " He throws 96 mph with an 83 mph splitter that was on tonight . He did n't walk many guys until the very end . " 	 DJ LeMahieu doubled off Kevin Gregg to start the ninth and advanced to third on a groundout by Gonzalez . Tulowitzki walked before Gregg induced Cuddyer to ground into a game - ending double play for his 18th save in 20 chances . 	 Chicago regained the lead in the seventh
column27: sparked by Cody Ransom 's two - out walk off reliever Edgmer Escalona ( 1 - 3 ) . Rizzo followed by lining a double down the right - field line . column1: SAN FRANCISCO -- Chad Gaudin might just be pitching himself right into a permanent spot in the San Francisco starting rotation . 	 He certainly pitched the defending World Series champion Giants to an important victory to begin the season 's second half against the division - leading Arizona Diamondbacks
column2: striking out eight in seven scoreless innings to build on his impressive monthlong stretch with a 2 - 0 win Friday night . 	 " It 's huge
column3: " Gaudin said . " Any win in our division is huge . " 	 All - Star Buster Posey hit an RBI double
column4: and Hunter Pence added a run - scoring single as San Francisco started a key series to open the second half by pulling within 5 1/2 games of the D - backs in the NL West race . 	 Arizona starter Ian Kennedy ( 3 - 7 ) was denied career win No . 50 yet again in his eighth try . 	 In his past four starts
column5: Gaudin ( 4 - 1 ) has a 0.77 ERA and two earned runs in 23 1/3 innings . He has an 11 - inning scoreless streak . 	 " What a great job he did tonight
column7: " manager Bruce Bochy said . 	 Gaudin is unbeaten in seven starts since joining the rotation in early June to replace the injured Ryan Vogelsong -- and he is making for a tough decision by the Giants ' brass when Vogelsong is ready to return next month . 	 " Obviously I 'd like to start and enjoy starting
column9: so valuable for his versatility . 	 Not bad for a guy who signed a minor league deal with the Giants and had no guarantee of making the team out of spring training . 	 " I signed over here to do what I 'm doing now

column2: and Tampa Bay showed how important its bullpen has been to its recent success . 	 The right - hander got out of a bases loaded

column1: NEW YORK -- The rookie pitcher who got the biggest outs for the Mets on Saturday was not the one with all the hype . 	 Gonzalez Germen came in from the bullpen to bail out Zack Wheeler and help New York hold on for a 5 - 4 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies . 	 Marlon Byrd
column2: David Wright and Daniel Murphy each had an RBI single for the Mets
column3: who handed Cole Hamels his latest defeat and snapped Philadelphia 's seven - game winning streak at Citi Field . Another rookie
column5: had a run - scoring single among his three hits . 	 Germen ( 1 - 1 ) escaped a bases - loaded jam and struck out three in 1 2/3 hitless innings for his first major league win . 	 " He did an amazing job
column6: " Byrd said . " That could be a scary lineup to face when you 're a young kid . " 	 Jimmy Rollins hit a leadoff homer
column7: and Chase Utley had a two - run shot in the ninth for the Phillies . They put the potential tying run on second before Bobby Parnell retired Darin Ruf on a game - ending liner to second . 	 The series finale Sunday features a marquee matchup of All - Star pitchers : Mets ace Matt Harvey against lefty Cliff Lee . 	 Wheeler wiggled out of early trouble in his sixth major league start
column8: but the prized right - hander needed 106 pitches to get through 4 2/3 innings in 93 - degree heat . 	 " I just told him to hang in there . I just said
column10: you can only do it as best you can for as long as you can
column11: " Mets manager Terry Collins said . " You could just tell he was out of gas . Yeah
column12: I could have let him go one more hitter
column13: but we 're trying to win games
column14: too . " 	 Hamels ( 4 - 12 ) allowed three runs in a 35 - pitch first inning and was pulled for a pinch - hitter after five . The three - time All - Star and 2008 World Series MVP leads the NL in losses . 	 Hamels has always had trouble with the Mets . The left - hander
column15: who was 2 - 0 with a 1.57 ERA in three previous July starts
column16: dropped to 6 - 12 in 24 outings against them . 	 Coming off a gem in San Francisco but pitching for the first time in 10 days
column17: Wheeler gave up a two - strike single to Hamels to start the fifth . The Phillies loaded the bases with nobody out
column18: but all they managed was Utley 's sacrifice fly . 	 All - Star slugger Domonic Brown flied out on a 3 - 0 pitch . Wheeler walked Ruf to load the bases again -- and was lifted one out short of qualifying for a win . 	 Wheeler kept his back to Collins as the manager marched to the mound
column19: then handed over the ball and disappeared down the dugout runway . Collins followed moments later
column20: and Wheeler was back on the bench to greet Germen with a high - five after he struck out streaking Delmon Young to preserve a 3 - 2 lead . 	 " Right now
column22: " Young said . " He 's been pitching in big situations . " 	 Collins said he did n't want Wheeler to be trailing when he came out . In his only other outing at home
column23: the 23 - year - old was beaten by Washington 13 - 2 . 	 " That was definitely tough . I wanted to get through that inning
column24: " Wheeler said . " Not just for the win
column25: but just to get out of that jam so we did n't have to use the bullpen earlier than we had to . 	 " My pitch count was high
column26: and I guess Terry thought that was the right time to take me out . It worked out for us . " 	 Wright hit a run - scoring single in the fifth
column27: and Murphy added his RBI single in the seventh . LaTroy Hawkins worked the eighth
column28: and Parnell got three outs for his 18th save despite allowing Utley 's second homer in two days . 	 It was the first home run given up by Parnell since Aug. 4
column30: at San Diego . 	 Still struggling to command his lively pitches and get ahead
column31: Wheeler has however shown the ability to bear down in a jam . He held Philadelphia hitless in five at - bats with runners in scoring position
column32: leaving opponents 4 for 32 ( .125 ) in those situations during his brief big league career . 	 " I really concentrate . I really pride myself
column33: if guys are in scoring position
column34: that they 're not going to score
column35: " Wheeler said . 	 Rollins drove Wheeler 's third pitch to right for his 45th career leadoff homer
column36: breaking a tie with Brady Anderson for fourth place in major league history . 	 It was Rollins ' first home run in 162 at - bats since May 31 . He has a 16 - game hitting streak against the Mets . 	 New York came right back in the bottom of the first with the help of two walks by Hamels
column37: who issued one free pass over 23 innings in his previous three starts combined . Byrd lined a run - scoring single
column38: Lagares fisted an RBI single into shallow right
column39: and Anthony Recker knocked in another by beating out a double - play ball after third baseman Michael Young double - clutched . 	 " You ca n't always go out with your best stuff

column1: BOSTON -- Mariano Rivera has jogged from the right - field bullpen to the Fenway Park mound a number of times in his 18 - year career . He 's probably never been greeted like he was by the rival Red Sox fans on Saturday . 	 Rivera entered to a nice ovation and worked a scoreless ninth inning for his 31st save
column2: closing out a strong effort by New York 's pitchers that carried the Yankees to a 5 - 2 victory . 	 " I always love to pitch here
column4: " the 43 - year old Rivera said . " Yankee Stadium 's home
column5: but I love to come here . It 's a great atmosphere . We 've played big games here . It 's always good . " 	 Lyle Overbay and Brett Gardner each collected three hits and drove in a run to back Hiroki Kuroda 's seven strong innings . David Robertson worked a scoreless eighth
column7: the All - Star game MVP . 	 " That does n't surprise me
column8: " Overbay said of Rivera 's ovation . " He deserves it . I think everybody 's embracing what he 's done as a pitcher

column1: CHICAGO -- One day after being yanked from a game for not hustling
column2: Alex Rios busted out of his big slump in a big way . 	 Rios hit a grand slam
column3: drove in five runs and had three hits to lead the Chicago White Sox to a 10 - 6 victory over the Atlanta Braves on Saturday . 	 Rios had been in a 2 - for-20 slump before going 3 - for-5 . Rios
column4: who also ended a homerless drought of 120 at - bats
column5: insisted that his big day had nothing to do with being pulled from the game on Friday . 	 " I go about my business the same way every day
column6: " he said . " It does n't matter what happens the night before or whatever . I try to do the same things every day and I try to perform my best . 	 " I felt a little better today . I felt like I was seeing the ball better . When you see the ball better
column7: it 's because you 've done some mechanical adjustments . " 	 Rios and White Sox manager Robin Ventura disagreed on whether the benching was necessary
column8: but they were on the same page in believing it did n't have any carry - over effect . 	 " The other day he was 6 - for-6 and there was nothing going on there
column9: " Ventura said referring to Rios ' performance at Detroit on July 9 . " He 's just a good player and he had a good day . He came up at the right time . 	 " He hit a grand slam and had some big hits to help us win . I do n't think it had anything to do with last night . " 	 Either way
column10: Rios ' slam turned around what appeared to be another lackluster White Sox game into their 10th win in 32 games . 	 Jake Peavy ( 7 - 4 )
column11: making his first start since June 4 because of a fracture rib
column12: got off to a shaky start . He allowed a two - run homer to Dan Uggla in the second inning and two more runs in the third . But he shut down the Braves during his final three innings . 	 He allowed seven hits in six innings
column13: and just two of the four runs charged to him were earned . 	 " I probably came out of the gate a little too fast because I was excited
column14: " Peavy said . " I had a little extra adrenaline
column15: but the feel was n't there . I was able to pull the reins back a little toward the middle and get my feel back a little bit to where I was throwing the ball more consistently to where I wanted it . 	 " The boys picked me up today . The team came back and Alex got a big hit . It was a fun day . " 	 Braves starter Paul Maholm ( 9 - 9 ) was forced out in the fourth inning because of a sprained left wrist . He was staked to a 4 - 0 lead but could n't hold it . He allowed seven runs and seven hits in three - plus innings . 	 " It flared up on him in the fourth inning
column16: " Braves manager Fredi Gonzalez said of the injury . " He did it in Miami his last start when he was hitting . In the fourth it flared up on him a little bit and we did n't want to take any more chances . 	 " We got him out of there as soon as we saw something . " 	 The soft - tossing left - hander started struggling with his location after retiring six of the first seven batters he faced . 	 But the first five batters in the third inning got on
column17: capped by Rios ' grand slam that gave the White Sox a 5 - 4 lead . 	 Rios ' 12th homer of the season ended a power drought of 120 at - bats . 	 During the White Sox 6 - 4 loss to the Braves on Friday
column18: Rios hit what appeared to be a routine double - play grounder in the fifth inning . Braves shortstop Andrelton Simmons bobbled the ball
column19: and Rios likely would have beaten the throw to first
column20: but he did n't run hard out of the box . 	 Instead of a run scoring
column21: the White Sox were out of the inning . Ventura removed Rios in the seventh . 	 Before Saturday 's game
column22: Rios admitted he was wrong for not running hard . He said it was caused mostly by frustration
column23: and added that he wished Ventura had handled it differently . 	 " ( The message ) would have gone through better if he put me in his office and talked to me personally
column24: " he said . " If he wants to make a statement for the team
column25: it probably worked . " 	 On Saturday
column26: the Sox followed their five - run third with a four - run fourth to break the game open . 	 Chicago 's latest struggles are a reason both Rios and Peavy have been involved in rumors as the July 31 trade deadline approaches . 	 " With trade rumors

column1: CINCINNATI -- At the end of a very long day
column2: the Cincinnati Reds were fretting on their bench . How would starter Mat Latos describe the mood ? 	 " Anxiety
column5: Aroldis Chapman turned the anxiety into instantaneous joy . 	 Chapman escaped a two - on
column7: preserving a 5 - 4 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates that began with a long rain delay and ended with some overpowering pitching by the Reds ' All - Star closer . 	 " He has the kind of electric fastball where he can strike himself out of trouble
column8: " manager Dusty Baker said . " That 's not the first time he 's been in trouble . There 's been times he 's walked himself into trouble
column9: but he can strike himself out of trouble . 	 " There 's not a lot of guys who can do that . " 	 Joey Votto drove in a pair of runs
column10: and Shin - Soo Choo extended his hitting streak to a career - high 14 games
column11: helping the Reds score just enough . 	 The third - place Reds have won the first two games in the NL Central series
column12: closing their gap with second - place Pittsburgh to two games . The Ohio River rivals have split their 12 games this season . 	 Latos ( 9 - 3 ) and Pittsburgh 's A.J. Burnett ( 4 - 7 ) had a tough time finding their control after a 1 - hour
column13: 17 - minute delay in the middle of the first inning . 	 " It was a challenge
column14: " Latos said . " That 's something I 've never experienced before
column15: and I do n't want to do it again . " 	 Latos gave up three runs in only five innings . Travis Snider 's pinch - hit RBI double cut it to 5 - 4 in the eighth
column16: but Logan Ondrusek got Jose Tabata to ground out with the bases loaded
column17: ending the rally . 	 Chapman gave up an infield single by Andrew McCutchen to open the ninth and made a wild pickoff throw . Shortstop Zack Cozart misplayed Pedro Alvarez 's grounder for Cincinnati 's third error
column18: leaving runners on first and third . 	 The All - Star closer got a pop - up
column19: then fanned Michael McKenry and Jordy Mercer to end it
column20: earning his 23rd save in 26 chances . 	 " He was able to minimize the damage
column21: " catcher Devin Mesoraco said . " It was cool to see him go out and keep his cool and go after guys . It was definitely a fun thing to see . " 	 Choo had a double and a single
column22: extending the longest streak by a Reds player this season . 	 Thirteen minutes after the first pitch
column23: the umpires called for the tarp when a gust of wind blew through Great American Ball Park with Burnett warming up . Several members of the grounds crew were blown off their feet while wrestling the tarp into place . 	 Burnett had a rough time getting re - started
column24: allowing four runs right away . 	 " We all have our routines
column25: " Burnett said . " That was nowhere close to my routine . " 	 Three of the runs were set up by Mercer 's fielding error at second base . Votto got his 500th career RBI on the error
column26: Brandon Phillips singled home a run
column27: Cozart hit a sacrifice fly and Mesoraco doubled for a 4 - 0 lead . 	 " You do n't know what the layoff did to his routine
column28: " Mesoraco said . " I 'm not saying it was all luck
column29: but a couple of hits fell in
column30: too . " 	 Latos struck out to end the nine - batter inning -- an hour and a half after he 'd thrown his last pitch . Then
column31: just like Burnett
column32: Latos struggled to find his touch . Garrett Jones homered and Cozart 's errant throw at shortstop let in a run in the second . 	 McCutchen hit a solo homer in the fourth
column33: his third homer in his last four games . Eleven of his 12 homers have been solos . The Pirates have five homers in the first two games of the series
column34: all solo shots . 	 Burnett did n't allow another run until the sixth
column35: when he walked Votto with the bases loaded on his 109th and final pitch . 	 Cincinnati 's Jack Hannahan and Pittsburgh 's Starling Marte were hit by pitches
column36: making it 21 batters plunked during the teams ' season series . It 's the most for any season series in the majors . column1: WASHINGTON -- In a game long overdue for a clutch hit
column2: along came Hanley Ramirez with a man on second and none out in the 10th inning . 	 Ramirez already had two singles
column3: but the other team pitched to him anyway . He raised his average to .390 and essentially won the game with an RBI double
column4: the kind of clutch hit the Los Angeles Dodgers have been getting lately -- and the sort of thing that has totally deserted the Washington Nationals . 	 Ramirez drove in Adrian Gonzalez
column5: then scored on Andre Ethier 's sacrifice fly in Saturday night 's 3 - 1 win . Among the teammates congratulating Ramirez in the dugout was starter Zack Greinke
column6: who wondered why the Nationals bothered to throw the Dodgers cleanup hitter a strike . 	 " He said : ' Even me
column8: ' " Ramirez said . 	 As it turned out
column9: Ramirez and Greinke -- who raised his average to.406 -- combined for half the Dodgers ' 10 hits
column10: but everything seems to be going right for a team that has won seven of nine and 19 of 24 to pull within a half - game of the first - place Arizona Diamondbacks in the NL West . 	 " We 're winning all kinds of different ways as the momentum has started to go our way
column11: " manager Don Mattingly said . " We lost a lot of these early in the year
column12: but now it seems like we 're hanging in there
column13: feeling like we 're going to win these . " 	 Ethier won Friday 's game with a ninth - inning homer
column14: and the first two games of the series yielded outcomes that kept the teams trending in opposite directions . The Nationals have lost seven of nine to fall below .500 and into third in the NL East . They went 1 for 12 with runners in scoring position and are 2 for 21 with RISP in the series . 	 " I 'm sure everyone is sick of hearing it
column15: but it 's got to turn around at some point
column16: " Nationals shortstop Ian Desmond said . " And if it does n't
column17: then we 're going to keep on trying until we run out of time . " 	 In seven of the 10 innings
column18: the Nationals had legitimate scoring chances . They looked like a rock band that decided to play all of its worst hits on the same night . First inning : bases loaded
column19: none out . Second inning : leadoff double . Third inning : pair of one - out singles . Fourth inning : leadoff single . Seventh inning : first and second
column20: one out . Eighth inning : first and third
column21: one out . 	 They failed to score each time . In the fourth
column22: they managed three consecutive fielder 's choices . Even Greinke is mystified . 	 " They should be scoring more than they have
column23: " Greinke said . 	 Greinke allowed the only Nationals run on his final pitch
column24: when pinch - hitter Roger Bernadina hit an RBI single and was thrown out trying to advance to second
column25: ending the sixth inning . The run ended Greinke 's scoreless innings streak at 21
column26: a Dodgers season - high . 	 Jose Dominguez
column27: Paco Rodriguez
column28: Ronald Belisario
column29: J.P. Howell

column31: and Jansen handled the 10th for his 11th save as the Nationals fans

column35: who had won five consecutive starts

column2: Mo. -- Mike Moustakas was in a slump and Justin Verlander
column4: helped him snap out of it . 	 Salvador Perez drove in three runs and Moustakas went 3 for 4 with a game - winning home run to lead the Kansas City Royals to a 6 - 5 victory over the Detroit Tigers and Verlander . 	 Moustakas was hitless in 10 at - bats and in a 3 - for-20 slide . His home run to right in the fifth snapped a 5 - 5 tie
column5: while the three - hit game was his first since May 8 . 	 " There 's a great pitcher on the mound and he does n't make too many mistakes
column6: " Moustakas said . " I got a pitch I could handle and did n't miss it . " 	 Verlander ( 10 - 7 ) had not lost to the Royals since Sept. 9
column10: on eight hits and four walks in 5 2/3 innings . 	 " It was not good at all
column11: " Verlander said . " I walked guys and they scored runs . I was n't able to execute . I was just all over . I was n't in sync . I 've got to find it . I had three or four games before the All - Star break where I thought I had it back
column12: but I did n't feel in sync tonight . Hopefully I 'll get it back . " 	 It was the seventh time in 21 starts that Verlander failed to make it into the sixth inning . 	 " I would say over the course of the season up to this point
column13: and there 's still a lot of season left
column14: his performance has n't been quite as consistent as in the past
column15: " Tigers manager Jim Leyland said . " It 's just not what you expect of him
column16: which is a little unfair because of what you expect of him . " 	 Perez drove in a run in the first with a sacrifice fly and stroked a two - run double in the third . 	 Jeremy Guthrie ( 9 - 7 ) picked up the victory
column17: surrendering five runs on 10 hits and two walks in six innings . 	 " The bullpen won the game despite me trying to give it away
column18: " Guthrie said . 	 Aaron Crow
column19: the fourth of five Kansas City pitchers
column20: pitched out of danger in the eighth inning . Alex Avila led off with a single
column22: and pinch hitter Don Kelly walked . After Austin Jackson bunted them both over
column23: Crow retired Torii Hunter and Miguel Cabrera on ground balls to third base to strand them . 	 " I 'm trying to put everything behind me and they both hit balls right at Moose ( Moustakas )
column24: " Crow said . " I got the ball down on Cabrera and he hit it on the ground . You do n't want to walk him to load the bases with Prince ( Fielder ) on - deck . " 	 Hunter and Cabrera are a combined 0 for 14 off Crow . 	 " We were not going to give in to Cabrera
column25: " Royals manager Ned Yost said . " We 'd either walk him or make perfect pitches . Crow made the perfect pitches . " 	 Greg Holland worked the ninth to collect his 24th save in 26 chances
column26: although he yielded a one - out double to Victor Martinez off the right - field wall . 	 " Soon as he hit it
column27: I was praying it would stay in the park
column28: " Yost said . " I thought it had a chance to go out . I 'm just glad it did n't . " 	 Martinez stood at the plate for a couple of seconds to admire his work before taking off and just making it to second . 	 " I thought I had that ball and then I saw it go down
column29: " Martinez said . 	 Fielder and Martinez stroked RBI - singles in the first as the Tigers jumped out to a 2 - 0 lead . 	 The Royals seized a 5 - 3 lead in the fourth when Chris Getz drove in a run with a fielder 's choice grounder
column30: while Verlander walked Eric Hosmer with the bases loaded . 	 Avila drove in two runs with a two - out fifth inning single to tie the score at 5 - all . 	 Getz
column31: who was recalled Friday from Triple - A Omaha
column32: suffered a mild medial strain of his left knee in the fifth inning while trying to field Fielder 's smash grounder . He was replaced by Elliot Johnson . Yost said Getz is " not a DL ( disabled list ) situation
column33: more like a day - to - day situation . " 	 Game notes 	 Royals RHP Felipe Paulino
column34: who threw a 45 - pitch bullpen session

column36: who remains on the disabled list after having Tommy John surgery last year
column37: said the elbow is fine

column1: MILWAUKEE --   The last team in the major leagues to produce a shutout this season
column2: the Brewers now have seven in the team 's last 30 games . 	 Including two straight over Miami . 	 Yovani Gallardo and four relievers combined on a five hitter and Jonathan Lucroy and Rickie Weeks belted home runs in Milwaukee 's 6 - 0 victory over the Marlins on Saturday night
column3: extending Miami 's scoreless streak to 24 innings . 	 " Yovani had great command today . He was really efficient
column4: " Milwaukee manager Ron Roenicke said . " When we command the ball we 're tough to get a lot of runs off of and the relievers keep doing their jobs . " 	 Roenicke said he was confident his staff would come around during their 67 - game stretch to start the season without a shutout . 	 " Some of the guys we knew were going to pitch well eventually
column5: " he said . " We all knew that sooner or later ( Wily ) Peralta was going to put it together once he got his command . We knew ( Gallardo ) was going to pitch better . It 's good to see . 	 " Early in the season we were getting down by so many runs early . It was tough on the offense . It was tough to stay in a ball game . " 	 That the Brewers pitchers have faced the NL 's worst offensive team the past two games should n't diminish the accomplishments of his staff
column6: Roenicke said . 	 " I just know when we do n't pitch well everyone hits us hard
column7: " he said . 	 Gallardo ( 8 - 8) gave up five hits in 6 1/3 innings
column8: striking out five and walking two . 	 Lucroy collected four hits in four at - bats and finished a triple short of a cycle . 	 " He can really hit
column10: I know he did n't start off well . But we really believe this is a guy who can drive in runs and hit for average . " 	 Lucroy knew he 'd come around . 	 " It 's just a matter of putting the work in
column11: " he said . " I 'm trying to stay within myself and find an approach that works . I 'm pretty much keeping it simple . " 	 The Brewers continued their dominance at home against the Marlins
column12: having won 13 of the last 16 games at Miller Park
column13: dating to 2009 . 	 The Brewers got to Miami starter Nathan Eovaldi ( 2 - 1 ) for two runs in the first inning . Norichika Aoki and Jean Segura hit back - to - back singles to start the frame and Ryan Braun followed with a two - run double off the base of the center field wall . The Brewers loaded the bases later in the inning but failed to score . 	 The Brewers extended their lead to 3 - 0 in the third when Lucroy hit a home run that caromed off the heel of the glove of Marlins right fielder Giancarlo Stanton . 	 " Baseball is a crazy game
column14: " Lucroy said . " I told ( Stanton ) I owe him dinner when we play in Miami next year . " 	 Stanton was frustrated by his failure to make the catch . 	 " Little things like that hurt us . It would n't have been a homer
column15: " he said . 	 Weeks led off the fourth inning with a homer to center field . Jeff Bianchi followed with a double and later scored on Aoki 's single
column16: giving the Brewers a 5 - 0 advantage . Lucroy 's double drove in another run
column17: as the Brewers sent eight batters to the plate in the inning . 	 Eovaldi surrendered 10 hits and six runs in four innings . He struck out five and walked two . Miami 's bullpen held Milwaukee scoreless over the final four innings . 	 " Most of the counts
column18: I was behind and the ball was up in the zone . It 's frustrating . It 's tough to pitch like that
column19: " Eovaldi said . 	 Lack of control hurt Eovaldi
column20: Miami manager Mike Redmond said . 	 " He struggled with his command
column21: he was up in the zone with his fastball
column22: and they hit him pretty good
column23: " Redmond said . 	 The Marlins ' loaded the bases in the sixth inning with one out
column24: but Logan Morrison grounded into an inning - ending double play . 	 " I thought we came out flat these first two games
column25: especially offensively
column26: " Redmond said . " We 're getting completely shut down . We 're not getting guys on base and we 're not getting big hits . " 	 Game notes 	  As part of a Negro Leagues tribute
column27: the Brewers wore reproduction uniforms of the Milwaukee Bears
column28: the city 's 1923 representative in the Negro National League . The Marlins donned uniforms of the Minor League Miami Marlins
column29: who were a Triple - A franchise in the International League . The Miami uniforms featured a patch commemorating Hall of Fame pitcher Satchel Paige
column30: who played in the Negro Leagues from 1926 - 47 and once played for the Marlins . .The Brewers honored former Negro Leagues players George " Jo - Jo " Altman and Lonnie " Showboat " Harris in a pregame ceremony . .With a third - inning single
column31: Miami SS Adeiny Hechavarria has a hit in 14 of his last 15 games . . In a 30 - minute first inning
column32: Gallardo threw 25 pitches and Eovaldi totaled 32 . 	 The Braves added depth at catcher by signing Manny Pina to a two - year

column1: MINNEAPOLIS -- After cruising through Cleveland 's lineup for much of the evening
column2: Kevin Correia finally made a mistake . With speedy Michael Bourn on base in the sixth
column3: Correia " got a little quick " and left a pitch up in the strike zone for Jason Kipnis . 	 Kipnis crushed it into the left - field seats to give Cleveland a 2 - 0 lead . 	 " I feel like that 's how the last two months have gone
column4: " Correia said . 	 But what happened next sure was n't . The Twins responded with three runs in the bottom half
column5: Correia ( 7 - 6 ) won a start for the first time in a month and Minnesota beat the Indians 3 - 2 for its fourth - straight win . 	 " I feel like it was a flashback to like
column7: " Correia said . " I feel like if I would stop doing that
column8: I would have 15 wins right now . " 	 Not quite that dramatic
column9: but Correia has left with his team leading only once in the last nine games . He 's allowed homers in his last three starts . Still
column10: he looked sharp for most of the night against the Indians . He allowed only three hits with one walk and three strikeouts . 	 Joe Mauer and Justin Morneau each had two hits and a walk
column11: and the Twins offense took advantage of two costly infield mistakes by the Indians in the sixth to take the lead for good . 	 " When you 're getting four or five hits
column12: you 've got to play a clean game
column13: " Indians manager Terry Francona said . 	 The Indians failed to gain ground on Detroit
column14: which maintained a 1 1/2 - game lead in the AL Central . Corey Kluber put Cleveland in good position to close the gap with five shutout innings before leaving the game with tightness in his left hip in the sixth . Afterward
column15: Kluber said the pain had been constant throughout the game . 	 " I was a little off to start the game
column16: whether it was that or something else
column17: I 'm not sure
column18: " he said . " Obviously
column19: I would have liked to have gone more than five innings
column20: but they wanted me to get out of there before it got to a point where I hurt myself . " 	 The Indians have lost two straight after heading into the All - Star break with a four - game winning streak . 	 " It 's still late July
column22: " Kipnis said . " We 're not losing too much ground
column23: thankfully . But if we want to get where we want to be
column24: we 're going to have to start winning games
column25: and these are games that we need to be winning . " 	 Cleveland 's lineup sputtered against Correia early
column26: failing to reach base in the first three innings . Kluber was just as good
column27: though
column28: not allowing a run for the second - consecutive start . Minnesota had base runners in each of the first three innings against Kluber
column29: but he did n't allow any of them past second . 	 Things turned in Minnesota 's favor when Rich Hill ( 1 - 2 ) came out for the sixth instead of Kluber

column1: HOUSTON -- The Seattle Mariners only managed one hit against Houston on Saturday night . That big swing by Michael Saunders was all they needed to put away the last - place Astros . 	 Saunders got Seattle 's only hit with a two - run double with two outs in the seventh inning to lift the Mariners to a 4 - 2 victory . 	 Erik Bedard ( 3 - 7 ) pitched 6 1/3 innings of no - hit ball before he was replaced by Jose Cisnero
column2: who walked Mike Zunino with two outs before the double by Saunders put Seattle ahead 4 - 2 . 	 The long fly ball sailed just out of reach of sprinting center fielder Brandon Barnes and landed at the top of Tal 's Hill in straightaway center . 	 " That was the longest double I 've ever had
column3: " Saunders said . " I definitely put a good swing on it . I guess if the hill is n't out there
column4: maybe he runs it down . Or if the hill is n't out there
column5: maybe it 's a home run . I do n't know . But it fell
column6: we won and that 's all that matters . " 	 Bedard had thrown 109 pitches when he left the game . Houston manager Bo Porter gave him the option of staying in

column8: " Bedard said . " I 'm not going over 110 ( pitches ) . I 'd rather pitch a couple more years than face another batter . " 	 The Mariners
column9: who extended their season - high winning streak to five games
column10: tied it in a wacky sixth inning by scoring two runs thanks to a combination of passed balls

column13: " Porter said . " But it 's crystal clear how we ended up on the losing side of it . When you walk ( six ) guys and all four of their runs that score are via the walk
